Many research studies include weight and height as primary outcomes. Although having trained personnel conduct direct measurements of body weight and height using research quality equipment and standardized techniques is considered the “gold standard” in research, financial and/or logistical considerations  frequently preclude the application of this gold standard. This can be a problem for the many research studies that use weight and height or Body Mass Index  as primary outcomes.
Recognition of the morbidity and premature mortality associated with mental disorders has prompted attempts to increase access to treatment and opportunities for early detection among children . Integration of mental health  with primary care offers the possibility of addressing MH concerns, in conjunction with associated developmental and medical issues, in a setting that is less stigmatized and more accessible to families . Although MH issues commonly present in primary care, primary care providers  typically receive limited training in their diagnosis and treatment .
Saphenous vein grafts have been established as the gold standard conduit for lower extremity bypass grafting . Conventionally, the great saphenous vein  is typically harvested via a long continuous or “skip” incisions that may extend from the groin to the ankle, before its use as an arterial conduit. This approach however is associated with significant morbidities including surgical site infections, ischemic skin flaps, fat necrosis, lymph leak, increased postoperative pain and longer hospital stay for as many as 24% to 43% of patients  .
Detection of BMB is improved by new, high resolution, 3D GRE T2* and susceptibility weighted imaging . At 1.5T, the SWI sequence was found to be fourfold more sensitive for detection of traumatic BMB than conventional GRE T2* and recent data in mild cognitive impairment subjects indicates again at least a fourfold increase in BMB recognition by SWI compared to conventional GRE T2* imaging  . CAA is comorbid with Alzheimer’s disease  in as many as 95% of AD cases .
Neutrophils, through their ability to be rapidly recruited to tissues and deploy adiverse array of antimicrobial effector mechanisms, are essential for the clearance of manybacterial pathogens. This commences with immune ‘sensing’ ofpathogens by tissue resident cells followed by activation of the vascular endothelium andneutrophil extravasation from the bloodstream, and finally initiation of neutrophilantimicrobial functions,  . The first of these istethering and rolling on the vascular endothelium, which is mediated by P selectinglycoprotein ligand 1  or VLA 4  on the neutrophiland E  and P selectin or VCAM 1  on theendothelium.

Moreover, p38 mediates UV induced apoptosis by activating p53, through direct phosphorylation of functionally important residues , and stabilization of the p53 protein . A p38 downstream kinase MAPKAPK2  may also contribute to the inactivation of Cdc25B and Cdc25C and DNA damage induced cell cycle arrest .

Organisms ranging from bacteria to humans control the formation of protein disulfides in the cytosol through the action of the glutathione and thioredoxin redox systems, . Similarly, thioredoxin  reduces protein disulfides, in a reaction that produces oxidized thioredoxin .
Even in the Protein Data Bank , which is highly selective for structured proteins, only approximately 30% of crystal structures are completely devoid of disorder, with the remaining structures exhibiting IDRs of various lengths. For example, more than 70% of signaling proteins have long disordered regions  and approximately 60% of human transcription factors have long disorder regions . The abundance of polar and charged residues makes IDPs and IDRs much more flexible.
Cancer treatments lead to a number of side effects in older adults including cancer related fatigue and global side effect burden . High levels of cancer related fatigue and global side effect burden lead to functional decline . Although side effects can be detrimental to the physical and psychological functioning of all cancer survivors, older cancer survivors, due to additional age related declines, may have more difficulty recovering from treatment related side effects .
Infection with the parasite Trypanosoma cruzi causes Chagas disease. The important manifestations of clinical Chagas disease are acute myocarditis and chronic dilated cardiomyopathy. , We and others have shown that mice infected with T. cruzi develop many of the structural and functional alterations observed in the human disease.

ERK1/2, a threonine/tyrosine kinase, is one major target of MAPK kinase 1/2 , while AKT1 and p38 MAPK, two serine/threonine kinases, are primarily activated by PI3K and MAPK kinase 3/6 , respectively.
It is essential as the population ages, that treatments that target the cause of this disease be developed. One promising approach are anti amyloid therapies, based on the hypothesis that increased amyloid beta  deposits in the brain is a major underlying cause of the pathology of AD . There is significant genetic support for this hypothesis: mutations in the amyloid precursor protein  gene, lying in or near the Aβ peptide region, lead to early onset AD, perhaps the strongest evidence for the amyloid cascade hypothesis .
Among the known nucleic acid reaction products resulting from inflammation mediated reactive species are oxidized and halogenated DNA bases, including 5 chlorouracil  . Of the halogenated uracils, ClU is arguably the most likely product of inflammation mediated damage. Although ClU is perhaps the most likely halogenated base to form in mammalian tissues, little is currently known about the biological impact of this damaged base .
Early research indicated that expression of MHC class II  was restricted to particular APC subsets including professional APCs or dendritic cells, monocytes, macrophages and B lymphocytes. In the skin a number of APC subsets expressing MHC II have been identified, including the well characterised Langerhans cells of the epidermis  and the dermal APCs . We recently reported that three APC subsets exist in the healthy human dermis, CD1a+ and CD14+ dermal APC and migratory Langerhans cells .
We have reported that the A280V mutation in the glycerol 3 phosphate dehydrogenase 1 like  causes BrS by reducing INa. Other mutations in GPD1 L have also been linked to reduced INa and sudden infant death syndrome . Therefore, we investigated whether the cardiac Nav1.5 channel might be modulated by alterations in NAD and whether these changes might explain the effects of GPD1 L mutations on INa .
Inhalational anesthetics produce various clinically important actions, including hypnosis, amnesia and immobility . Although the precise substrates for immobilizing actions are not known with certainty, it is nevertheless clear that anesthetics cause a depression of motor output that is general and profound . Despite widespread inhibition of motor function observed at immobilizing anesthetic concentrations, it is interesting  that the respiratory motor system remains operational under those same conditions.
The Southwest United States, including Arizona and New Mexico, has a diverse climate  and is home to many different avian species . Despite the importance of the Southwest for avian migration, there remains uncertainty about its relationship to the diffusion of avian influenza viruses . Phylogeography is a field that uses sequence data to model geographic diffusion and genetic diversity over time .
Gastric hydrochloric acid  is a noxious stimulus that following penetration through the mucosal barrier contributes to pain arising from the oesophagus, stomach and upper small intestine. Exposure of the rodent stomach to excess HCl elicits a visceromotor response indicative of pain  and causes many neurons in the nucleus tractus solitarii  of the brainstem to express c Fos, a marker of neuronal excitation . Both the gastric HCl evoked visceromotor reaction and medullary c Fos response are suppressed by vagotomy, which attests to a significant role of vagal afferent neurons in gastric chemonociception  .
Bipolar disorder  is a prevalent, severe, and highly disabling psychiatric disease characterized by recurrent depressive and manic episodes, and is associated with increased morbidity and mortality due to general medical conditions, such as obesity, diabetes and cardio disease  . BD has multiple risk alleles consistent with a polygenic inheritance , but its pathological mechanisms are not agreed on. Studies showing increased brain levels of pro inflammatory cytokines and increased glutamatergic function suggest roles for excitotoxicity and neuroinflammation in the disease  .
, Both human and animal studies have shown onset of hypertension because of loss of nitric oxide, which acts as the endothelium derived relaxing factor. Nitric oxide is catalyzed by endothelial nitric oxide synthase , an enzyme with multiple genetic variants that might confer risk for hypertension. However, inconsistent findings on the relationship between NOS3 polymorphisms and hypertension have been observed in earlier studies, with significant associations reported from Japan and Singapore, but no associations observed in China and Australia.

However, one concern with these models is that the epithelium is columnar  which is different than human stratified squamous epithelium. Consequently NHP are believed to be suitable for the evaluation of microbicide safety ; however, NHP are expensive and there are limited numbers available.
Human and mouse studies have proven that high levels of cholesterol rich remnants cause atherosclerosis, but the relevance of triglyceride rich lipoproteins  to atherogenesis remains controversial. In part, this controversy stems from the fact that elevated levels of TRLs and remnants often coexist . Humans with chylomicronemia have severe hypertriglyceridemia but low levels of cholesterol rich remnants.
Sonoporation has shown promise to facilitate intracellular transport of drugs, proteins, genes, and other therapeutic agents that are otherwise impermeable to the cell . Because ultrasound exposure can be non invasively controlled in application volume and location as well as exposure duration, sonoporation is uniquely suitable for in vivo site specific delivery . However, even with recent progress in the field, a detailed mechanistic description of sonoporation and its full range of bioeffects remains to be elucidated  .

The design of the study included monitoring of post TMS EEG activity at the prefrontal site, and immediately after rTMS session provide gamma activity feedback training with the goal of instrumentally condition post TMS gamma activity changes. We proposed that neurofeedback based operant conditioning of prefrontal EEG activity immediately post rTMS sessions will result in more pronounced improvements of functional outcomes as compared control waitlist group of children with ASD, as we hypothesized that rTMS over the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex  improves I/E ratio and enhances gamma activity.
The population of the United States  is aging rapidly. The number of adults in the U.S. age 65 or older will more than double to approximately 71 million by 2030 . Approximately 80% of older adults have at least one chronic disease and the numbers of elders living in the community with serious, eventually fatal chronic conditions has increased dramatically over the last decade placing tremendous strain on family members .

In health, the mucosal immune system is geared towards tolerance and limits inflammatory responses to these antigens. In genetically predisposed individuals, when tolerance to commensal bacteria is lost, chronic inflammatory bowel disease  may develop.
In humans, adolescence is usually defined as the second decade of life , with females showing more rapid maturation than males . It is still not clear, however, whether human adolescents differ from their adult counterparts in terms of how they behaviorally and hormonally respond to stressors and whether the adverse consequences of stress exposure would more profoundly impact the development of anxiety disorders during adolescence than during adulthood. Similarities found between human adolescents and adolescents of various mammalian species in terms of developmental history, behavioral changes, as well as neural and hormonal responses provide sufficient face and construct validity to support the use of animal models to explore certain basic features of adolescence  .
In vivo bioluminescence imaging  uses luciferase enzymes  as reporters to generate light emission during the catalytic oxidation of their substrates for non invasive imaging of biological targets and processes in intact cells and living animals . Herein, we report the design of luminogenic probes based on D aminoluciferin for imaging furin activity in breast cancer cells in vivo . Furin, one of the seven endoproteases that belong to the proprotein convertases family, is ubiquitously expressed in mammalian cells processing and activating a wide variety of proprotein substrates .
When studying patient impairments in cognitive function, it is important to distinguish between global performance deficits and selective alterations in particular processes putatively related to underlying neural mechanisms. Notably, several reinforcement learning studies have reported that patients with SZ exhibit selective deficits in learning from probabilistic rewards/gains, and not punishments/losses . These tasks were chosen to assess biases in learning and decision making processes that arise in healthy individuals—biases that are thought to reflect the signatures of striatal function or prefrontalstriatal communication.
CA1 hippocampal pyramidal neurons are selectively vulnerable to global cerebral ischemia . IPC activates several endogenous signaling pathways that result in protection against ischemia. Using the selective peptide activator ψεRACK, preconditioning with direct activation of εPKC  confers neuroprotection after 48 h with an efficacy similar to IPC .
Profound neurogenesis occurs in restricted areas of the adult mammalian brain under physiological conditions . In the olfactory system, central neurogenesis provides subventricular zone derived interneurons to the OB . OSN axons form the olfactory nerve, coalesce into fascicles from OSNs expressing the same odor receptor, and converge into topographically defined glomeruli, in the OB .
An increased risk of myocardial infarction  in HIV infected patients was described in 2007 by Triant et al. . In this large cohort, the relative risk of MI was 1.4 fold greater in men with HIV and 3.0 fold greater in women with HIV. HIV infection is associated with known cardiovascular risk factors such as increased total cholesterol, decreased HDL cholesterol, lipodystrophy and the metabolic syndrome .
Ca2+ mediated signaling regulates diverse aspects of cellular functions in bacteria, plants, fungi and animals . In order to fit the specific physiological requirements of each cell type, a specific set of proteins are selectively employed from a large repertoire of Ca2+ signaling molecules. It had been generally believed that many ion channels and transporters in the animal Ca2+ signaling machinery were animal specific and were developed in ancient multicellular animals  .
Therefore, it is necessary to integrate how life history traits are expressed across environments  and standing levels of genetic variation in fitness components  with patterns of demographic and environmental variability . In particular, we need to understand the number and kind of genes responsible for life history differences, how coordinated groups of genes are expressed at different life cycle stages, and how environmental effects on genes influence internal and external buffering and genotype by environment  interactions  . Currently, large gaps remain in our understanding of how genomic expression throughout the life cycle is influenced by relevant ecological variables.
The ErbB family of receptor tyrosine kinases includes EGFR, ErbB2 , ErbB3 , and ErbB4 . Over the past ten years, it has become evident that many epithelial cancers require EGFR or HER2 signaling for their growth and survival. Inhibitors of EGFR and HER2 come in the form of small molecule tyrosine kinase inhibitors  and targeted antibodies .
Given that anxiety disorders are among the most common psychiatric disorders , treatment interventions aimed at increasing treatment attendance could benefit a substantial number of patients . Despite well documented problems with treatment refusal and dropout, surprisingly little empirical work has focused on methods of increasing treatment attendance among patients with anxiety disorders. For instance, motivation to change anxiety related behaviors appears to be a significant predictor of reduction of anxiety symptoms among patients with panic disorder  and generalized anxiety disorder .
Muscle pain can result from repetitive or eccentric activity, and may persist for days  or weeks  after exposure to these activities . While the underlying cellular mechanisms in these pain syndromes are not well understood, inflammatory cytokines, which sensitize high threshold mechano sensitive muscle afferents  are likely to be involved . For example, following eccentric exercise in humans  and in a repetitive motion induced muscle pain model in the rat , levels of inflammatory cytokines are increased in the exercised limb .
TFPI suppresses factor Xa generation by binding via its Kunitz 1 domain to the TF:FVIIa catalytic complex and via its Kunitz 2 domain to factor Xa. Additionally, TFPI also has been shown to regulate coagulation by inducing the internalization and degradation of TF:VIIa complex on cell surfaces. Lipoprotein associated TFPI has been shown to have less anticoagulant activity than free TFPI.

Wood also contains nitrogen, mainly in the form of cell wall proteins but also in various extractives. A 15N labelling experiment in Pinus ponderosa found that most labelled nitrogen was deposited in wood produced the year after the label application, but some nitrogen was translocated to annual rings produced a few years before and after that .
Endothelin 1  is the predominant isoform of three distinct isopeptides constitutively secreted by endothelial and other vascular cells, and the most potent endogenous vasoconstrictor known . The renal artery is particularly sensitive to ET 1 , and an increase in renal artery tone may lead to reduced kidney perfusion and subsequent activation of the renin angiotensin system, which contributes to ET 1 dependent regulation of basal vasomotor tone and blood pressure . Indeed, ET 1 contributes to vascular stiffening and calcification with aging, which are all major independent cardiovascular risk factors and associated with cardiovascular complications such as myocardial infarction, stroke, and renal injury  .
Cancer development has been known to share many molecular frameworks with embryonic development, tissue renewal and differentiation . In contrast, during tumor development Notch is constitutively activated and its sustained activation could be a result of genetic or epigenetic alterations. Notch3 gene amplification correlated with gene overexpression and pathway activation in ovarian serous carcinoma tissues.
Type 1 diabetes is mainly caused by autoimmune destruction of the pancreatic insulin producing β islet cells of Langerhans . The peak age for T1D onset occurs earlier in girls  than boys . However, after age 25, the male to female T1D incidence ratio is approximately 1.5 .
In a process termed as “negative selection”, DP thymocytes which express rearranged receptors that recognize peptides derived from self antigens bound to self MHC, are deleted . Examination of the expression of luciferase activity in thymocytes from these mice revealed significant NF κB activation in DN cells undergoing β selection, and in CD8 SP thymocytes. Further characterization indicated that NF κB is activated in DN cells in response to signaling from the pre T cell receptor acts as an anti apoptotic factor that helps provide a survival advantage to β selected cells.
Integrative large scale gene expression analysis of 200 GBM tumors revealed 4 subtypes: proneural, neural, classical and mesenchymal . Heterogeneity in GBM tumors may be responsible for differential response to therapeutic interventions , and understanding the etiology of tumor heterogeneity in animal models may become increasingly important to design therapeutic strategies effective at targeting molecularly defined tumor subtypes . For example, GEMs harboring mutations found in human gliomas have been used to assess tumorigenic effects of individual genes and mutations and to reveal the tumor cell of origin in some models .
The relationship of interpersonal and personality characteristics to complicated grief and depression following loss has been infrequently examined. There has been little investigation of whether personality variables  or the quality of the relationship between the bereaved and deceased  may play a role in the development of complicated grief or depression, particularly among young adults. High levels of dependency in combination with interpersonal conflict or loss are also associated with depression  .
Mast cells play an important role in many immunological and inflammatory reactions. They are, however, best known as the critical cell in allergic inflammation during which they release an array of inflammatory mediators. The activation of mast cells for release of these mediators in allergic reactions depends on IgE and its high affinity receptor FcεRI present on the surface of these cells.
Over three fourths of the population with heart failure  is aged 65 years and older, and the proportion of older HF patients is projected to increase as more adults are surviving into old age. Indeed, older HF patients have greater hospitalization rates, health care expenditures, and mortality  as well as symptoms of exercise intolerance that are often more severe than in younger HF patients. It has been hypothesized that aging related increases in comorbidities lead to worse exercise capacity, symptoms, and quality of life in older HF patients.
The MA protein is comprised of 132 amino acids and makes up the N terminal subunit of the Gag polyprotein . Several studies refute the role of MA in the early steps of replication and show that mutation of the nuclear localization signals has no consequence on nuclear import of viral DNA . The MA domain targets the Gag and Gag Pol polyproteins to the plasma membrane and mediates incorporation of the viral envelope protein .
Furthermore, some studies  indicate that voltage gated Ca2+ channels are also affected by volatile general anesthetics at concentrations that occur under clinical conditions. On the basis of the membrane potential at which they activate, these channels are subdivided into high voltage activated  and low voltage activated , or transient  Ca2+ channels. Pharmacological and physiological experiments support the existence of multiple types of native HVA Ca2+ channels .
Tocomin® represents commercially available mixture of naturally occurring tocotrienols  and tocopherol  extracted from palm oil/palm fruits that possess powerful antioxidant, anticancer, neuro/cardioprotective and cholesterol lowering properties. Cellular autophagy represents a defense mechanism against oxidative stress and several anticancer compounds. Recently, we reported that tocotrienols induce apoptosis and endoplasmic reticulum stress in breast cancer cells .
Craniosynostosis is defined as the premature fusion of one or more cranial sutures and is a common malformation  occurring in all ethnic groups . Craniosynostosis of the sagittal suture is the most common form of craniosynostosis, accounting for 5560% of all craniosynostoses . Although environmental and genetic risk factors for craniosynostosis have been identified, no single risk factor has emerged as being necessary or sufficient to cause premature fusion of any of the calvarial sutures.

The amino acid sequence of p7 is shown in ; also shown are the sequences of two truncated constructs that have also been expressed and purified.
Heterotaxy patients are often described as being “bilateral left sided”  or “bilateral right sided” . Cardiac conduction system  abnormalities in the human heterotaxy population are thought to arise from either duplication or absence of one or more CCS elements resulting from similar left right patterning abnormalities. Heterotaxy syndrome itself is a risk factor for increased mortality  .
Modic changes  are signal variations of the vertebral endplate and the adjacent subchondral vertebral marrow seen on magnetic resonance images  . According to the patterns of signal changes on T1  and T2 weighted images, traditionally MCs have been classified into three types . While type 2 MCs demonstrate increased signal intensity on both T1  and T2 weighted images, type 3 MCs reflect decreased signal intensity on both T1  and T2 weighted images.
Chromosomal deletion is a hallmark of tumor suppressor genes, because it can reveal recessive mutations, cause haploinsufficiency, or truncate/abolish a gene through loss of heterozygosity , heterozygous deletion or homozygous deletion . Deletion of part or all of chromosome 6, often involving 6q14 q27, is the second most frequent genetic alteration in different types of cancers including breast cancer . Deletion at 6q in breast cancer has been detected by different approaches including cytogenetic analysis , fluorescence in situ hybridization  , comparative genomic hybridization  , and LOH study .
Aortic root dilation leading to aortic dissection has been associated with numerous connective tissue disorders such as Marfan syndrome , EhlersDanlos syndrome  and LoeysDietz syndrome  . Other patients at risk include those with valvular abnormalities such as bicuspid aortic valve  and various genetic syndromes such as Turner syndrome, 18q deletion syndrome, and fragile X syndrome . Identifying patients with aortic root dilation in these at risk groups of patients is important as progressive dilation can lead to aortic dissection and death if left untreated .
G EAT lesions are characterized by infiltration of inflammatory cells and destruction of thyroid follicles . Thyroid lesions reach maximal severity 20 days after cell transfer, and inflammation resolves or progresses to fibrosis by day 60 depending on the extent of thyroid damage at day 20 . CD4+ T cells are the primary effector cells for G EAT  and CD8+ T cells are important for G EAT resolution  .
Childhood asthma causes considerable morbidity, interference with normal daily activities, and a burden for the health care systems and for the whole family, especially during periods when it is inadequately controlled . Over the past decade, the concept of asthma control as the degree to which manifestations of the disease are reduced or removed by therapy has been clearly defined and has been incorporated into current asthma guidelines . Asthma control has been considered a key therapeutic goal and an outcome measure in clinical research studies, and its regular assessment has been recommended as a guide to a stepwise  approach to asthma therapy  .
Conventional chemotherapeutic regimens involve high doses of a cytotoxic agent followed by a 3  to 4 week rest period. However, recent studies using this approach have demonstrated a rapid acquisition of chemoresistance in certain patient populations after an initial response . Furthermore, conventional chemotherapy drugs have been associated with many toxic adverse effects that often impair quality of life and limit continuation of therapy  .
For nearly 50 years the rate of progression of COPD has been defined by the slope of the annual decline in FEV1 determined from serial measurements of FEV1 obtained over a span of years in the course of observational or intervention studies. In intervention trials conducted over the last few decades, this slope has been determined mainly from serial measurements of the post , rather than the pre , bronchodilator FEV1 . The rationale for the latter practice appears to derive from the assumption that there may be less variability in the post  than the pre bronchodilator measurement and that the post bronchodilator value would be less influenced by noncompliance with instructions to withhold bronchodilator medication during the washout period prior to scheduled spirometric testing.
Malaria continues to impose a substantial health burden across the globe. Functional studies have demonstrated that a host erythrocyte G protein signal pathway may be a critical component in parasite invasion and, thus, presents a potential target for disease intervention. Harrison and colleagues demonstrated that successful in vitro erythrocyte invasion by P.falciparum requires activation of the host stimulatory G protein  signal transduction pathway mediated by the beta 2 adrenergic receptor   .
The tolloids and BMP 1 contain a conserved metalloproteinase domain not found in BMPs 27 which are classed as transforming growth factor β  superfamily members . Recent studies suggest that growth factors activated during development may be induced later in adults during regulation of neuronal plasticity mechanisms  and members of the tolloid/BMP 1 family are implicated. An elevated number of hippocampal neurons expressing mammalian tolloid like 1  mRNA in mice was related to conditions that increase neurogenesis, such as access to running wheels .
Rather, the advantage of being able to form, and successfully cope with, increasingly complex social systems may represent a key factor driving the evolution of mammalian brains . Hence, being able to efficiently process socially relevant information is an optimal adaptation to complex social systems. Assessing facial trustworthiness is decisive because trusting an untrustworthy individual could have severe negative consequences, whereas not trusting a trustworthy one means a missed opportunity for cooperation .
Nanomaterials are used in a range of appliances and household products, in the manufacture of textiles and electronics, as well as for medical products and in bioremediation technology. Nanoscale zinc oxide  and copper oxide  are manufactured in large scale for both industrial and household use since they possess greater promise for future applications, such as fillers, opacifiers, catalysts, semiconductors, cosmetics, and microelectronics . CuO NPs also have potential wide industrial applications, such as gas sensors, photovoltaic cells, catalyst, and heat transfer nano fluids .
The glomerular filtration rate declines with 20 25% from 40 to 80 years of age. Furthermore, the capacity of the kidney to concentrate urine reduces progressively with age . This has been linked, using kidney tissue obtained before transplantation and on autopsies of subjects not known to have a renal disease, to a significant increase with age of the number of sclerotic glomeruli and the amount of interstitial tissue .

Such motion can cause errors and artifacts that may not be evident in typical quality assurance procedures. Even if movement is noticed by the scanner operator, subject motion is often the cause of repeated scans, resulting in inefficient use of scanner time .
Glutamate, the major excitatory neurotransmitter in the central nervous system , is neurotoxic when its extracellular concentration is high. Glutamate transporters, also called excitatory amino acid transporters , play an important role in removing glutamate from extracellular space into cells . Dysfunction of EAATs causes extracellular glutamate accumulation that results in glutamate excitatoxicity.

Depression and substance abuse are common among low income, minority adults in safety net settings. Little is known about comorbidities across service sectors supporting these clients .
Studies have shown that open angle glaucoma  disproportionately affects people of African descent  over those of European descent  and is a leading cause of blindness in persons of AD . Moreover, the Ocular Hypertensive Treatment study described African American race as a baseline factor that predicted increased risk of developing OAG . Disparities in occurrence and progression between AD and ED groups have heightened interest in the mechanisms driving the observed disparity in OAG .
Expressed largely in the plasma membranes of cancer cells, ABC transporters mediate cellular resistance to anticancer agents by the ATP dependent efflux of toxic chemotherapeutics from cells. While several ABC transporters have been shown to transport anticancer drugs in vitro, P glycoprotein  stands out by conferring the highest level of resistance to a vast array of drugs and because of its demonstrated association with clinical multidrug resistance  and poor clinical outcome . “Collateral sensitivity” of otherwise MDR cells represents a promising but yet unrealized strategy for targeting Pgp mediated MDR.
Barriers to consent when conducting prehospital research are unavoidable. However, before an EFIC study can be approved, investigators must consult both the geographic community where the study will be conducted and the community from which subjects will be drawn  . The stated goals of community consultation are to notify the public, to offer an opportunity for input on the study, and to demonstrate respect for communities and potential enrollees.
TSC is an autosomal dominant disorder characterized by the growth of benign tumors called hamartomas in multiple organs including the brain . TSC patients suffer from epilepsy, autism and developmental delay. Within the central nervous system, TSC is associated with cortical tubers, made up of giant cells, dysmorphic neurons and astrocytes.
This transporter, called P glycoprotein, was found to be expressed in Chinese hamster ovary cells selected for colchicine resistance. More than thirty years later, 14 additional ABC transporters  have been associated with drug resistance . Among multiple factors, conflicting reports on the role of ABC transporters in the clinic can be explained by the technological limitations of high throughput gene expression profiling platforms to precisely detect individual genes in a highly homologous gene superfamily such as the ABC transporter superfamily .
Mail order pharmacies are widely used to deliver medications in the U.S., with up to 1/3 of chronic illness medications delivered by mail. Research suggests a positive association between mail order pharmacy use and greater adherence to diabetes and antihypertensive medications,  and with better LDL C control. These favorable outcomes may reflect improved access to medications with mail order pharmacy use, which may be of particular value to patients with disabilities, time constraints, or limited transportation ., However, there may be unintended consequences to using mail order pharmacies.
, Ideal nanotheragnostics, therefore, 1) differentiate biological events in cancer development/progress at a molecular level, 2) generate distinctive imaging signals in response to a biological trigger , and 3) simultaneously convert themselves to activated therapeutic agents upon detecting a molecular event . In this study, a single nanoparticle platform, which generates dramatic stimuli responsive optical signal changes and is simultaneously activated for internalization and gene silencing, was developed for combined and synergistic optical imaging and gene therapy. However, cancer specific stimuli break the linkages, causing the clustered Au NP to dissipate into smaller individual particles and generate dramatic drops in scattering intensity by lost inter particles coupling effects.
Tobacco use is the major preventable cause of premature death in the United States, accounting for more than 400,000 annual deaths from cancer, cardiovascular and respiratory disease., Secondhand smoke  exposure in nonsmokers increases the risk of lung cancer, cardiovascular disease, and has a number of other negative health outcomes. Health effects in children include low birth weight, asthma, increased ear and respiratory infections and sudden infant death. Cotinine is further metabolized by P450 2A6 to trans 3' hydroxycotinine .
Long term efficacy of osteochondral allografts  depends on the presence of viable chondrocytes within graft cartilage to locally maintain homeostasis and prevent degeneration. Historically, fresh OCA, used within 7d of donor death, have high chondrocyte viability and, when implanted into large cartilage defects to treat isolated post traumatic, osteonecrotic, or osteochondritis dissecans lesions, has resulted in long term clinical success rates  >75%. In contrast, frozen OCA are devoid of viable chondrocytes and, as used for massive oncologic joint reconstructions, result in cartilage that, in retrievals, is acellular and exhibits surface and bulk tissue degeneration.
Food frequency questionnaires  facilitate dietary data collection in large cohort studies and are the most frequently used diet assessment method in nutritional epidemiology to assess habitual eating habits and rank individuals’ energy and nutrient intake . Development of an appropriate food and nutrient database is required to translate information derived from FFQs into estimates of nutrient intake, dietary quality or for absolute or rank ordered nutritional risk assessment . Experts use a variety of approaches in database development for FFQ analysis, including reliance on expert opinion , population specific data driven methods , or a combination of the two .
To a lesser extent, outersphere anions or cations may serve to modulate the water structure around the Gd cation with the net effect of influencing water ligand exchange, an important property for this class of MRI contrast agent. A relatively new class of contrast agent known as paramagnetic chemical exchange saturation transfer  agents, shows promise for development as responsive MRI agents. PARACEST agents are paramagnetic Ln complexes that have mobile protons in chemical exchange with bulk water.
In addition, CXCR4 is a well studied molecule in both HIV and cancer. Of note, CXCR4 tropism was found to be correlative with chronic immune activation and AIDS pathogenesis , and studies in a variety of human cancers have shown the chemotaxis inducing potential of CXCR4 to be exploited during tumor cell metastasis . CXCR4 defects in humans lead to a syndrome characterized by warts, hypogammaglobulinemia, immunodeficiency, and myelokathexis, collectively termed the WHIM syndrome  .
As described by Hulten et al.  over 30 years ago, decreases in blood flow are found more frequently in chronic and mild IBD and in the late fibrosing stage of Crohn’s Disease, while increases in blood flow can be found in severe IBD . Animal models of IBD, in which blood flow has been reported to decrease, have implicated a role for ET 1 in the resulting inflammation. In the trinitrobenzenesulfonic acid  model in rats, several studies  have investigated the potential effectiveness of the non specific endothelin receptor antagonists bosentan and Ro 48 5695, with the results indicating a dose  and time dependent ability to inhibit neutrophil infiltration  and to reduce histologic signs of tissue injury.
Specifically, 2/3 of the US population is overweight or obese, while 40% exhibit symptoms of pre  or frank diabetes, and the combined direct and indirect costs of obesity and diabetes are now approaching $500 billion a year. Compounding those factors in a subset of mentally ill patients is the use of second generation antipsychotics , which are known to induce weight gain and to exacerbate risk for metabolic disease and diabetes, especially in youth . The patients most often prescribed SGAs have schizophrenia.
The E1 ubiquitin activating enzyme uses ATP to covalently activate and then add ubiquitin to an E2 ubiquitin conjugating enzyme. The HRD pathway is one of the principal routes of ERAD in eukaryotes, being responsible for the degradation of both lumenal and membrane bound misfolded ER proteins . The multi spanning Hrd1p membrane domain has numerous known functions, including binding to and communication with the lumenal domain of Hrd3p, correct placement of the C terminal ligase domain, and recruitment of ERAD factors for recognition of misfolded proteins and for later steps in the pathway such as retrotranslocation .
Statistical analyses are an essential component of medical research, which when appropriately applied can further our understanding of risk factors, treatment effects and other aspects of disease. Knowledge of statistics is also important for those involved in the peer review process of a research article, as they will be responsible for judging the adequacy and correctness of the statistical methods used. In fact, readers often rely on the “approval stamp” given to articles that have undergone peer review by a reputable journal.
Until recently, mammalian mitochondria were not thought to possess any DNA repair activities , however, it is now clear that mitochondria are proficient in DNA repair of certain types of DNA lesions, particularly those repaired by the base excision repair  pathway, which removes oxidative and alkylating damage . DNA mismatch repair  suppresses MSI  through its role in repairing DNA mismatches and small loops. Most notably, human hereditary non polyposis colon cancer  is linked to mutations in nuclear MMR proteins , with nuclear MSI being a hallmark of this disease .
Subtilosin, a ribosomally synthesized 3.4 kDa cyclical peptide  produced by both Bacillus subtilis  and Bacillus amyloliquefaciens , is a bacteriocin that has the potential for applications in contraception and reproductive health due to its unique properties, such as natural origin, biodegradability, antimicrobial properties, lack of immunogenicity, overall safety, ease of production and formulation . This compound also displays antimicrobial activity against the foodborne pathogen Listeria monocytogenes Scott A  and against bacterial vaginosis associated pathogen Gardnerella vaginalis, including their antibiotic resistant forms  . Herpes simplex virus types 1 and 2  are human viral pathogens that cause serious clinical diseases comprising genital ulcerations, corneal blindness, cold sores and encephalitis.
Cardiac amyloidosis involves the deposition of insoluble fibrils in the myocardium and is an underdiagnosed cause of heart failure with preserved ejection fraction . The most clinically relevant cardiac involvement occurs in primary light chain  amyloidosis, familial transthyretin amyloidosis , and senile transthyretin amyloidosis . Other forms of systemic amyloidosis including secondary AA amyloidosis rarely affect the heart.
Large intracranial arterial occlusions are associated with high morbidity and mortality. In patients who are ineligible for or fail intravenous thrombolytic therapy, endovascular revascularization is often the only method that can potentially improve functional outcome. Although a good arterial occlusive lesion  score represents good or excellent target vessel recanalization and is associated with favorable clinical outcomes, it does not necessarily equate to tissue revascularization.
The growth in science and engineering research conducted by teams has dramatically accelerated since 1975, making multi university collaborations the fastest growing authorship structure. Bennett, Gadlin and Levine Finley provide a generic definition of team science: “Team science has been described as a collaborative and often cross disciplinary approach to scientific inquiry that draws researchers who otherwise work independently or as coinvestigators on smaller scale projects into collaborative centers and groups.” The literature also includes definitions of teams according to a wide range of organizational/structuralist dimensions, such as size, organizational complexity, geographic scope, funding, duration, leadership structure, team goals, etc. Thus, the general understanding in the literature on team science is that the team is a mechanism, an organizational structure at the center of the translational science enterprise.
The protein is composed of an N terminus domain of approximately 180 amino acids, named PI/PTB , followed by a cluster of five tyrosines and a C terminus containing two consensus regions for the serine/threonine kinase Cdk5 . The PI/PTB domain binds a tetra amino acid motif, Asn Pro X Tyr , present in several transmembrane proteins including members of the low density lipoprotein receptor and amyloid precursor families . Two of these lipoprotein receptors function as receptors for Reelin , a large glycoprotein implicated in the control of neuronal migration .
The spirochete genus Borrelia comprises three major groups of species. The species of the second group are transmitted by hard  ticks of the genus Ixodes and include agents of Lyme borreliosis , such as B. burgdorferi and B. afzelii, as well as species, such as B. bissettii, that have not been associated with human disease. Another species in this third group is B. miyamotoi, which is transmitted by Ixodes species, has rodents as reservoirs, and occurs in Asia, Europe, and North America.
In this pathway, HDL removes cholesterol from peripheral tissues and transports it to the liver for excretion via bile formation . Scavenger receptor class B type I , the HDL receptor, facilitates this transfer of cholesterol from HDL into cells. Hepatic overexpression of SR BI in mice  markedly lowered HDL C, increased cholesterol catabolism and excretion, and reduced atherosclerosis .
The D factor  has been added by the current researchers as an additional risk factor. Depression, which is highly prevalent but underdiagnosed, is predictive of poor control of diabetes mellitus and may influence an individual’s ability to control blood pressure and cholesterol secondary to poor diet and physical inactivity . There are similar levels of underdiagnosis and under treatment for those with diabetes mellitus and hyperlipidemia., The growing obesity epidemic contributes to these CVD risk factors.
The particles themselves consist of the molecular motors and the IFT particle polypeptides used in the attachment of the motors to the cargo being transported. In addition, the phosphorylation of flagellar proteins has been observed to change as flagellar activity changes . Recent evidence suggests protein phosphorylation  may play key roles in flagellar length control and/or stability.
The balance between heat generation and heat removal by blood flow defines brain temperature in humans and other large animals . We emphasize that this theoretical conclusion, derived for a brain isolated from the external environment, does not depend directly on the rate of blood flow, although Ta might. Even un anesthetized mice have been found to have 0.4°C higher brain temperature than rectal  .
It has been a matter of debate whether acute defensive engagement  is accompanied by heightened sensitivity to external cues, or alternatively, by a focus on bodily processes and internal cues  . Whereas traditional psychophysiological models have interpreted the initial phase of defense  as indicating sensory “rejection” to facilitate internal processing or protect the individual from the aversive character of the external stimuli , the defense cascade model  predicts enhanced perceptual processing in the context of an acute defensive response. These motivational circuits are activated by environmental and memorial cues and initiate cognitive processes that enhance perception in the service of selecting an appropriate action .
The most frequently studied candidate gene for Neuroticism, depression, anxiety related traits and disorders is the serotonin transporter . Given that the SSRI therapeutic action is through blocking reuptake of serotonin, one would expect the less efficient S allele  to be associated with lower Neuroticism . Furthermore, the original report was replicated in a number of later studies , but others failed to find an association using general population  or clinical samples , and some found an association in the opposite direction .
Psoriasis is an autoimmune disease affecting 7.5 million Americans. There is increasing evidence that psoriasis is associated with the prevalence and incidence of diabetes and diabetes related complications. Prospective studies from several countries have found that the risk of developing diabetes is increased among those with psoriasis, especially among those with more severe psoriasis.
One of the greatest challenges in ocular drug delivery is effectively administering drugs to the back of the eye to treat diseases of the retina, choroid and vitreous body . While conventional delivery using topical eye drops can transport drug to the anterior segment, this method generally cannot deliver useful amounts of drug to the posterior segment, due to rapid elimination via precorneal tears and conjunctival blood flow, low corneal permeability coupled with counter directional intraocular flow of aqueous humor, and long diffusional distances from the ocular surface to the back of the eye . The sclera is the white, structural sheath around the circumference of the eye and is a largely acellular tissue composed of interweaving collagen fibers embedded in an aqueous, glycosaminoglycan matrix .
The Mc1r ligands, melanocyte stimulating hormone  and ACTH are derived from the propriomelanocortin peptide   released from keratinocytes on exposure to UV radiation . Engagement between Mc1r and α MSH results in stimulation of black eumelanin production through a cAMP dependent signaling pathway . A subset of these polymorphisms consists of mutations that impair the cAMP signaling pathway and eumelanin production, resulting in a higher proportion of reddish phaeomelanin and a phenotype with red hair, fair skin, decreased photoprotection and increased UV sensitivity .
LCFA CoAs are potent regulators of a wide variety of enzymes, signaling receptors, and nuclear regulatory proteins involved in fatty acid and glucose metabolism . Likewise, by binding and reducing the unbound levels of LCFA CoAs, ACBP plays important roles not only in normal regulation of LCFA CoA transport, metabolism, signaling, vesicular trafficking, and nuclear regulation, but also in opposing the deleterious effects of elevated intracellular LCFA CoA levels associated with diabetes and obesity . ACBP overexpressing mice fed control chow exhibit altered hepatic lipid metabolism .
Cytoreductive surgery followed by platinum based chemotherapy usually combined with paclitaxel is the standard initial treatment and has improved survival in patients with epithelial ovarian cancer . A recent retrospective review of six randomized phase III clinical trials has demonstrated that patients with stage III CCC treated with carboplatin paclitaxel in the setting of front line chemotherapy had a significantly shorter survival compared to those with other histological subtypes of epithelial ovarian cancer . Another important problem in the clinical management of CCC is the lack of effective chemotherapy for recurrent CCC after front line treatment with platinum based chemotherapy.
The two electron reduction of quinones does not result in the formation of free radicals  and highly reactive oxygen species, hence protecting cells against the adverse effects of quinones and their derivatives . Interestingly, NQO1 is part of an electrophilic and/or oxidative stress induced cellular defense mechanism that includes the induction of more than two dozen genes . Approximately 2 4 % of human individuals are homozygous and 20 25% is heterozygous for this polymorphism .
If performance on each trial reflects the cues available to the listener at the associated TMR, then recognition should be similar whether or not sentences are repeated with ascending TMRs. In this context, a sentence is repeated at increasing TMRs until the listener is able to correctly recognize it, at which point the track begins, using novel stimuli on each subsequent trial. For example,  estimated thresholds for masked sentence recognition by systematically increasing the TMR until the listener was able to accurately report three keywords.

In addition to these well understood G1 phase functions of the MAPK cascade, accumulating evidence indicates that activation of the MAPK cascade also positively regulates the G2/M transition in somatic cell cycles. In these cells, serum stimulation of cell cycle reentry from G2 arrest requires activation of the MAPK cascade .
Toxicity is characterized by centrilobular hepatic necrosis progressing to fulminant liver failure . Tissue repair following acetaminophen intoxication involves proliferation of remnant hepatocytes and the production of new extracellular matrix proteins . Accumulating evidence suggests that inflammatory mediators, including TNFα, are also involved in this process .
Despite formidable challenges from the underlying physics, cardiac MRI has recently been demonstrated at 7 Tesla  . The FLASH   and bSSFP   images obtained are of sufficient quality to assess cardiac volume and function ; and right coronary angiography is feasible . Human cardiac imaging at 7T is an exciting area that is still in its infancy  .
In clinical and research assessments of respiratory health, it is often necessary to conduct multiple tests during a brief visit. Although closely spaced tests may be unavoidable, concern that one test could influence the results of subsequent tests may lead to test ordering recommendations to minimize possible carryover effects. Furthermore, carryover effects may vary by health status, leading to different test ordering recommendations for clinical assessment  and research assessment  .
The combination of mass spectrometry with solution phase hydrogen/deuterium exchange  has become a powerful method to study protein structure and protein/protein interactions  . High resolution mass analysis  is particularly advantageous for accurately assigning the peptide fragments after protease digestion and in resolving overlap of peptide isotopic distributions, both before and after HDX , . The reliability and sequence resolution of solution phase HDX monitored by mass spectrometry has been hampered by the limited number and poor specificity of proteases that are active at the low pH necessary to quench HDX.
These hosts obtain their symbionts by a number of mechanisms that deliver the symbionts horizontally , vertically , or environmentally , and can occur prior or subsequent to embryogenesis . Symbiotic bacteria develop complex traits such as surface adhesions, chemoattraction to specific polysaccharides, motility towards recognizable receptors, and resistance to specific immune response proteins , to improve their chances of pioneering host colonization. Most colonizing bacteria are capable of expressing adhesions, and/or pili, and have the ability to form biofilms, making these components key factors in bacterial colonization and symbiosis  .

This disease is characterized by the accumulation of toxic amyloid β  proteins in the extracellular space of the brain and on the wall of blood vessels in the brain  . The endothelium of brain blood vessels provides a semi permeable barrier between blood components and brain tissue. Evidence for dysfunction in the endothelial barrier of the brain vascular system in AD subjects is provided by the prevalence of an increase in microvascular permeability and disruption of cerebral vascular endothelial cell  tight junctions  and cerebrovascular inflammation in Alzheimer’s disease.
Two traditional approaches for identification of asthma susceptibility genes are association studies of candidate genes and linkage studies followed by positional cloning. The majority of proposed asthma susceptibility genes are biological candidate genes . In recent years, it has become feasible to interrogate single nucleotide polymorphisms  across the genome to identify novel disease susceptibility genes, an approach known as the genome wide association study .
In particular, cardiac stem cells that express the stem cell factor  receptor, c kit, have been characterized extensively and have been shown to be effective in intracoronary transplant improving the myocardial function of patients with heart failure . SDF1 CXCR4 has also been shown to play a prominent role in the maintenance of the hematopoietic stem cell niche in the bone marrow   . Although CXCR4 regulation of cell cycle has now been reported, the mechanisms associated with this important aspect of cell function are still unknown.
Specifically, the functional properties of cardiac troponin I  are regulated by phosphorylation and play a vital role in tuning cardiomyocyte performance in health and disease. cTnI has multiple phosphorylation sites that regulate cardiomyocyte contractility in cardiac health and disease. PKA phosphorylates cTnI at Ser23/24, thereby reducing myofilament Ca2+ sensitivity and enhancing relaxation of the heart that is needed to maintain cardiac performance at increased heart rates.
Near the end of his life, in about 1876, he postulated that the body maintains the constant internal environment by myriad, continual, compensatory reactions, which would tend to restore a state of equilibrium in response to any outside changes, enabling independence from the external environment. According to Pasteur’s followers, diseases would result mainly from external threats to the well being of the organism, such as exposure to germs; the body’s responses would be relatively unimportant. This chapter introduces a way of thinking about how the brain regulates the inner world, to maintain apparent constancy despite continual changes .
While a wide variety of self report measures have been developed to assess adherence with HIV ART, few of the questionnaire items that make up these measures have been subjected to rigorous cognitive testing to ensure that the items are consistently understood by respondents. They could also be useful for research when more objective measures such as MEMS caps  or unannounced pill counts  are impractical or too costly  . For HIV, a wider variety of instruments have been developed and used .The validity of these instruments has been assessed, in general, by examining their relationship to laboratory outcomes, most commonly viral loads.
As acellular scaffolds derived from rodent lungs are readily available and easily handled, high throughput approaches can be utilized to study cell matrix interaction or to assess the multiple conditions needed for effective recellularization and development of functional lung tissue . Further, approaches utilized in rodent models may be insufficient for adequate decellularization of lungs obtained from larger animals and humans. Technical difficulties in handling larger tissue represent a major challenge in attempting to scale up rodent model decellularization techniques to porcine and human lungs or lobes.
The gold standard approach to identifying a risk factor, however, involves measuring HPA axis characteristics prior to the onset of MDD, and then following the same individuals longitudinally to identify whether, and which types of HPA axis alterations are associated with higher rates of the development of MDD over the intervening time period . Although elevated cortisol levels across the full day and especially during the evening hours, are the most frequent cross sectional correlates of MDD , it is elevated morning cortisol that is prospectively predictive of depression  . The increase after waking, or cortisol awakening response , has become the target of considerable interest over the past 10 years for a number of reasons.
