Recently, Monastrol was introduced as a mitotic inhibitor that does not affect tubulin polymerization rather, it blocks mitosis by inhibiting Eg5 Kinesin ATPase activity .
In addition to this, it is also a key regulator of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal  axis . Neurons in the more medially situated pPVN are the principal CNS source of corticotropin releasing hormone , which is a major physiological regulator of pituitary ACTH secretion. Crh and Avp stimulate ACTH secretion by interacting with the Crh type 1 receptor  and Avpr1b, respectively, on the pituitary corticotrope.
It is generally accepted that the tendency of insulin to self associate in solution is strongly enhanced in the presence of zinc ion , which is normally present at a concentration of ca 0.2 mM in human serum . In particular, under conditions where zinc free insulin exists in monomeric form, insulin in the presence of zinc is thought to exist primarily as a hexamer binding two moles of zinc per mole of hexamer . The concentration dependent self association of bovine Zn insulin at pH 7.0 was previously studied by Milthorpe et al  via sedimentation equilibrium over the concentration range 0.03  0.6 mg/ml, who reported that over this concentration range the sedimentation equilibrium could be accounted for by an equilibrium between monomer and hexamer.
Synchronization of cortical areas in the human brain plays an important role in the understanding of the computational basis for human cognition . However, coupling across frequencies would allow for much more complex cortico cortical interactions  and has been examined in brain signals . Here, we demonstrate time dependent cross frequency phase coupling between distant sites in the motor area during execution of a simple finger movement task, using a biphase locking synchronization measure.
Neuronal exocytosis is a highly regulated Ca2+ triggered process involving the membrane fusion of synaptic vesicles with the presynaptic plasma membrane. There is strong evidence that the synaptic vesicle protein synaptotagmin 1  acts as the Ca2+ sensor for this process ; ; ; . When bound to Ca2+, the C2 domains of syt1 penetrate into lipid bilayers that contain anionic phospholipids ; ; .
Spiral ganglion neurons  transmit primary acoustic information from cochlear hair cells to the brain. SGNs extend a peripheral process to hair cells and a central process to target neurons in the cochlear nucleus . Type I SGNs innervate single inner hair cells, whereas each type II SGN innervates ~3060 outer hair cells .
Over the past several years, three different laboratories have independently isolated mitotically active germ cells from juvenile and adult mouse ovaries that can be propagated ex vivo , generate what appear to be oocytes in defined cultures in vitro , and differentiate into fertilization competent eggs after intraovarian transplantation in vivo . These findings, coupled with identification of a comparable population of oocyte precursor cells in ovaries of reproductive age women , add strong support to claims made almost a decade ago that, contrary to longstanding beliefs in the field of reproductive biology , adult mammalian ovaries are capable of oocyte and follicle renewal . Although more experiments are needed to define the exact physiological contribution of these newly discovered cells to adult ovarian function and perhaps aging related ovarian failure, the now large body of evidence from multiple laboratories supporting the existence and functionality of mammalian OSCs provides a strong impetus to characterize these cells more rigorously  .
Peer relationships provide a socialization context of great importance during adolescence, in part because adolescents who are similar to one another tend to aggregate in groups and to influence one another’s behavior in those groups . Concurrent links between social standing in the peer group  and youth behavior  are well documented . However, less is known about the stability of social standing in the peer group, individual characteristics that may predict changes in social standing, and implications of changes in social standing for subsequent behavior.
Germline copy number variants can be used for phenotypic mapping in genome wide association studies, and have been linked to various diseases . During carcinogenesis, tumor genomes often acquire somatic chromosomal alterations that can alter the dosage or structure of oncogenes and tumor suppressor genes. A powerful way to find cancer genes is to identify genomic regions with recurrent copy number alterations  in tumor genomes.
Disclosure of HIV status among people who test positive for HIV has important implications for preventing new HIV infections and for the treatment, care and support of people living with HIV/AIDS  . The potential preventive health benefits of disclosure have been emphasized in health research and programs  with a particular focus on HIV disclosure to sexual partners  . There is mixed evidence that disclosure to sexual partners leads to sexual risk behavior change .
However, many people do not receive effective treatment, particularly ethnic minorities . Substantial racial and ethnic differences in access to and quality of mental health care have been reported, including antidepressant pharmacotherapy , and the substantial general under treatment of mental disorders is even greater for black Americans . Previous reports have indicated that less than half of black Americans with depressive conditions were prescribed antidepressants compared to about two thirds of whites .
Rapid economic growth, including that of the alcohol industry combined with poor regulatory policies, multiple health risk factors, such as infectious diseases and malnutrition, and inadequate public health resources make alcohol related problems especially significant in developing countries . Detecting alcohol use disorders , specifically alcohol abuse and dependence, provides a critical opportunity for early intervention efforts to reduce adverse impacts of consumption. Studies in India have used alcohol screening measures, primarily the AUDIT , to examine hazardous alcohol use, defined as an alcohol consumption pattern that increases the risk of harmful consequences for the user and others , and to assess harmful drinking or alcohol abuse.
Squamous cell carcinoma, which arises from the epithelial lining of the vaginal tract, accounts for 7095% of primary vaginal tumors . Treatments for VAIN include laser ablation and topical therapy, neither of which are effective against an invasive tumor . Systemic chemotherapy is relatively ineffective at treating intravaginal tumors, thus it is used only in combination with surgery or irradiation .
This immunity, however, appears to be slow to develop and ineffectively maintained , also demonstrated by the low prevalence of Plasmodium falciparum  malaria antigen specific memory B cells  even in high endemic areas . While the complex nature of the parasite  and the high degree of antigenic variation  certainly contribute to this apparently impaired generation of humoral immune memory, there is also increasing evidence that the malaria parasite actively alters B cell function . This includes not only polyclonal activation and modified responsiveness of B cells in vitro and in vivo , but also profound changes to the composition of the peripheral blood B cell compartment as recently described in naturally malaria exposed populations .
Recent clinical studies have suggested that ETA antagonists may be a useful therapeutic approach for proteinuric renal disease, but the precise mechanism of action is not known. Over expression of ET 1 in the kidney causes renal inflammation and fibrosis. The mechanistic pathways of albuminuria in chronic kidney disease  have not been resolved.
Type II diabetes mellitus  is a metabolic disorder with multiple derangements in metabolic and immune pathways that predisposes individuals to cardiovascular disease. While glycemic control is of paramount importance, recent data indicate that broad pleiotropic strategies that target multiple pathways are more likely to succeed in the reducing cardiovascular risk in these patients. Emerging evidence suggests an important role for theincretin hormone, glucagon like peptide , in the regulation of post prandial glycemic control and satiety.
Obesity is associated with expansion of metabolically active adipose tissues leading to local and systemic inflammation, insulin resistance, and dyslipidemia, all of which can contribute to cardiovascular disease. Also, inflammatory cell infiltration was reported to be markedly increased in PVAT surrounding atherosclerotic human aorta as compared with non diseased aorta. Inflammation of human PVAT may in part relate to the unique properties of human perivascular adipocytes, which express higher levels of chemokines compared to adipocytes from other depots.
Ligand engagement can result in either removal of the ligand from the extracellular environment or stimulation of specific intracellular signaling pathways. Determination of the contribution of LRP1 to vascular diseases was hindered initially by the embryonic lethality of whole body deletion. SMC specific deletion of LRP1  in aged mice also leads to several vascular phenotypes including extended aortic length, aberrant superior mesenteric artery structure, and ascending aorta dilation.,, Recent studies have suggested a role for LRP1 in human vascular pathologies, particularly aortic aneurysms.
With respect to cognitive functioning, numerous studies have demonstrated a relationship between high levels of glucocorticoids  and impaired performance in several different populations. For example, in healthy adults both the administration of glucocorticoids and the implementation of a brief stressor increase salivary cortisol levels and adversely affect non emotional memory processes . While much research exists for the adult human population, less is known about the relationship between cortisol and cognitive functioning in human infants.
Quantitative non invasive tests would improve not only the diagnosis of ALS but also the tracking of disease progression over time  . Nogo A is best known for its role as a myelin associated inhibitor of nerve sprouting and regeneration . In a mouse model of ALS carrying a glycine to arginine mutation at residue 86 of superoxide dismutase 1 , Nogo expression was found to increase in lumbar spinal cord and gastrocnemius muscle extracts .
Since the early 1980s, the incidence of P. aeruginosa pneumonia has been steadily rising. Based on isolation of the organism from sputum culture, P. aeruginosa currently ranks as the leading cause of nosocomial pneumonia in the United States . The bacterium is uniquely problematic because of a combination of inherent resistance to many drug classes and its ability to acquire resistance to all relevant treatments.
Since they regulate the function of their binding partners, tetraspanins play roles in diverse cellular processes including adhesion, proliferation, fusion, and signaling . Through its direct association with CD19, CD81 participates in the B cell coreceptor, a complex of integral membrane proteins  that lowers the threshold of activation of the B cell receptor in response to opsonized antigens . Accordingly, B cells from CD81 null mice express less CD19 on the cell surface and present a weaker antibody response to Th2 inducing antigens .
Cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death among persons with diabetes and there is evidence that cardiac damage is often present at the time of clinical diagnosis of diabetes , . Elevated glucose levels are thought to induce hyperglycemia mediated coronary microvascular dysfunction and result in myocardial injury  . Previous studies have shown that persons with pre diabetes or diabetes have an increased prevalence of atherosclerosis as measured by carotid intimal thickness or coronary artery calcium .
This bone remodeling process is accomplished by a precise coordination of the activities of two cell types: osteoblasts, which deposit the calcified bone matrix, and osteoclasts, which resorb bone,. Bone resorption and formation do not occur along the bone surface at random. Coupling of bone resorption and formation is believed through release of a factor, or factors, from the bone matrix during osteoclastic bone resorption that directs migration of BMSCs to the bone resorptive surfaces.
The ability to speak, swallow, taste food, and maintain a healthy oral cavity is heavily reliant on the presence of saliva, an important effect of which on our everyday lives is often unappreciated . Salivary glands  have an important role not only in oral health but also for general health and well being. While the major glands secrete their fluids fully only upon stimulation, the minor mucosal glands function more or less continuously providing ongoing protection to the oral tissues  .
Type I endometrial cancers are estrogen  dependent and appear mostly in pre  and peri menopausal women. In contrast, Type II endometrial cancers are E2 independent and are diagnosed mostly in post menopausal women, thin and fertile women, or women with normal menstrual cycles . PTEN  is one of the most frequently mutated tumor suppressor genes in human cancers .
Following activation from the ovarian reserve, follicle growth is characterized by an increase in oocyte size and proliferation of the surrounding granulosa cells. In vitro follicle culture systems allow for the monitoring of individual follicles and therefore provide a model to investigate this complex sequence of events . In vitro culture systems aim to mimic the native ovary by providing an environment that supports and directs follicle growth and differentiation .
Neurotransmitter release is essential for communication between neurones and thus brain function. It is stimulated by influx of extracellular calcium  via voltage dependent Ca2+ channels on nerve terminal depolarization by action potentials . Ca2+ influx evokes this release by stimulating the fusion of neurotransmitter containing synaptic vesicles  with the nerve terminal plasma membrane.
Broadly, stress can simultaneously provoke both an adaptive and apoptotic response within cells. Integration of these programmed survival and death signals determines the fate of the cell. Understanding this alternative, adaptive pathway known as autophagy, has thus become increasingly important .
Transcranial magnetic stimulation  can be used within the MRI scanner to noninvasively manipulate brain activity while subjects undergo functional neuroimaging. As the technical challenges related to delivering TMS in the scanner have been overcome , this multimodal approach has been increasingly used to causally map motor, sensory, and cognitive brain networks in humans . TMS can be shaped by nearby magnetic fields , so the scanner’s static field likely influences the TMS coil’s field.

However,dysregulation of coagulation in the form of thrombotic microangiopathy in the graft and/orconsumptive coagulopathy  in the recipient remains a major barrier . Furthermore, upregulated TF expression on peripheralblood mononuclear cells and platelets in kidney xenografts recipients coincides with theonset of CC .
Chronic kidney disease is now recognized as a major public health concern. ,  It is estimated that approximately 26.3 million adults in the US have non dialysis dependent kidney disease and over 470,000 have end stage renal disease, collectively representing over 13% of the US population. In the next 20 years, the burden of chronic kidney disease is expected to increase, with over 2 million individuals projected to be receiving renal replacement therapy  by 2030.
The reduced energy availability and increased oxidative stress that occur in AD may promote neuronal membrane depolarization and overactivation of glutamate receptors resulting in excitotoxic damage to the neurons . The role of NMDA receptor overactivation in excitotoxic damage to neurons led to the development the NMDA receptor channel blocker memantine as a therapeutic that can slow cognitive decline in some patients with moderate to severe AD . KATP channels in the plasma membrane play important roles in reducing neuronal excitability in cardiac cells, neurons and other excitable cells .
Several neuroimaging studies have activated right PFC in specific conditions of logical reasoning tasks. In the latter condition, the presence of conflict, be it belief logic conflict, where the logical conclusion conflicts with our beliefs , or even the simple presence of inverted relations , results in activation in right prefrontal cortex  . As an example, consider transitive arguments of the form A> B; B>C; A>C.
Epidermal fatty acid binding protein  belongs to a family of low molecular weight  cytosolic proteins that binds long chain free fatty acids. Compared to other members of FABPs in the family, E FABP has particularly wide tissue distribution, suggesting its diversified functions. E FABP is also found expressed in tissues such as vasculature endothelial cells , mammary tissue , adipose tissue , pancreatic islets , macrophages  in addition to all nerve cells studied.

To maintain body mass, energy input through food intake and absorption, must match energy expenditure through physical activity, basal metabolism and adaptive thermogenesis.
The vocal fold mucosa is a layered structure comprised of epithelium and lamina propria ; both of which are superficial to the thyroarytenoid  muscle. Together, these mucosal structures facilitate vocal fold immune, transport and barrier function, and underpin self sustained tissue oscillation for voice production . The LP is especially important for vocal fold oscillation as it contains an extracellular matrix  rich in proteins and glycans with favorable viscoelasticity .
Homotetrameric RyR2s have a transmembrane channel domain, and regulatory and scaffolding cytoplasmic domain . In heart, FK506 binding protein  12 and 12.6 isoforms are co expressed, and can bind RyR2 at a stoichiometry of 4 FKBP per RyR tetramer,. Nevertheless, FKBP12 & 12.6 share 85% sequence homology and similar 3D structures.
Evidence for the negative impact of poor health literacy is accumulating. Adults with limited health literacy have less knowledge of disease management and of health promoting behaviors, are less likely to use preventive services, and report poorer health status . Genetic literacy pertains to one's capacity to understand and apply genetic information to make appropriate health and lifestyle decisions.

Downstream mitogen activated protein kinases  are responsive to a large number of external stimuli and are nodes of signaling integration for estrogenic signals, as well as those from other classes of ligands, via their receptors . The p38 MAPK can also control cell number by cyclin D1 phosphorylation at Thr 286 which ubiquitin tags it for rapid degradation through proteasomes , cyclin dependent kinase  regulation at major checkpoints , or inducing apoptosis through cellular stress mechanisms .
One way that EGFR signaling is regulated is via the endocytic pathway. In addition to biochemical responses, ligand binding also triggers the internalization of the ligand:receptor complex via clathrin mediated endocytosis. The duration of receptor activation is controlled by the kinetics of membrane trafficking; the receptor's proximity to downstream effectors is dictated by the spatial localization within the endocytic pathway .
The contraction of striated muscles is regulated by the troponin complex, which controls the association of actin and myosin in a calcium dependent manner. Following membrane depolarization, the rise in intracellular  is sensed directly by the Ca2+ binding subunit of the troponin complex, troponin C . Calcium bound TnC undergoes a conformational change increasing its apparent affinity for the inhibitory subunit of the troponin complex, troponin I .
The receptor for IL 22 is expressed in barrier sites such as skin, intestine, lung as well as in liver, pancreas and kidney . IL 22 production is attributed to many immune cells types such as CD4, CD8 and γδ T cells, NK cells and subsets of innate lymphoid cells  . Thus, the expression pattern of IL 22 and its receptor creates signaling directionality from the immune system to the tissues in line with the important function IL 22 has in maintaining tissue integrity.
Alveolar Capillary Dysplasia with Misalignment of Pulmonary Veins   is a rare, lethal disorder of the lungs. Affected patients typically present with severe respiratory failure and refractory pulmonary hypertension within a few hours after birth and die in the first month of life, although rare late onset presentations have been reported . Histopathologically, ACDMPV is characterized by malposition of pulmonary veins adjacent to small pulmonary arteries, medial thickening of small pulmonary arteries, deficient lobular development, a paucity of alveolar wall capillaries, and occasional lymphangiectasis .
New anticoagulant drugs for the prevention and treatment of vascular thrombosis have focused on improved efficacy, predictable dosing in a wide range of patients, and, importantly, acceptable bleeding risk  . Heparin has played a central role in the treatment of arterial and venous thrombosis . Binding of ATIII to a specific heparin pentasaccharide sequence causes protein conformational change that regulates ATIII .
Graft versus host disease  has severely limited the use of allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation  for the treatment of hematological malignancies . Donor T cell mediated alloreactive responses and conditioning regimen induced tissue damage, with subsequent activation of the innate immune system and inflammatory cytokine release, are implicated in the pathogenesis of acute GVHD  following allo HSCT  . Cytokines, such as TNF α, can augment aGVHD through direct cytotoxic impact on host tissues .
The olfactory bulb  is a unique model for investigating in vivo the correlation between vascular density, synaptic transmission, metabolism and neurovascular coupling . Dorsal glomeruli can be easily imaged in vivo with two photon laser scanning microscopy , a technique that allows one to characterize vascular architecture with a micrometer spatial resolution, and to measure cerebral blood flow  and neuronal activity  with a millisecond time resolution. The olfactory bulb has been well studied with respect to its synaptic organization .The superficial nerve layer is composed of glial cells and unmyelinated axons from olfactory sensory neurons .
Chronic transplant dysfunction, likely caused by ischemia secondary to graft arteriosclerosis , is the most significant factor limiting long term survival after clinical heart and kidney transplantation. Evidence supports a possible association of acute graft arterial injury and GA  . HMG CoA reductase inhibitors  exhibit immunomodulatory  and anti inflammatory  effects independent of their lipid lowering actions.
Currently, more than 2 billion individuals have been infected with M. tuberculosis and about 5%10% those infected will develop active TB disease during their lifetime. Currently M. bovis BCG has been administrated to over 4 billion people and remains the only licensed anti TB vaccine worldwide . Routine BCG vaccination involves the intradermal administration of BCG to infants shortly after birth and it has been found to partially protect against some childhood forms of tuberculosis such as TB meningitis and military TB .
but specific demonstrations of how these processes are manifest during specific movements has been lacking generally. Smooth pursuit eye movements are a well defined, model motor system for the study of some of these higher order processes because we know a great deal about the goal of the movements and the signals and areas involved . Smooth pursuit eye movements allow us to see well in everyday life, by assuring accurate visual information about moving objects.
Sodium channel blocking insecticides  are a relatively new group of insecticides. SCBIs inhibit voltage sensitive sodium channels in both insects and mammals . These compounds have no effect at hyperpolarized membrane potentials, but cause a voltage dependent, nearly irreversible block as the membrane is depolarized  .
Patients receiving hospice care have a variety of distressing symptoms and problems facing them, with fatigue and pain being among the most distressing. As patients near the end of life, priorities may shift from concerns about work and health to concerns about what comes after death. Thus, many patients may strengthen or renew their relationship with God, however they may define that relationship, confirming the need for clergy to be included in the interdisciplinary team.

Bupropion HCl is a first line treatment for TD that alleviates withdrawal symptoms , and is more effective than placebo in maintaining abstinence . Bupropion HCl also increases nucleus accumbens dopamine overflow in animals during nicotine withdrawal .

In various cell model systems, PAX genes have been implicated in the maintenance of the multipotent state, the initiation of differentiation programs, cell migration, proliferation and survival. In particular, PAX3 and PAX7 are required during early embryogenesis for the development of the neural crest and skeletal muscle , and gene rearrangements with FKHR are frequently implicated with rhabdomyosarcoma   . RMS is the most common soft tissue sarcoma in children  that consists of alveolar  and embryonal  subtypes.
Amblyopia, also known as “lazy eye,” is a spatial vision disorder that affects about 3% of the population . It is characterized by reduced visual acuity in one or both eyes without any organic origin. Although conventional wisdom on visual development suggests that spatial vision becomes hard wired after the critical period  and only infant and young child amblyopes are treated in current clinical practice, a number of recent studies suggest that perceptual learning might be a potential treatment for adult amblyopia .
Leukopenia or lymphopenia at the time of admission to the hospital was a prominent feature in H5N1 infected patients with a severe or fatal outcome, but was not reported in individuals who had less severe disease. With some exceptions the virulence in mice infected with human H5N1 isolates corresponds to the severity of disease in humans . The conventional approach to investigate the molecular basis for virulence is to study a pair of viruses that are associated with different levels of virulence in mice .
Body dissatisfaction is pervasive among adolescents  and has been linked with poor emotional well being  and weight and shape control behaviors . In the 2011 Youth Risk Behavior Survey, a nationally representative sample of US high school students, 61% of girls and 32% of boys reported trying to lose weight; 12% of adolescents reported fasting, 5% reported using diet pills, and 4% reported self induced vomiting or laxative use for the purpose of weight control . In addition, there is growing awareness and concern regarding the use of muscle enhancing behaviors among adolescents .
In the olfactory system, volatile odorants are detected in the periphery by ORNs which transduce chemical stimuli into electrical signals that are relayed downstream to the OB or the AL. In the AL and OB, neural codes for odors take the form of spatio temporal patterns of activity distributed across ensembles of principal neurons  in insects, mitral cells in vertebrates; ; ; ). These odor evoked ensemble responses, which contain information about odor identity, intensity, and timing , are reliable over repeated trials, and, particularly in insects, can be quite elaborate, often consisting of sequences of excitation and inhibition that together can long outlast the eliciting odor stimulus .
Patients with germline Rb mutations are at increased risk for lung cancer and the Rb/p16 pathway is deregulated in most, if not all, lung cancers providing convincing evidence that loss of Rb/p16 pathway function is essential in the genesis of this malignancy  . The Rb/p16 pathway is classically viewed as a linear pathway wherein p16 positively regulates Rb which in turn suppresses cell proliferation by inhibiting expression of E2F target genes . The tumor suppressor p16 inhibits cyclin D cdk4/6 activity thereby enhancing Rb activity and suppressing cell growth.
E2F1 directed transcription is mediated by coordinated activity of the ‘winged helix’ DNA binding domain and C terminal transactivation domain, which recruit basal transcription machinery to target gene promoters . E2F1 regulation and function have been studied primarily in cycling cells. Although neuronal E2F1 does retain some properties observed in mitotic cells, including its ability to induce apoptosis, these observations suggest E2F1 may have a novel function in neurons .
It is thought that bacterial infection by P. aeruginosa stimulates formation of lipid rafts containing CFTR that permits the bacterium to invade the epithelial cell, initiate protective host inflammatory responses followed by apoptosis and shedding of the superficial layer of epithelial cells with internalized bacteria . These fractions also retain the caveolin 1  and caveolin 2  proteins. Caveolae are involved in pinocytosis, endocytosis, and cell signaling and are very abundant in lung cells, where they are found in endothelial cells, type I pneumocytes, and bronchial epithelial cells .

Ordinarily, the nuclear export signal  of Rev binds to a complex of the cellular proteins Crm1 and Ran GTP to facilitate the nuclear export of the HIV 1 vRNA that encodes the Gag and GagPol proteins, as well as other incompletely spliced HIV 1 RNAs . During its transit, gp160 is cleaved by furin like proteases to yield the Env surface  and transmembrane  proteins, which remain associated, and assemble into trimer units .
In addition, agonists acting at α2ARs and ORs interact in a greater than additive  manner when co administered to the spinal cord . Synergistic interactions can result in greater than 100 fold increases in analgesic potency as well as increased maximum efficacy. Synergy is important in clinical pain management as it makes possible production of analgesia at lower doses for each drug, thus reducing undesired side effects and improving treatment outcomes .
Skin of psoriatic patients is characterized by well demarcated erythematous lesions with specific histopathological features, including epidermal hyperplasia, increased dermal angiogenesis and dense infiltrates of immunocytes . The infiltrating immune cells generate inflammatory cytokines which can enhance expression of MHC II, adhesion and co stimulatory molecules, angiogenic and growth promoting factors by keratinocytes, further facilitating pathologic interactions between immune and epithelial compartments of the affected skin . Important advancements have been made in deciphering the role of growth factors , inflammatory cytokines  and their downstream transcription factors  in the crosstalk between immune and epithelial cells that underlies the pathogenesis of psoriasis .
More than AIDS, malaria and tuberculosis combined, pneumonia is responsible for about 19% of all deaths in children below five years . Pneumonia is the primary complication of influenza infection and, as such, accounts for the majority of influenza mortality . For example, a recent study found a strong but brief interaction between bacterial and influenza infection that can elevate susceptibility to pneumococcal pneumonia by 100 fold .
Due to the lack of established ESC in livestock, HR in livestock requires the use of somatic cells, instead of ESC . In recent years, several groups have targeted genes in cultured porcine somatic cells, at efficiencies similar to those observed in mouse ESC, 9.3×10−5 to 8.3×10−7 targeting events per exposed cell . These targeting enrichment strategies reduce the number of random integration events that survive selection.
Hemorrhagic shock results in the disruption of the microvascular endothelial cell barrier leading to vascular leak . Hemorrhagic shock is associated with the formation of mitochondrial reactive oxygen species  and mitochondrial mediated ‘intrinsic’ apoptotic signaling . Studies from our laboratory have shown that ROS formation and the activation of the “intrinsic” apoptotic signaling cascade are major mediators of vascular leak following hemorrhagic shock .
The molecular clockworks in the master and in peripheral oscillators are under the control of feedback loops of clock genes . The mPER and mCRY proteins inhibit CLOCK:BMAL1 mediated transcription in a circadian manner . Circadian rhythms in clock gene expression in the SCN and in some peripheral oscillators like the liver are self sustained in the absence of rhythmic input .
Over the past decade, significant progress has been made in the development of non contact wide field technologies for quantitative, sub surface functional imaging. For example, fluorescence imaging can now provide surgeons with real time guidance during surgical procedures , and has successfully been translated to human trials for breast cancer sentinel lymph node mapping . Frequency domain photon migration  and fluorescence lifetime imaging  have been applied to large fields of view   for normal versus tumor cell delineation through natural chromophore contrast , or for improved exogenous and endogenous fluorescence signal detection through lifetime contrast .
The development of squamous cell carcinoma  of the epidermis occurs via a multistage, stepwise process whereby keratinocytes accumulate distinct genetic lesions in oncogenes and tumor suppressor genes that promote cell growth and cell survival . Two critical phenotypes acquired early in SCC progression are cellular immortalization and cellular transformation, and loss of function mutations of p53 and oncogenic activation of H Ras are known to immortalize and transform epithelial cells, respectively . In addition, these genetic lesions are common events in human epidermal SCC  and play crucial roles in its development .
Although shared decision making leads to better health outcomes, some studies suggest that there is a low level of shared decision making in routine pediatric ADHD care. The American Academy of Pediatrics  recommends use of shared decision making in its practice guidelines for ADHD, with a focus on identifying goals for ADHD. The AAP also states that, “The goals should be realistic, attainable, and measurable,” .
Phosphorylation of the activation loop is one common mechanism for kinase activation. In an active state conformation the aspartate of the DFG motif points into the ATP binding site and coordinates 2 Mg++ ions, with the activation loop displaying an open and extended conformation. The other hallmark feature of an active state conformation is the orientation of the αC helix located on the N terminal domain; in an active conformation it is rotated inward toward the active site, together with a characteristic ion pair interaction between the conserved Glu of the αC helix and the Lys of the β3 strand of the β sheet in the N lobe, , .
Upon activation by toll like receptor  or other pattern recognition receptor signaling, macrophages recruit additional pro inflammatory immune cells including neutrophils, exudative macrophages, and Th1 lymphocytes to the lung and alveolar space as a critical part of the innate immune response . Repeated TLR4 stimulation by LPS results in a state of reduced inflammatory capacity known as endotoxin  tolerance . In contrast to the systemic effects of sepsis where the majority of immune cells are exposed to the same circulating stimuli, recruited inflammatory macrophages may respond differently than resident macrophages to successive lung stimuli  .
Polychlorinated biphenyls  and other persistent organic pollutants , such as hexachlorobenzene , and p,p’ dichlorophenyldichloroethylene , a metabolite of p,p’ DDT, have been found to elicit a broad spectrum of biologic, metabolic, and immunologic responses . The potential of these POPs to impair immune responses and trigger autoimmune disease is of growing concern. Given the structural similarity to thyroid hormones, PCBs  may mimic thyroid hormone action and even modulate the mechanisms and interfere with the binding of these hormones , potentially leading to thyroid functional disorders and autoimmune thyroid diseases  .
Depressive disorders, including major depressive disorder and dysthymia, are common among adolescents and are associated with substantial health, social, and developmental consequences. Research has also reported that major depressive disorder places adolescents at greater risk for later mental health problems, substance use disorders, educational underachievement, unemployment, poorer functioning in work, and social problems . Most adolescents with depressive disorders do not receive any mental health services, even though effective treatments are available .
Vibrio cholerae, an autochthonous aquatic bacterium, is the causative agent of cholera, a severe, watery, life threatening diarrheal disease. Genes encoding for cholera toxin, ctxAB, and other pathogenic factors have been shown to reside in various mobile genetic elements . The epidemic potential of cholera has been realized throughout human history with seven recorded pandemics and the disease is persistent in many developing countries.
In area CA3, PKA plays a fundamental role in the induction and maintenance of the N methyl D aspartate receptor  independent form of LTP at mossy fiber  to pyramidal cell synapses . Furthermore, it is well established that PKA modulates the activation of the L type voltage gated Ca2+ channels  required for the induction of NMDAR independent LTP at Schaffer collateral to pyramidal cell synapses  as well as MF to pyramidal cell synapses . PKC also was found to play a role in LTP at MF to pyramidal cell synapses.

Profound thrombocytopenia, microangiopathic hemolytic anemia and organ ischemia are characteristic features of TTP syndrome. If left untreated, the mortality rate is as high as 80~100%.
Strabismus, a manifest misalignment of the visual axes, is one of the most common childhood visual disorders, occurring in 3 4% of the population . Phoria, a latent misalignment of the visual axes, exists to some degree in nearly all individuals. In those with a large near phoria or weak vergence system, the effort to prevent diplopia during sustained near work may cause significant eye strain  .
For example, ionic interactions within residual structures can stabilize protein denatured states by 1 to 4 kcal/mol. Thus, non random structure in the denatured state of a protein can clearly influence the folding process, but does not always do so. Still, stable residual structures present in the denatured state ensemble have the potential to dictate early nucleation events, which in turn guide the denatured polypeptide down the ‘folding funnel’, limiting the “walk across conformational space” towards a thermodynamic minimum.
Curcumin, 1,7 bis 1,6 heptadien 3,5 dione, is the primary bioactive component isolated from turmeric, a dietary spice made from the rhizome of Curcuma longa . Curcumin has chemopreventative and chemotherapeutic properties in numerous experimental models and has been shown to inhibit a variety of cellular targets that promote survival and metastasis including nuclear factor kappa B  and signal transducer and activator of transcription 3 , among others . Despite its broad target specificity, curcumin has a favorable safety profile in humans  , although dietary curcumin has poor bioavailability .
Results from genome wide scans have confirmed common genetic variants with very small effects on breast cancer risk; however, this approach likely misses clinically and functionally important cancer susceptibility alleles because of false negatives and poor coverage in some regions. Therefore, examination of candidate genes still provides a useful, complementary approach. The Breast Cancer Association Consortium, a collaborative data pooling effort of more than 60,000 subjects, was initiated to validate reported genetic associations with breast cancer risk.
CKD has become one of the leading causes of morbidity and death after LTx . Although calcineurin inhibitor toxicity is typically considered a major contributor, other risk factors for CKD include perioperative acute kidney injury, diabetes mellitus, hypertension and chronic hepatitis C infection  . The reported prevalence of CKD after LTx ranges between 10% and 45% .
Although inversions have been studied for nearly a century, only recently have researchers begun to elucidate their effects on patterns of molecular evolution. Dobzhansky proposed that natural selection would favor inversions if they captured a set of positively interacting alleles, which he referred to as a “supergene” complex . Thus, the influence of inversions on the rate and pattern of recombination is fundamental to their adaptive significance and evolution .
Although no P. aeruginosa vaccine has yet made its way into clinical practice, the relatively recent identification of another virulence factor, the type III secretion system , associated with acute infection by this species , has led to development of a novel immunotherapy effective against laboratory strains of this bacterial species . The TTSS is a mechanism widely exploited by gram negative pathogens to intoxicate eukaryotic cells and permits successful multiplication of the pathogen in the host . PcrV, a homologue of the Yersinia V antigen LcrV, has been recognized as an important structural translocation component of the P. aeruginosa TTSS.
Falls are among the most serious problems facing older adults, which can cause injuries and even death . Slips comprise 40% of outdoor falls among older adults . Therefore an effective training program to prevent sliprelated falls is highly desired.
Chronic postsurgical pain  occurs in 10 50% of patients undergoing major surgery and results in pain sufficient to negatively impact quality of life. Psychosocial and genetic factors have been shown to contribute to the risk of CPSP,  as do procedures with a high risk of nerve injury such as limb amputation, thoracotomy and breast surgery. Individual differences in pain processing impart risk as well, especially the strength of conditioned pain modulation  in which analgesia is induced diffusely over the body from an intense, focal pain stimulus.
6  Fluoro L dopa  is a radiopharmaceutical that follows the metabolic pathway of L dopa . In catecholaminergic neurons, FDOPA is decarboxylated by aromatic L amino acid decarboxylase  to fluorodopamine, which is taken up into synaptic vesicles by vesicular monoamine transporter type 2  and cleared from the synaptic cleft by dopamine transporters . The ventral tegmental area  is relatively preserved in PD and contributes dopaminergic projections to many brain regions outside the striatum; several studies have related this extrastriatal uptake to non motor symptoms  .
Shanks, also known as ProSAP, Synamon, SSTRIP, CortBP and Spank, are a family of scaffold proteins at the postsynaptic density . Shank proteins are thought to promote enlargement and maturation of spines ,  and have been implicated in a number of neuronal diseases including autism  . Shanks have multiple protein interaction domains and can bind to other PSD scaffolds, GKAPs and Homers .
Individual agents used to treat human osteoporosis reduce fracture risk by ~50 60%. Since agents that act with complementary mechanisms are available, sequential therapies that mix anti resorptive and anabolic agents could improve fracture risk reduction, when compared to monotherapies .
Diabetes mellitus  is one of the most frequent metabolic disorders, with an estimate of 371 million people living with this condition worldwide . Around 4.8 million people died in 2012 due to diabetes, half of them were under 60 years  . The diabetic foot is one of the major complications of this disease, with an estimated 10% to 25% of diabetic patients developing a diabetic foot ulcer  in their lifetimes , causing a considerable burden in health care and patient well being  .

GF signaling is particularly important for hepatic differentiation of stem cells. Growth factors are the signals that drive ESCs to foregut endoderm and further, toward the hepatocyte lineage.

Alpha and beta frequencies are two sinusoidal waves within the study of EEG that can be used to characterize these behaviors. Beta has also been found to have two distinct bands as well:  upper beta  and  lower beta .

CAM has been defined by the National Center for Complementary and Alternative Medicine as a group of diverse medical and health care systems, products, and practices that are not presently considered part of conventional medical care.
Despite modest improvements in survival rates from colorectal cancer  over the last 25 years, deaths from CRC still account for approximately 10% of all cancer deaths in the UK. The main CRC prognostic marker at present is stage at diagnosis, which describes tumour spread through the bowel wall, number of affected lymph nodes and spread of tumour to distant organs  . Some studies have reported that lifestyle factors such as physical activity and body mass index influence particular characteristics of the tumour systemic inflammatory response, which affects cancer survival .
It has been widely proposed that connexin43 , the main gap junction protein expressed in astrocytes, can under specific conditions form functional “hemichannels”, providing a transmembrane pathway for the diffusion of ions and relatively large molecules . Evidence in support is primarily pharmacological, showing blockade of uptake of fluorescent dyes  and of release of intracellular molecules  by compounds known to block gap junction channels; additionally, electrophysiological recordings have demonstrated the presence of large  conductance channels in astrocytes  . Recently, a newly discovered group of proteins, the pannexins , were cloned from mammalian tissues.

This scenario is unlikely because functions such as omni shifting RFs and transhemifield saccadic sequences survive transection of the corpus callosum  and the result of one FEF acting upon the other seems to be mostly inhibitory .

Moreover, most TSE agents also maintain their original identity even after serial passage in foreign species with different PrP res band patterns.

In the United States, the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental DisordersIV Text Revision provides the official classification of mental and substance use disorders widely employed in clinical, research, educational, and statistical settings. DSM IV subtypes substance users who meet criteria for Dependence into those with versus without a physiological component using the presence of either tolerance or withdrawal as a specifier. The investigators found that patients who reported cocaine withdrawal with or without tolerence had a higher prevalence of lifetime psychiatric disorders and a more severe pattern of substance use than did patients without symptoms of cocaine withdrawal.
However, there exist congenital anomalies wherein two of the leaflets are fused to form a bicuspid aortic valve . Previous studies have indicated that the biological mechanism of calcium deposition in BAV patients is similar to the calcification process that occurs in patients with a TAV; however the process is greatly accelerated for reasons that are not clearly understood. It should be noted that BAV is part of a larger spectrum of AV structural anomalies that range from single to quad leaflet forms.,,, Progression of calcific aortic valve disease  starts with asymptomatic stages that include mild thickening of the leaflets without affecting valvular function—a condition called aortic valve sclerosis .
, In this technique, biorecognition molecules of interest are pulled apart or stretched under an external loading force. Fitting the force spectrum data to different theoretical models yields kinetic and thermodynamic information for the single molecule interaction. Further, recently developed microscopic models have demonstrated the limitations of the Bell Evans model, especially at high and low loading rates, likely resulting in unreliable kinetic parameters.
Catheter ablation has been shown to be superior to antiarrhythmic therapy for the treatment of drug refractory, symptomatic atrial fibrillation . The past decade has produced significant advances in catheter ablation approaches for AF and improved procedural outcomes. This may be due to a variety of factors, including better patient selection, technological advances and greater operator experience.
In the Stop signal task  participants make simple decisions about a visual stimulus, but on some trials a signal is presented after the stimulus indicating that the response is to be withheld . Differences in inhibitory control are often assessed by calculating a stop signal reaction time , which provides an index of how long it takes an individual to inhibit the response, and thus the strength of their inhibitory ability. We focused on individual differences in decision components based solely on Go trials , and assessed the degree to which these components were associated with activation of the stopping network on Stop trials.
Together these data suggest that KOR activation by endogenous dynorphins may mediate the negative affective changes caused by stress that increase drug addiction risk . We interpret these data to suggest that KOR activation by endogenous dynorphins induces a dysphoric state that enhances the rewarding properties of the subsequently experienced euphorigenic drug; however, the underlying mechanisms by which dynorphin may alter cocaine CPP responses are not yet known . To define those mechanisms consistent with Pavlovian learning theory , the sequence of events during the CPP assay can be conceptualized as follows: 1) the animal is administered cocaine , 2) experiences a subjective rewarding euphorigenic effect , 3) learns to associate this UR with a specific environmental context , and when subsequently presented with the CS, 4) the animal exhibits approach behavior  to the previously cocaine paired CS.
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  are ligand gated cation channels composed as homopentameric or heteropentameric combinations of α and β subunits . The most abundant heteromeric nAChR in the brain contain α4 subunits, bind nicotine with high affinity, and have been implicated in conditions including Parkinson’s disease, Alzheimer's disease, epilepsy, and drug dependence  . The N terminal domain plays a key role in ligand binding , and the transmembrane domains are important for channel kinetics and ion permeability .
Unfortunately, growth factors can degrade within minutes under physiological conditions, and biomaterial systems designed to deliver soluble growth factors to sites of tissue repair are therefore often ineffective and costly . Immobilization not only ameliorates degradation and spatial issues associated with soluble biomolecules, but may also mimic naturally occurring biomolecule tethering, such as that which occurs during sequestration of growth factors by the extracellular matrix  . Epidermal growth factor  participates in the growth and repair of many types of tissues throughout the body.

Accordingly, we evaluated relationships of breast cancer risk factors and tumor pathology to estrogen receptor  and progesterone receptor  expression in TDLUs surrounding breast cancers .
While imatinib has been remarkably successful in reducing the tumor burden and suppressing the progression of patients in the chronic phase of CML, it has been less successful in the treatment of the accelerated phase of the disease. One correlation that has been observed in leukemic samples from untreated patients as the disease progresses is increased expression of BCR ABL. BCR ABL transformation is associated with cell autonomous proliferation and increased glucose metabolism .
The ROS produced during PDT are effective in killing both the malignant and the normal cells via necrosis, apoptosis or autophagy, depending on the cell type, structure of the PS, and the light parameters chosen,  . Accordingly, the generation efficiency of triplet 3* is nearly identical to that of 3C60*, . By a similar mechanism to the tetrapyrrole PS used for photodynamic therapy , illumination of solubilized C60 and its monoadduct derivatives in the presence of oxygen leads to the generation of singlet oxygen  via energy transfer from the excited triplet state of C60 or C60> to O2, giving the photocytotoxic effect.
Ligand activated GPCRs act as guanine nucleotide exchange factors  for G proteins that stimulate exchange of GDP for GTP on the Gα subunit . Crystal structures have been resolved for both GDP bound inactive and GTP bound active conformations and have shed light on the discrete differences of these nucleotide dependent conformational states . Consequently, efforts have been undertaken to develop nucleotide state selective inhibitors for both inactive GDP bound heterotrimers and active GTP bound Gα or Gβγ dimers .
Endometriosis is a chronic estrogen dependent disease characterized by the growth of ectopic endometrial tissue . The incidence is estimated to be up to 10% of women of reproductive age and 30 50% of women seeking treatment for infertility . The theory proposed by Sampson in 1927 suggests that endometrial tissue is released into the peritoneal cavity via retrograde menstruation .

A recent study in Western Uganda also found 38% of HIV positive patients' concomitantly consuming herbal medicine and ART . Clinicians however discourage the concomitant use of herbal medicines with the conventional ARVs or other treatments based on their concern on the possible risk of ADRs due to the herbs alone or possible unfavorable effect on the safety and efficacy of the ARVs due to herb drug interactions .
Despite progress in the prevention of mother to child HIV transmission, nearly 260,000 infections occurred among children in 2012. Pediatric HIV infection remains a public health problem, but early treatment improves survival and preserves immune health. Cure of HIV infection remains elusive due to the early establishment of viral latency in long lived resting memory CD4+ T cells that evade immune surveillance mechanisms and antiretroviral drugs.
Neurocognitive assessments in athletes and non athletes in the short term following concussion have demonstrated deficits in working memory, attention, and processing speed. There is wide variation in the persistence of these defects, with the majority of individuals showing good recovery within days, weeks or months following injury and a small minority showing persistent deficits. Over age 56, this number increased to 1.2% in the general population, but to 6.1% among retired players.
Safe and effective vaccines to prevent pneumococcal meningitis now exist  and many developing countries will introduce vaccine in the near future. Accurate etiological tests appropriate for developing country situations will assist with measuring vaccine impact and improving clinical care . Culture based identification of the etiologic agents causing acute bacterial meningitis in developing countries may have poor sensitivity for a variety of reasons .
Cigarette smoking is a well documented risk factor for cardiovascular diseases, including atherosclerosis, coronary artery disease, acute myocardial infarction, hypertension and sudden cardiac death. Multiple prospective studies have consistently shown that cigarette smoking is associated with increased risk of hypertension. It has been well proved that nicotine is the main reason of smoking dependence, and approximately 80% of the inhaled nicotine from smoking is metabolized to cotinine by C oxidation in liver, then the cotinine is further metabolized into trans 3 hydroxycotinine that is finally excreted in urine as the major nicotine metabolite.
Dopamine receptor genes are key players in regulating neurotransmission in response to dopamine and, therefore, are of central interest in a range of neuropsychiatric diseases, including schizophrenia, substance addiction, and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder . Since many behaviors and psychiatric conditions show moderate to high heritability, the study of genetic variation in the dopamine related genes will contribute to unraveling the molecular mechanisms of the catecholamine pathway. These insights into the role of genetic variability could contribute to the development of personalized pharmaceutical intervention based upon the genotype of each individual patient .
A key molecular structure responsible for these effects is the hydroxylated aromatic ring , such that virtually all phenolic chemicals exhibit some degree of estrogenic toxicity . In light of their significant potential to cause adverse health effects and their resistance to conventional drinking water and wastewater treatments , environmental estrogens have become a critical treatment and research priority. Compared to conventional wastewater treatment and other oxidative treatments, the use of extracellular enzymes for removal of estrogens from water has several particularly appealing benefits , including: 1) the unique specificity of enzyme reactions, which enables rapid reaction even at exceedingly low substrate concentrations; 2) the diverse array of naturally occurring enzyme catalysts exhibiting native reactivity towards various xenobiotic substrates; and 3) the potential usefulness of protein design to engineer specially tailored enzymes for individual contaminants or classes of particular regulatory concern.

Manipulation of radiation induced cell death is one such strategy , and has been proposed to enhance therapeutic ratio in cancer. Apoptosis molecularly represents a cascade of caspase proteases released from the mitochondria, and is characterized by condensation, chromatin margination, early nuclear condensation and nucleosomal ladder formation.
In T cells, receptor dependent activation of Ras by the RasGEFs Sos1 and RasGRP1  is required for the normal differentiation of thymocytes in the thymus and for the mature effector functions of mature T cells  . Phosphorylated LAT  can associate with critical proteins to form two complexes that regulate Ras activation. Active Ras then signals to multiple effector pathways to drive both T cell development and mature T cell function  .
Frontotemporal lobar degeneration  is a common cause of dementia, particularly in younger individuals with disease onset at ages less than 65. The clinical and pathological heterogeneity of FTLD creates particular challenges for determining optimal pharmacological management. Currently, there are no FDA approved treatments for FTLD, although a number of medications that affect the function of specific neurotransmitter systems have been studied and may offer modest benefits for the behavioral and cognitive sequelae of this disorder.
These forces all alter intra luminal pressure and strain, which along with other physiologic forces may support the normal gut mucosal cytoarchitecture. Such biophysical forces stimulate intestinal epithelial proliferation and modulate intestinal epithelial differentiation in vitro, and activate tyrosine kinase signaling within the gut mucosa in vivo  . However, the effects of physical forces on the biology of the intestinal mucosa in vivo are less clear, although repetitive deformation stimulates mucosal tyrosine kinase activity in anesthetized rats .
Epidemiologic studies have linked obesity with the risk of developing certain cancers, including colorectal, postmenopausal breast, kidney, esophageal , pancreatic, liver, gallbladder, and endometrial cancers. Many of these cancers arise as a result of physiologically altered endocrine and/or metabolic functioning in obese people. Large, prospective, population based studies have demonstrated that in addition to increasing the risk of developing cancer, obesity remains an independent risk factor for death from malignancy in both obesity associated and non obesity associated tumors .
The standard somnological armamentarium lacks affordable tools for objective assessment of sleep architecture on a large scale or repeatedly over time . Multichannel polysomnography  is encumbering and costly for such applications; simpler devices for assessment of sleep disordered breathing  provide only autonomic indices of sleep quality that have not been validated in non SDB populations; actigraphs estimate duration and timing of sleep but render no information about its macro  or microstructure; finally, diaries and questionnaires are subjective. Recent years have seen the emergence of self applicable recorders worn on the forehead that assess sleep architecture from the mixture of electroencephalograms , electrooculograms  and electromyograms  recorded in a single differential derivation .
Nonetheless, the use of granulocyte transfusions has remained infrequent and only about 1000 granulocyte units are transfused per year in the US . Recently, interest in granulocyte transfusions has increased for a variety of reasons, including the ability to collect granulocytes in higher numbers using granulocyte colony stimulating factor , an increased incidence of therapy related neutropenia and a rise in antibiotic resistance . US clinical trials are currently underway to investigate the use of granulocyte transfusions for treating infections in individuals with neutropenia  as well as for treatment of cancer  .

Signal Transducer and Activators of Transcription  are important cytoplasmic proteins that act as transcription factors to regulate gene expression. STAT proteins, especially STAT3, are important in the development and progression of cancers by either preventing apoptosis or promoting proliferation .

The inflamed mucosal plexus is associated with not only widely variable changes in blood flow velocity , but discontinuous and even bidirectional flow . Exposure of cells and tissues to xenobiotics or physico chemical sources of oxidative stress  causes the generation of reactive oxygen species , which in turn can cause damage by interacting with cellular macromolecules such as DNA, proteins, and lipids, as well as by forming secondary toxic products. ROS initiated membrane lipid peroxidation  is highly damaging to cells because a single oxidative event can start a chain reaction and lead to the formation of large amounts of LPO products including toxic electrophiles such as 4 hydroxynonenal  . In recent years, 4 HNE has been shown to be an important second messenger involved in signaling for cell cycle arrest, differentiation, apoptosis and regulation of the expression of a multitude of genes including p53, in cells of diverse origin .
During the course of epithelial cell differentiation, the virus shifts through three phases: establishment, maintenance; where the viral episome is maintained at low copy, and amplification; where the virus replicates at high copy . The viral proteins E1 and E2 function together in HPV genome amplification . In addition to transactivation and origin recognition, E2 is thought to serve as a maintenance factor by tethering newly synthesized HPV genomes to mitotic chromosomes or mitotic spindles, thereby allowing equal segregation to daughter cells .
Arithmetic operations such as division and subtraction are a fundamental and widespread property of inhibition in neuronal networks. It has been suggested that different cortical inhibitory cell classes provide distinct combinations of divisive or subtractive inhibition during stimulus mediated synaptic drive in vivo. Recent studies in visual cortex using optogenetic activation of inhibitory neurons have provided important insights into their function.
Understanding the connection between the PPTg and SNc is particularly important because they are implicated in the pathology of Parkinson’s disease. This is not surprising, given that the basal ganglia play a role in action selection and in the learning of action outcome associations and stimulus response habits . Critical to such associations is the phasic release of dopamine  in the striatum, which selectively reinforces corticostriatal synaptic activity.
To generate a stable and economical gait pattern, it is critical to activate ankle plantar flexor muscles with the correct timing and appropriate magnitude to produce trailing limb push off during late stance. In humans, the ankle mechanical power burst provides the majority of positive work required to restore the energy lost in redirecting the center of mass in step to step transitions . As plantar flexor muscle activity is largely mediated by proprioceptive feedback during walking , it is important that the nervous system modulates stretch reflex pathways to meet the mechanical requirements of gait.

While minimally invasive methods continue to be refined, SWL remains the only extracorporeal procedure for stone disintegration . These revelations have in turn led to production of several machines with similar specifications to the HM3, delivering broadly focused shocks with relatively low pressure amplitudes.

However, there is increasing awareness that acknowledgement and exploration of White racial identity are important steps toward recognizing and understanding racism and White privilege . A recent trend in scholarship on White racial identity highlights the complexity of White identity , emphasizing the diversity within the White population.
Several recent studies have highlighted the fact that adverse renal effects of Cd may result from even low levels of exposure and that children and individuals with confounding health conditions, such as diabetes, may be especially susceptible  . Some of the urinary biomarkers that have been used for this purpose include the Cd binding protein metallothionein , low molecular weight proteins such as β 2 microglobulin  and Clara cell protein 16  , and even Cd itself  . For example, the urinary excretion of metallothionein and Cd are markers of Cd exposure as well as proximal tubular injury, and identifying the critical levels of urinary metallothionein or Cd to indicate the onset of tubular injury has been problematic .
Clinical use of urine toxicology testing to differentiate oral THC medication compliance from smoked cannabis has been difficult . Oral fluid  is a biological matrix for cannabinoid testing with multiple advantages for drug testing programs . Two prior studies have evaluated OF cannabinoid testing following oral THC administration.
Osteosarcoma  is the most common primary bone tumor in both dogs and man . OSA most commonly arises in the appendicular skeleton and affected bones develop both trabecular and cortical osteolysis. In addition to lysis, affected bones have variable degrees of reactive bone formation in both the endosteal and periosteal compartments, as well as osteoid formation by the tumor cells.

Head and neck cancer  is the fifth most common form of cancer and causes over 350,000 deaths globally each year . Cetuximab is a monoclonal anti EGFR antibody which was approved for the treatment of HNSCC in 2006. Recently, an increasing body of literature has suggested that resistance to anti EGFR therapy arises frequently through activation of alternative signaling pathways that bypass the original target .

Whereas other heme enzymes are known to react with chlorite, the highly efficient generation of O2 from this substrate is unique to Cld . This makes Cld the only known enzymatic system outside photosystem II that has evolved to efficiently catalyze OO bond formation. Chlorite is a thermodynamically robust oxidant , and should be capable of compound I formation.
AGE induced microvascular and macrovascular complications of diabetes mellitus  are very well documented in experimental and clinical studies., In addition to AGE production, ROS lead to production of toxic reactive aldehydes such as malondialdehyde , acetaldehyde, and 4 hydroxy 2 nonenal . Aldehyde dehydrogenases  are a group of enzymes that metabolize toxic aldehydes into nontoxic acids. ALDH2*2 is associated with many metabolic disorders such as hypertension, metabolic syndrome, type 2 DM, and diabetic complications.
Alcohol use disorders  are characterized by maladaptive patterns of alcohol consumption manifested by symptoms leading to clinically significant impairment or distress . These disorders are not only among the most prevalent mental disorders worldwide but contribute to the development of more than 60 disease conditions and account for 4% of the global burden of disease  . Current data indicate that alcohol use disorders are pervasive among Western countries , and maybe increasing in developing countries .

The cotton rat and mouse models of hRSV challenge have been used extensively to study seroconversion and other immune responses to this virus, but these models face limitations with respect to issues of infectivity and virus replication in vivo . Results of several recent studies suggest that PVM may also serve as a useful model for developing vaccine strategies, particularly those focused on acquisition of mucosal immunity to replicating virus pathogens.
In the United States, primary open angle glaucoma  is the most common type of glaucoma . POAG is an age related progressive optic nerve degeneration caused by irreversible destruction of retinal ganglion cells eventually leading to blindness. A subgroup of POAG patients develops optic nerve degeneration without elevation of intraocular pressure  and this POAG subset is called normal pressure glaucoma  .

While the precise mechanisms underlying the effects of CR are not fully understood, it appears that CR, at least in part, may act through anti oxidative and anti inflammatory mechanisms . Brain white matter  is especially sensitive to inflammatory and oxidative damage due to its high metabolic activity .

We have previously reported a neuroprotective role of sodium pyruvate  treatment in a rat model of cortical contusion injury  . A single SP treatment was also found to significantly reduce the numbers of dead/dying neurons in the peri contusional cortex at 6 h post CCI. Similar cell protective effects of exogenous pyruvate, which appear to be mediated through metabolic improvements, have been reported in several animal models of injury to brain or liver  .
Myelin, the insulating sheath that wraps around the axons facilitating the rapid saltatory conduction of impulses, is made in the central nervous system  by the oligodendrocytes , cells which also play a crucial role in establishing axoglial interactions responsible for clustering of sodium channels at the nodes of Ranvier . Because a single OLG forms multiple myelin internodes, loss of even few cells leads to demyelination of several axons. During embryogenesis, OLGs arise from a pool of progenitors within the ventricular and subventricular zone  .
Cardiovascular  disease remains the leading cause of death in the United States,  although it is preventable through nutrition and physical activity. Latinos are less likely to receive prevention messages than other racial/ethnic groups  in part due to limited access to health services. Computer technology is rarely used for health promotion among Latinos, although it may greatly extend the reach, fidelity and sustainability of health promotion efforts.
The capacity of the adult cortex to undergo reorganization was first demonstrated in the pioneering studies of Merzenich, Kaas and colleagues . In these studies the median nerve, which innervates the medial volar surface of the hand in primates, was transected and electrophysiological recordings were carried out in the somatosensory cortex. Acute mapping revealed that islands of novel receptive field inputs conveyed by the intact radial and ulnar nerves were immediately expressed in the “median nerve cortex” .

These drug candidates are a challenge to deliver via the oral route as their absorption is often poor and unpredictable when administered in conventional  dosage forms . These pharmacokinetic studies are commonly performed in rats and dogs with rat studies being more common, at least in early discovery, as smaller animals are cheaper to house and maintain.
Chronic pain conditions such as JPFS can affect numerous domains of functioning including physical , , social  and psychological functioning , , . Assessments of physical and psychosocial functioning in JPFS, as in most studies of chronic pain, have relied almost exclusively on self report , .
