Moreover, focal adhesion assembly plays a key role in the generation of strong traction forces. Focal adhesion assembly also contributes to cell adhesion strengthening by distributing bond forces along the cell substrate interface .
However, few studies have investigated how executive processes contribute to key cognitive deficits in depression, such as impoverished retrieval of autobiographical memory. Specifically, they assessed how autobiographical memory was associated with tasks of executive control and found that errors on the control tasks negatively correlated with ability to retrieve specific memories, or memories of contextualized events that lasted less than one day. Functional avoidance takes place when the retrieval of overgeneral memories occurs to minimize negative affect as these memories, relative to specific negative memories, contain fewer details about the sensory and perceptual features of negative experiences .
Despite known health risks, nicotine use remains high, especially in populations diagnosed with mental illnesses, including anxiety disorders and Post Traumatic Stress Disorder . Smoking in these populations may relate to the effects of nicotine on emotional memories. The current study examined the effects of nicotine administration on the extinction of conditioned fear memories .
Kv4.2 channels underlie the transient A type K+ current  in hippocampal dendrites where they control the amplitude of back propagating action potentials and shape postsynaptic responses . Recent studies have shown that Kv4.2 channels in hippocampus undergo activity dependent internalization in response to activation of synaptic glutamate receptors resulting in altered IA and enhanced magnitude of long term potentiation  . This is consistent for a role of Kv4.2 channels in controlling postsynaptic responses that contribute to synaptic plasticity  .
Since 1996, the zoonotic threat of avian influenza viruses  has been exemplified by the direct transmission of the H5N1 from poultry to humans in many countries throughout the world, including Asia, Africa and Europe . In poultry, the virulence of AIV determines its classification as either low pathogenic or highly pathogenic virus. Infection with low pathogenic AIV strains produces asymptomatic to mild respiratory and enteric disease, while infection with the highly pathogenic strains results in clinical illness and systemic disease .
Acute ischemic stroke  treatment is limited to IV or intra arterial  tissue plasminogen activator  and mechanical endovascular therapies. These strategies benefit eligible patients, but carry inherent risks, thereby making determination of individual risk versus benefit important when considering recanalization therapies. The most commonly assessed stroke risk factors are age, infarct volume, and baseline National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale  score.
Anaplastic astrocytomas  are diffusely infiltrative astrocytic tumors with cellular anaplasia and mitotic activity but, unlike glioblastoma , they have neither microvascular proliferation nor necrosis . Although less aggressive than GBM, mortality is still quite high with a five year survival rate of only 25.9 % . The prognostic role of isocitrate dehydrogenase  mutations in gliomas has recently been gaining significant attention .
Encapsulating chemotherapeutics within liposomes significantly reduces the toxicity of those drugs . In order to reliably activate the particle in the region of interest, the development of imaging methods to track the particle is required. Image guidance methods using magnetic resonance imaging, ultrasound, and X Ray computed tomography are well known ; however, image guidance using nuclear medicine techniques are attractive due to their high sensitivity.
Known demographic risk factors for poor sleep include older age, female sex, non White race, less education, low income, and being unmarried. Medical and psychological risk factors include cardiac problems , congestive heart failure, and angina), use of certain medications, physical inactivity, depression, and anxiety . The potential effects of anger expression on sleep quality have not been evaluated in patients with CHD .
Exposure to ethanol during the development of the central nervous system  can lead to a wide array of neuroanatomical, behavioral and cognitive abnormalities, broadly subsumed under the Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder  classification. Despite concerted efforts to increase awareness of the dangers of developmental alcohol exposure, the incidence of alcohol related developmental disorders has continued to escalate since it was first characterized 40 years ago . The developing nervous system is not uniformly sensitive to ethanol neurotoxicity.
There is a high prevalence of depression in patients with diabetes. Approximately one third of diabetic patients also exhibit comorbid depression, and the odds of developing depression double in diabetics over the general population . Both diabetics  and those with depression  can exhibit increased plasma cortisol, as well as increased sensitivity to acute and chronic stress.
Individuals infected with HIV 1 are at risk of developing HIV associated neurocognitive disorders  despite the availability of combined antiretroviral therapy . The psychostimulant effect of METH apparently results from an elevated extracellular dopamine  concentration in the striatum, but METH abuse also impairs attention, working memory and executive functions . The various affected brain structures and neural circuits suggest pathological consequences beyond the dopaminergic system  .
Due to its role in telomerase activity, hTERT has been targeted to inhibit telomerase activity, and downregulation of hTERT was shown to decrease proliferation cancer cells  and increase apoptosis  and chemosensitivity  . Expression of hTERT is primarily regulated by the core promoter located 180 to +1 relative to the transcription initiation site , and this core promoter contains five Sp1 binding sites and one E box as a c myc binding site  . These binding sites are important for promoter activity, and the middle three Sp1 binding sites have been shown to be essential for hTERT expression in several cancer cell lines .
The postsynaptic density protein 95  is one of the most abundant proteins present at excitatory postsynaptic sites in the CNS . Therefore, regulation of PSD 95 synaptic clustering during development is likely essential for proper synapse formation. Electrophysiological studies in c Abl−/− mice have shown that c Abl is required for the regulation of neurotransmitter release at Schaffer collateralCA1 synapses .
Laser light has been shown to be an effective nerve stimulus. For example, Wells et al.  have stimulated rat peripheral nerves, Izzo et al.  have stimulated gerbil cochlea and Fried et al.  have stimulated the rat cavernous nerve. Electrical stimulation requires an electrode to be in contact with the neuron, which may damage the tissue under investigation.

Based on qualitative observations, they proposed that all stripe types receive inputs from the same V1 layers  and that their V1 input is tangentially segregated into only two pathways:  CO blob columns to thin stripes,  interblob columns to pale and thick stripes  .

The effects of TF on vascular cells could be mediated through localized procoagulant effects of this receptor, irrespectively of its cellular source, leading to the generation of factor Xa and thrombin, followed by the deposition of fibrin and activated platelets ;. Similar to other pain medications, opioids have well documented side effects such as nausea, constipation, and sedation. A notable feature of physical dependence on opioid is the hyperalgesic response during opioid withdrawal . Recently, hyperalgesia has also been demonstrated in the absence of overt opioid withdrawal in preclinical models of opioid exposure , indicating a paradoxical phenomenon of opioid induced hyperalgesia .

Many human tumors produce low levels of chemokines, while others produce chemokines for which effector T cells lack receptors. For example, we gave lymphocytes expressing a chimeric antigen receptor  specific for the GD2 tumor associated antigen to subjects with neuroblastoma .
Erectile dysfunction  is associated with cardiovascular disease , however the association between change in ED status over time and future underlying CVD risk is unclear .
The pathophysiology of hepatic IR injury is complex and involves a complex orchestration of necrosis, apoptosis and inflammation mediated by hepatic  and extra hepatic  components . We recently developed a murine model of liver IR induced AKI characterized by early renal endothelial cell apoptosis and dysfunction, proximal tubule inflammation and necrosis . Therefore, AKI developed due to liver IR is a disease of early endothelial cell apoptosis and dysfunction along with renal inflammation with subsequent F actin degradation and tubular necrosis .
Catheter ablation has become an integral part of the management of atrial fibrillation  when a strategy to preserve normal sinus rhythm is required. However, critical details of the technique are still controversial, the procedure demands high technical dexterity and carries significant risk of complications. Additionally, ablation of the left atrial posterior wall can lead to esophageal damage, which in turn can cause atrio esophageal fistula, a deadly complication.
This qualitative study is part of a larger mixed methods evaluation of a state small grants program for pregnancy prevention . The last decade has brought increasing consensus in the field of sex education on the importance of medical accuracy and science based practices , what constitutes an effective program , and what parents and adolescents want from sex education . Science based practices include identifying public health objectives, specifying goals for behavior changes, logic models, selecting or developing curricula using behavioral/social science research, and integrating evaluation into program development, adaptation, implementation and assessment  .
More than 90% of human cases of invasive PDAC harbor activating mutations in the proto oncogene Kras . According to the idea that Kras is a critical driver in disease initiation, endogenous expression of a KrasG12D mutant allele in the pancreas of genetically engineered mouse models faithfully reproduced the histological changes characteristic of human tumors . These included the formation of intraepithelial neoplasias , the most common precursor lesions observed in human PDAC.
The US has made little progress in the last three decades in protecting its young people against teen pregnancies and HIV and other sexually transmitted infections  . Youth are becoming sexually experienced early  , and the proportion increases steadily through high school: more than two thirds of high school seniors have had sex . Moreover, almost 40% of US teens who are sexually active reported not using a condom during their last intercourse  .
African Americans have a higher incidence and overall mortality of lung cancer compared to Caucasians. The reasons for these disparities have been debated extensively, with arguments including increased susceptibility and more aggressive biologic features for lung cancer in African Americans, increased stage of disease at diagnosis, and less aggressive treatment being offered for early stage disease. Survival analyses of patients participating in cooperative groups clinical trials, which provide for uniform extent of disease and therapy, showed statistically significantly worse survival at one year for African American patients.

The thioredoxin  system is one of the main ubiquitously expressed thiol reducing antioxidant systems. Trx1 has been described as growth regulator, transcriptional factor regulator, co factor apart from its very important anti oxidative role  .
The biochemical purification of proteins and macromolecular complexes has become the rate limiting step in structure determination by single particle cryo electron microscopy . A purification protocol of a recombinant protein for structural studies typically consists of an affinity chromatography step followed by size exclusion chromatography. We have recently introduced “monolayer purification”, a technique that combines protein purification with specimen preparation, as a fast and easy way to prepare specimens suitable for single particle EM, requiring only low expression levels or low concentrations of His tagged protein .
In both Menkes Disease, with low levels of copper, and Wilson's disease, with elevated levels of copper, neural function is impaired . These diseases are rare, caused by mutations in ATP7A and ATP7B, respectively. In addition to these two copper transporting P type ATPases, the uptake and tissue specific distribution of dietary copper involves additional transporters and copper binding chaperones .
Taking pain relief as an example, it is believed that analgesic treatments consist of two components: the treatment specific effect from the physical or pharmacological interventions, and the non specific, or placebo, component. Acupuncture has been studied in almost one thousand different randomized controlled trials  . Importantly, basic science research investigating acupuncture analgesia on experimental pain, , has implicated overlapping mechanisms involving endogenous opioids and CCK for example, in both acupuncture  and placebo analgesia .
The mammalian telencephalon develops at the rostral end of the neural tube as part of the early forming prosencephalon. The development of the telencephalon is under the guidance of a series of morphogens in and around the forebrain. These cues include Bone Morphogenetic Proteins , Wnts, Fibroblast Growth Factors  and Sonic Hedgehog .
Patients with chronic, life limiting illnesses face serious and confusing health care decisions in the last years of life which are often complicated by documents such as “living wills”. In a systematic review on the accuracy of surrogate decision making, Shalowitz et al concluded that surrogates incorrectly predicted patients' treatment preferences in one third of cases. Of the 16 articles reviewed, only two used an intervention intended to improve surrogate understanding of patient preferences.
Multiple techniques were proposed to analyze large scale biological datasets, some of which were originally applied to gene expression analysis but were then adapted to proteomics studies . A typical approach for the analysis of a large biological dataset is to investigate the presence of enriched gene or protein sets , Molecular Signature Database , or KEGG) in a list of proteins associated with a feature of interest  provided by a proteomics experiment. In addition, especially in the context of proteomics, these methods consider protein membership in annotation protein sets as binary and do not take into account protein quantification measurements, such as spectral counts or relative abundances.
Atrial fibrillation  is the most common sustained heart rhythm abnormality, affecting over 2.2 million adults in the United States. AF is an important risk factor for both incident and recurrent stroke. Cardioembolic stroke, most of which is due to AF, is the most lethal subtype of ischemic stroke and has a higher risk of disability than other stroke subtypes.
In the United States, the use of methadone for addiction is highly regulated and restricted to opioid treatment programs that are certified by both the state and federal governments. In Washington State, there are 11 such programs, all of which are in urban areas. Recognizing that access to opioid replacement therapy is severely limited, the US government passed the Drug Addiction Treatment Act in 2000 , which made it possible for trained physicians to prescribe buprenorphine in their normal clinical practices.
Second harmonic generation  is a nonlinear optical phenomenon where photons interact with a nonlinear material and generate photons with twice the energy. As we show in , neurons patched with whole cell electrodes and filled with FM 4 64 generate strong SHG signals that revealed not just the morphology of the cell body of the neurons, but also that of the main dendritic processes . When FM 4 64 was bath applied, SHG signals outlined the cell bodies of dozens of pyramidal neurons from the CA1 region of the hippocampus .
Mixing commercial facilities, single family housing, and multifamily housing has for centuries enabled residents to walk to multiple near home destinations. In the U.S., this long tradition was broken with the advent of Euclidian zoning, which allowed localities to separate land uses. Originally intended to protect health by separating noxious industrial land from residential areas , segregated land uses are now implicated in modern health problems associated with less walking, heavier weight, and more automobile pollution  .

Peripheral arterial disease  is prevalent in 12% of the United States population, and is associated with increased morbidity and mortality. Ambulatory dysfunction and lower physical activity level of patients with PAD places them at greater risk for disuse atrophy of the lower extremity musculature than is typically observed with normal aging. Patients with intermittent claudication have lower whole body resting energy expenditure than age matched controls, even after adjustment for fat free mass.
Itraconazole  is a systemic triazole antifungal with a broad spectrum of activity commonly used for the treatment of Candida spp. and Aspergillus spp. infections, the most frequent fungal pathogens .
Degenerative disc disease contributes to disability and pain pathology in the cervical and lumbar spine in over 80% of the US population. Intervertebral disc  degeneration is believed to arise from aging related changes in density and phenotype of the nucleus pulposus  cells in the disc. Juvenile NP cells have been characterized via the presence of brachyury T and production of extracellular matrix molecules .,, One of the most striking features of juvenile, young NP cells is their ability to remain rounded and form cell clusters, containing three or more cells.,, Studies that quantify percentage of NP cells that appear in cell clusters indicate significantly greater number of NP cell clusters present in juvenile tissue compared to mature or degenerated tissue in rat and human.
Despite a relatively low incidence, NETs represent a significant clinical challenge in diagnosis and clinical management. Conventional chemotherapy lacks effectiveness and specificity and is not considered for first line therapy in most patients . More than 50% of all tumors harbor p53 mutations, and more than 80% of tumors have an impaired p53 signaling pathway.
Hospitalization is common among older persons, and results in substantial morbidity and costs. The Medicare age population experiences a rate of hospitalization of 17.5% or 6.4 million per year, comprising over 49% of acute hospital days, and resulting in over $148.2 billion of annual Medicare expenditures. Frequently, hospitalization can initiate the terminal downward spiral for an older person.
Packaging regulations including pictorial health warning labels and restrictions on industry branding are central to global tobacco control, but regulations in the US have allowed the industry to promote smoking through cigarette packs virtually unrestricted. Scientists and policymakers have identified research that can inform the implementation of pictorial warning labels in the US, including studies determining how to optimize pictorial warning label impact on public health, how warnings affect smoking cessation in high risk subgroups, and how additional packaging regulations  may promote public health. Among the groups where packaging regulations could be effective at reducing smoking, young adult smokers stand out.
Data on sensitive behaviors are generally regarded as prone to various forms of misreporting and self reports of sexual behavior are thought to have particularly low reliability and validity, especially in the context of risk for HIV . While there is no “gold standard” that can be used to evaluate the accuracy of reports, self administered questionnaires  are widely thought to elicit better data . Prior items in a survey have been shown to affect responses to later items, since participants tend to eliminate information from their responses if the information has already been captured through previous questions .
The ubiquitous expression of the SMN protein is consistent with an essential role in the biogenesis of UsnRNP particles . Yet, in the absence of an identified transcript or group of genes selectively mis spliced in affected tissues it is perplexing how the disruption of a housekeeping function results in a largely neuromuscular phenotype. Obvious suspects include skeletal muscle and motor nerves since the disease phenotype is primarily neuromuscular in origin.
The positioning of proteins and protein motifs relative to either the membrane or to other membrane bound proteins is, for some proteins, critical and may depend upon conformational changes induced upon membrane association . In addition, understanding signaling mechanisms involving these proteins at the molecular level and developing pharmaceutical interventions has been limited by the absence of structural detail for these proteins in the membrane bound state. In particular it has been suggested that insertion of the N terminal arm and subsequent displacement of the core domain from the lipid membrane will expose binding sites on the core, facilitating interaction with host proteins .
Importantly, non declarative memory has been anatomically dissociated from declarative memory by the fact that procedural learning does not rely on the medial temporal lobe structures for consolidation  . Extending these findings, researchers demonstrated that: 1) improvement in performance on the texture discrimination task requires nocturnal sleep that lasts for at least six hours ; 2) 60 90 minutes of daytime sleep also produces retinotopically specific learning ; 3) primary visual areas show increased fMRI BOLD signals after sleep, which correlate with performance improvement . Many nocturnal sleep studies, however, are confounded by fatigue effects of sleep deprivation, circadian effects on memory performance, and interference effects on the waking control group.
Positron emission tomography  is a powerful and widely used diagnostic tool that has the advantages of high sensitivity  and ability to provide quantitative imaging analyses of in vivo abnormalities. In several studies, PET has been used to investigate the pharmacokinetics and biodistribution of 64Cu labeled NPs. However, there are two inherent limitations associated with the use of radiometal chelator complexes for nuclear imaging and in vivo study of NPs.
Acute HIV infection  is the period just following HIV infection when, due to a lack of an immediate immune response, the viral burden is dramatically high before receding to a lower set point . During AHI, the HIV transmission risk is sharply elevated, and up to 40% of new HIV infections are attributed to transmission during this brief period of time . Previous research has demonstrated that some individuals diagnosed with AHI continue to engage in sexual activity, including unprotected sex, suggesting that interventions beyond post test counseling are needed to reduce forward transmission .
When the ethanol is withdrawn , these previously compensatory neuroadaptive processes exhibit overcompensation , leading to the CNS hyperexcitability signs that are characteristic of the withdrawal syndrome . Symptoms of ethanol withdrawal in animals are similar to those seen in humans, and include tremor, other motoric dysfunctions, autonomic overactivity and, in the most severe cases, seizures  . The brain region and circuit involved in naturally occurring, genetically determined differences in neural activation associated with ethanol withdrawal are not known.
This model successfully accounts for a number of adaptation phenomena, including: savings, wherein the second adaptation to a task is faster than the first ; anterograde interference, wherein learning a second task interferes with the recall of the first task ; and spontaneous recovery, wherein if an adaptation period is followed by a brief reverse adaptation period, a subsequent period in which errors are clamped to zero causes a rebound toward the initial adaptation  . How these proposed fast and slow processes area organized, however, is ambiguous. Because the two state model is linear, it can account for the above data with either a serial organization, in which the fast process updates its state from motor errors and sends its output to the slow process, or a parallel organization, in which both the fast and slow processes simultaneously update their states from errors .
Dendritic cells  are an essential component of immune responses through their capacity to capture, process, and present antigens to T cells . Antigen presentation by immature DCs usually results in immune tolerance because of the lack of costimulatory molecules . Activated , antigen loaded DCs initiate the differentiation of antigen specific T cells into effector T cells displaying unique functions and cytokine profiles.
Over the last several years, advances have been made in understanding the development of ND. What is the subsequent symptomatic course following the initial experience of dependence? Are there specific sequences according to which symptoms are experienced?
Orthostatic intolerance  is defined by signs and symptoms of lightheadedness, tachycardia, diaphoresis, heat, hypotension, hyperpnea, headache, nausea, fatigue, cognitive deficits, and exercise intolerance while upright relieved by recumbence ;. POTS patients often report “Brain Fog” while upright to describe impaired awareness, mental confusion, lightheadedness, mental fatigue, and cognitive deficits, especially of working memory  . Although CBF decreases excessively in POTS compared to controls , we later showed mean CBF was abnormally reduced only in some during rapid orthostasis .
Representations are cognitive constructs in which features of the external world are abstracted and mirrored in the nervous system as “functioning isomorphisms” . Operations performed on representations allow extrapolation of implicit properties of real world systems , so under appropriate conditions, one can infer the “use” of particular representations through controlled behavioral tests. In the original sense of the British empiricists, these “associative” relationships are thus restricted to correlations that would enable a hypothetical rational observer to make an inference of causality  .
The ribosome is a complex macromolecular machine composed of three strands of RNA and over 50 proteins. In the current work, a general method is presented for the analysis of incomplete and complete ribosomal particles assembled in vivo. However, the abundance of cofactors involved in 50S assembly has offered the opportunity to study intermediates induced as a result of cofactor disruption, including those resulting from the deletion of SrmB, CsdA and DnaK or DnaJ, and mutations to CgtAE and DbpA.
Heat shock proteins , the functional components of the inducible heat shock response are implicated in the regulation of tumorigenesis by virtue of their ability to promote tumor cell survival . However, the only in vivo genetic evidence of a pro tumorigenic role for the stress response is the abrogation of tumor formation in mice deficient for heat shock factor 1 , the transcription factor essential for the expression of multiple HSPs . Extracellular HSP70 regulates these diverse immunoregulatory activities by acting as a cytokine to stimulate the release of pro inflammatory factors from immune cells  or from tumor cells .
This phenotype is recapitulated in zebrafish, in which disruption of p63 results in a lack of epidermal morphogenesis . Taken together, these data suggest that p63 plays critical roles in development, maintenance, and differentiation of stem cells in stratified epithelia . The p63 gene is expressed as six different transcripts in mammalian cells, all of which encode a DNA binding domain with significant homology to that of p53 .
These conditions can have a negative impact on a woman’s quality of life. Although PFDs are common, it is estimated that a small proportion of affected individuals will ever seek care for their symptoms. For example, it is estimated that only 26% of symptomatic women will seek care for UI.
In post traumatic stress disorder  as well as other anxiety disorders, normally adaptive fear responses become dysfunctional or maladaptive  when behavioral responses are no longer commensurate with appropriate fear for the situation, or when behavior disrupts normal daily functioning. Although extinction training is often spaced over several days, some recent findings indicate that the massed presentation of the CS initiates the process of extinction successfully, and that massed procedures produce fear extinction that is effective for both short  and long term reduction in fear response . Several studies found that early extinction produces weak extinction that does not produce long lasting suppression of fear , and even when early extinction occurred, it was found to be less effective at reducing long term fear as measured by the spontaneous recovery of fear, and did not show evidence for erasure of fear  .
In 2008, 1 in every 7 US households was food insecure, or at risk of going hungry because of an inability to afford food. Food insecurity generally occurs cyclically and episodically, with periods of food adequacy followed by food scarcity; the average food insecure household experiences seven episodes of food scarcity annually. We hypothesized that the cyclic nature of food insecurity, and its associated fluctuations in dietary intake, would predispose patients with diabetes to wide variations in blood glucose levels, including clinically significant hypoglycemia .
Epidemiologic and animal studies support the health benefits of habitual green tea consumption that include anti obesity properties , reduced risk of cardiovascular disease , decreased levels of oxidative stress ; as well as anti proliferative , anti inflammatory  and anti diabetic effects . A number of mechanisms have been proposed by which green tea and its constitutive polyphenolic catechins may modulate body weight   . For example, green tea and its extracts have been shown to induce carbohydrate malabsorption ; downregulate fatty acid synthase  ; suppress pancreatic and gastric lipase ; induce thermogenesis  ; incite sympathetic nervous system activity and lipolysis ; reduce adipocyte differentiation ; and alter the satiety response  .
Numerous studies have associated the mesolimbic dopaminergic  system, originating from the ventral tegmental area , with ethanol addiction. For instance,  ethanol consumption is reduced by the administration of dopamine antagonists  or agonists , or by the genetic deletion of dopamine D1 receptors  ;  pharmacological manipulations of VTA DA neuron activity alter ethanol consumption ;  ethanol increases dopamine release, from both the synaptic terminals ) and the somatodendritic region in the VTA ; and  ethanol stimulates the spontaneous activity of VTA DA neurons . Glutamate, the main excitatory neurotransmitter in the brain, excites VTA DA neurons .
Metal organic frameworks  have attracted the interest of chemists, physicists, and materials scientists due to their promising applications in catalysis, separations, optics, magnetism, host guest chemistry and gas storage, as well as for the variety of their often esthetically pleasing, highly symmetric structures. ,  The principal interest in the latter complexes has been their relevance to the active center of particulate Methane Monooxygenase  and other multicopper oxidases. , ,  The investigation of the fundamental properties of these complexes have revealed interesting redox, magnetic, and spectroscopic properties.
Fucosylation, the modification of proteins or glycans with a 6 deoxy monosaccharide, L fucose, plays critical roles in many physiological and pathological processes. Tissue development, fertilization and cell adhesion rely on proper protein fucosylation. For example, deficiency in fucosylation impairs leukocyte vascular epithelium interactions, which leads to a congenital disorder known as leukocyte adhesion deficiency type II .
Fluorescence spectroscopy has changed significantly in recent years due to the discovery of Metal Enhanced Fluorescence , a metalfluorophore interaction that greatly increases the observed emission intensity . Since the discovery of MEF the phenomenon has been applied to several bioassays . Furthermore, many studies of MEF have been conducted and the results were obtained using a sample geometry where two metal deposited slides are sandwiched together with the fluorescent sample within.
Many preclinical studies have examined the influence of pharmacological agents on the dose related effects of self administered cocaine to evaluate potential pharmacotherapies for cocaine addiction . Despite these advances, little is known regarding which neural systems regulate dose related changes in responding maintained by self administered cocaine. Thus, either the dorsal striatum or orbitofrontal cortex might be components of the neural circuitry that regulate responding in relation to cocaine dose if different unit doses reflect a change in reinforcer magnitude .
Anaplastic lymphoma kinase  positive Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma  is an aggressive T cell lymphoma that carries a chromosomal translocation involving the ALK gene . Currently, a multi drug chemotherapy approach is the mainstream treatment for ALCL . However, the chemotherapy used is neither cell  nor gene specific.
Functions of this family of cytokines in mucosal immunity are complex and overlapping due to the combinatorial expression of shared and specific receptor subunits on various cell types. Inflammatory mononuclear cells are a major source of OSM , while its specific receptors, consisting of gp130 and an OSM specific receptor beta subunit  are broadly expressed by structural cells, such as fibroblasts, osteoblasts, smooth muscles cells and endothelial cells . Additionally, myeloid dendritic cells  express OSM receptors and respond to OSM by differentiating into potent antigen presenting cells .
Toxoplasma gondii derived pattern activation molecular patterns , namely cyclophilin 18 and profilin have been shown to be recognized by receptors present in macrophages and dendritic cells, triggering cell activation and production of pro inflammatory cytokines, including IL 1β, IL 6 and IL 12. While cyclophilin 18 is recognized by both mouse and human CCR5 , profilin has been shown to mediate powerful cytokine production from mouse dendritic cells via activation of TLR11 . IL 12 mediated induction of type 1 immunity is crucial for containing parasite replication and mediating long term immunity to infection.
To date, approximately 100% of large molecule drugs do not cross the BBB and 98% of small molecules cannot penetrate this barrier, thereby limiting drug development efforts for many CNS disorders. The development of successful gene therapies for motor neuron disease will likely require widespread transduction within the spinal cord and motor cortex. Two of the most common motor neuron diseases are SMA and ALS, both debilitating disorders of children and adults, respectively, with no effective therapies to date.
Breast cancer is the most common type of female cancer and represents 14% of cancer related deaths in women . It has been estimated that there will be about 226,870 new cases of breast cancer in United States in 2012, and about 39,510 women will die from this disease . Global gene expression profiling studies have produced a new molecular classification of breast cancer with 4 distinct subtypes : lumunal, HER2, basal like, and unclassified .
In the absence of a single unifying molecular genetic event leading to the disease manifestation, the focus of new therapies should be based on biological pathways critical to tumor survival,,. The increased cytokine levels lead to an up regulation of signaling pathways within myeloma cells that ultimately results in increased transcription of proliferation related genes and decreased transcription of apoptosis promoting genes. Cytokine induced signaling pathways include the Jak/Stat3, PI3K/Akt, and Ras/MEK/MAPK pathways, , , .
One of the hallmarks of cancer is its resistance to apoptosis, a programmed form of cell death important in both the development and maintenance of higher organisms. This resistance enables cancerous cells to survive and divide even in the presence of endogenous pro apoptotic stimuli. Morphologically, apoptosis is characterized by cell shrinkage and membrane blebbing, which facilitate the engulfment and recycling of cellular components without provoking the inflammatory response.
Pacemaker cells  within the sinoatrial node  generate the electrical impulse that initiates each heartbeat. Sinus node dysfunction , characterized by loss of PCs and SAN fibrosis, is a common but poorly understood disease. With the advent of cellular reprogramming technology,,  there is increasing interest in understanding gene regulatory networks in PCs, both to improve our understanding of SND and to facilitate novel therapies such as biological pacemakers and SAN regeneration .
It has also been shown that Signal Transducer and Activator of Transcription 3  is frequently activated in lung cancer and functions as an oncogene . The JAK/STAT3 signaling pathway plays important roles in carcinogenesis because many Stat3 target genes including cyclin D1, Bcl XL, Mcl1, Hspa1a and Cryab are involved in cell proliferation and survival . Therefore, it has been targeted for cancer therapy .
Individual differences in risk for mood and anxiety disorders likely stem from multiple predisposing factors, including genetic variants that shape the developmental formation and/or adult functional integrity of the neural circuitry subserving emotion . In preclinical models of these disorders, inbred mouse strains exhibit marked differences in anxiety  and fear related phenotypes. Of note, the C57BL/6J strain typically shows lesser anxiety  and stress related behavior but greater conditioned fear behavior relative to certain other strains including BALB/cJ and in some cases DBA/2J ) .
Crystallography of the monomethylamine methyltransferase revealed that the UAG codon is decoded as a novel amino acid, pyrrolysine . Organisms whose genomes possess genes for these methylamine methyltransferases additionally have five pyl genes necessary for the genetic encoding and biosynthesis of pyrrolysine. The pylT gene encodes tRNAPyl , while the adjacent pylS encodes a novel class II aminoacyl tRNA synthetase .
The p75 neurotrophin receptor  is a potential therapeutic target for AD . p75NTR regulates neuron survival, function and structure by acting in concert with a collection of ligands and co receptors . p75NTR also regulates neurite outgrowth through its interactions with the Nogo and LINGO co receptors .
MSC proliferation and differentiation are controlled by a coordinated action of several signaling pathways including Wnt , Notch , BMP , and others such as acetylcholine  that has not yet been explored . Recent studies demonstrate that the cholinergic system also plays a role in regulating the function of non neural tissues or cells . The cholinergic system is composed of acetylcholine , acetyltransferase, acetylcholinesterase and acetylcholine receptors .
Due to the functional importance of the basement membrane and its role in many cellular processes and organ functions, a method for detecting the integrity of the BM may allow noninvasive and early detection of developmental and disease processes. The kidney is an excellent organ in which to study BM targeted contrast agents, since 150 L of filtrate must pass through the glomerular basement membrane  in humans each day. Endothelial cells lining the glomerular capillaries are fenestrated by 30 100 nm openings into the GBM, and GBM contains proteoglycans which form an anionic charge barrier.
At the postsynaptic level, type A1 adenosine receptors  and type D1 dopamine receptors  form heterodimers on striatal neurons of the direct pathway, whereas heterodimers of A2A adenosine receptors  and D2 dopamine receptors  form on neurons of the indirect pathway ). In vitro and in vivo studies indicate that the transcription factor NF κB  promotes the expression of A1AR and D2R, but suppresses the expression of A2AAR and D1R, thereby participating in the regulation of receptor density in the striatum. As compared with genetically intact mice, mice with genetic deletion of the p50 subunit of NF κB  show greater striatal expression of A2AAR, but reduced expression of A1AR and D2R .
Individuals with physical disabilities are as sexually active and have the same reproductive health needs as those without a disability . However, individuals with disabilities experience multiple physical and attitudinal barriers to reproductive health services . Previous research shows reduced cervical and breast cancer screening among women with disabilities .
Airway epithelial overexpression of the epithelial Na+ channel β subunit , driven by the Clara cell secretory protein  promoter in transgenic  mice, results in epithelial Na+ hyperabsorption, airway surface liquid  dehydration, impaired mucus clearance, airway inflammation and early post natal mortality . The Scnn1b Tg mouse model recapitulates many features of cystic fibrosis  and other human airway diseases associated with relative dehydration of airway surfaces , including chronic bronchitis  and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease . At birth, the lungs of Scnn1b Tg mice are morphologically normal, but rapidly develop time dependent abnormalities .
Viral reverse transcription is prevented in primary macrophages when cells are infected with either Vpx deficient SIVmac or HIV 2 . Interestingly, Vpx also increases the ability of HIV 1 to efficiently infect macrophages, dendritic cells and resting CD4+ T cells when Vpx is incorporated into HIV 1 particles or supplied in trans . Recent work identified SAMHD1 as the protein that blocks infection of SIVΔVpx, HIV 2ΔVpx and HIV 1 before reverse transcription in macrophages, dendritic cells and resting CD4+ T cells .
Increased STM capacity is required in adults when listening to speech in noise . Children in the 6 to 11 year age range showed poorer performance than adults, whereas the 12 to15 year olds performed at an adult level. As STM increases with age, children may be better able to meet the capacity demands required for auditory processing when listening to speech in noise.
Much of what we know about the characteristics of attentional bottlenecks in vision has come from studies in which sequences of brief stimuli are presented to the steadily fixating eye. It allows precise control over the spatial and temporal properties of stimuli, making it possible to study the fine grain properties of attention during brief and manageable intervals of time. These prior results came from studies of saccades made to designated targets, another convenient, but artificial, situation.

Ideally, these studies would be performed using a direct, well controlled injection of the tracer bolus into the feeding vessel. Therefore, accurate quantitative analysis of DCE MRI data requires individually measured arterial input function .
Depletion of ER Ca2+ stores results in ER stress that evokes the unfolded protein response . IP3R activity is regulated by proteins residing in the ER lumen or the cytosol. ER Ca2+ release through the IP3R channel is regulated by the actions of accessory modulating proteins that can interact with the large cytosolic regions of the LBD and the CGD under both normal and certain pathologic conditions, .
However, competitive exclusion may be avoided via a number of mechanisms, including differential resource use , temporally varying condition specific competition , and colonization competition tradeoff across a patchy environment . Testing hypotheses for mechanisms contributing to local or spatially patterned coexistence of invasive and resident species is important for predicting future ecological, economic, or health impacts of invasive species, and tests our understanding of the general mechanisms by which competing species coexist . A number of hypotheses could explain the persistence of A. aegypti after the invasion of A. albopictus at some sites.
Atypical antipsychotic drugs are a mainstay of psychiatric pharmacotherapy and are used to treat a variety of psychiatric illnesses, most notably schizophrenia. These second generation drugs lack the extrapyramidal and other debilitating movement side effects that complicated treatment with first generation compounds. The popularity of the atypical antipsychotics, especially olanzapine, led to the observation that these drugs have distinct metabolic side effects that were not detected during preclinical testing; including, insulin resistance, diabetes, and obesity .
Endocytic recycling in neurons is remarkable both for its high throughput and biochemical selectivity. The ability of neurons to respond effectively to repetitive ligand induced activation, and for the recycling pathway to support enhanced postsynaptic signaling on a timescale of minutes , suggest that the recycling pathway is capable of delivering significant numbers of signaling receptors to appropriate regions of the somatodendritic surface very rapidly. First, given the high degree of selectivity evident in endocytic regulation, what determines whether a particular signaling receptor is capable of entering the rapid recycling pathway?
Increased interest in inflammation has led to the investigation of additional inflammatory mediators, including the matrix metalloproteinase  family of enzymes. Matrix metalloproteinases are proteolytic enzymes that degrade the extracellular matrix , the basement membrane, and play a role in tissue repair and vascular remodeling . At this point, 23 MMPs have been identified in humans, but substrate specificity for MMPs is not completely characterized.
Domoic acid is a small neurotoxic molecule that is naturally produced by phytoplankton and accumulates in seafood products during harmful algal blooms  . The toxin was first identified in 1987 when over 100 people became ill and four died after consuming domoic acid contaminated mussels . For humans, risks of exposure to high levels of domoic acid are managed by testing shellfish and regulating harvests based on toxin loads ; however, there are no regulatory guidelines in place for protection from long term low level repetitive exposure  due to a lack of knowledge regarding the health impacts of chronic or episodic low level domoic acid exposure  .
Gene prediction programs identify protein coding genes using either ab initio prediction, evidence based prediction, or a combination of the two methods. One of the most challenging aspects of dispersed community annotation is the need to maintain consistent data formats, and to minimize the potential for duplicated annotation made simultaneously by two different annotators . The main mistake during manual annotation from previous genome projects was allowing the submission of incomplete data and data inconsistent with itself.
While studies are being conducted to identify and standardize approaches that will circumvent these issues , it is equally important to use these new approaches for re evaluation of existing biomarkers. Mass spectrometric methods of detection can shed light on the existence of structural variants that might serve as biomarkers with better sensitivity and specificity than their wild type proteins. More importantly, a structural variant of hemoglobin  is currently being used to assess glycemic control in people with diabetes, and has been proposed as a useful method of screening for and diagnosing diabetes  .
Cell based repair of small cartilage defects in the knee joint was first demonstrated clinically fifteen years ago. Many cartilage tissue engineering studies use chondrocytes as the cell source, however this approach is challenged by limited supply of chondrocytes, their limited regenerative potential due to age, disease, de differentiation during in vitro expansion, and the morbidity caused by chondrocyte harvest. Clinical translation of tissue engineered cartilage is currently limited by inadequate construct structure, mechanical function, and integration Currently, most tissue engineered constructs for articular cartilage repair possess cartilage mimetic material properties only after long term  in vitro culture.
Beyond its structural impacts on the genome, DNA content variation may have ecological and evolutionary significance , because GS correlates with a range of phenotypes, including flowering time, flower size, seed mass, leaf size and photosynthetic rate . Moreover, several studies have reported within species correlations between GS and ecological variables, such as altitude, latitude and temperature . Because the efficacy of selection is expected to scale with Ne, the lack of relationship between GS and Ne may indicate that selection has had little impact on the broad scale evolution of GS in higher plants .
Stroke is a leading cause of death nationally and internationally  and is associated with enormous public health burden, reductions in quality of life, increased health care costs, and a loss in economic productivity. Stroke is the 4th leading cause of death in the U.S. . In South Carolina, stroke was the 3rd leading cause of death and ranked 8th among other states in 2006 .
Large scale genetic screens of families with autism spectrum disorder  and intellectual disabilities  have identified hundreds of risk genes that converge on synaptic abnormalities as the core cause., The prevalence of these neurodevelopmental disorders underscores the importance of identifying key synaptic regulators and the underlying mechanisms whereby they control cognition and behavior. APC is a ubiquitiously expressed, large scaffold protein with multiple binding partners and functions. It is the major negative regulator of β catenin levels in the canonical Wnt pathway, serving as an essential component of the multi molecular degradation complex that targets β catenin for ubiquitin mediated proteosomal degradation.
Still, clinical success of adoptive immunotherapeutic approaches have been restricted to about 50% of patients, who show mostly partial rather than complete clinical responses  . Several factors clearly influence the challenge of an efficient immunotherapy: thymic selection, tumor released inhibitory cytokines and chemokines, the presence of regulatory T cells, altered macrophage differentiation, and defects in DCs . Consistent with this idea, we have previously shown that vaccination with mouse TRP 2, a melanoma associated self antigen , had only minor protective/therapeutic effect on B16 tumor challenge, due to an abortive immune response .
Oligodendrocyte precursor cells  are generated from progenitor zones in the forebrain beginning at various times during embryonic development . Sonic Hedgehog regulates the production of OPCs from ventral progenitor zones, but the signaling pathways that regulate the dorsal generation of OPCs are only beginning to be elucidated  . Wnts have prominent roles in progenitor cell proliferation, cell lineage and differentiation decisions .
Complete deficiency of the enzyme results in classic citrullinemia. This disorder is typically associated with elevations in citrulline above 1500 μM and is associated with significant long term neurological disability . However it has been recognized that some patients with milder deficiency may present with later onset of learning disabilities, in acute crisis in pregnancy  or as an incidental finding with good long term follow up  .
In this study we provide global transcriptomic profiling and analysisof botulinum toxin A treated muscle over a 1 yearperiod .
Current imaging methods, such as x ray angiography, magnetic resonance imaging , intravascular ultrasound , computed tomography, and optical coherence tomography  allow exquisite delineation of advanced lesions. As the gold standard, histology provides high performance in biopsy studies, but it is not feasible for live tissue imaging. In addition, with technical advances, fluorescence microscopy with one  and two photon excitation has been applied to vascular and atherosclerosis studies,  with the capability of identifying cellular and molecular compositions in vivo with labeling.
Oligomers of N substituted glycines, or “peptoids”, are a new class of unnatural materials that are capable of mimicking the structure and function of peptides and proteins. , Peptoids offer several advantages over peptides as therapeutic or diagnostic agents. They are resistant to proteases and more membrane permeable, due to the lack of amide  NH groups, thus overcoming two major problems associated with peptide drugs.
On any given night, over 40,000homeless adults are on the streets . Based on currenttrends of homelessness in Los Angeles, the population is aging; in particular, datareveal over one third are over 55 years of age  and frailty may be a significant issue . Frailty among vulnerable populations has not been studied widely; however,homeless populations may have a lifetime of risk factors for frailty which mayencompass poor nutrition , chronic diseases such as hypertension  and diabetes , along with the aging ofthe population , histories ofincarceration ,gang related activities and substance abuse which may lead to adverse outcomes .
Effective clinical diagnosis of FAS/FASD depends, in part, on a distinct set of abnormal facial features  . Diagnosis of facial dysmorphology in these guidelines, encompass all or a partial set of distinct facial features; including a smooth philtrum, short palpebral fissure, and thin upper vermilion. Current diagnostic methods for human facial features in FAS/FASD use direct clinical observation , scored assessment of two dimensional photographs , or craniofacial anthropometry  combined with multivariate analysis to assess sets of distinct facial alterations that may be used to classify FASD over a wide age range  .
Unfortunately, one disadvantage to single intracranial injections of rAAV vectors into the brain parenchyma of large animal models or humans will be the restricted distribution of the rAAV vectors to relatively small volumes of the brain. Convection enhanced delivery  is a method of delivering clinically relevant volumes of therapeutic agents to significantly larger areas of the brain in a direct intracranial injection procedure. The CED method was previously investigated in gene therapy studies as a way to increase the distribution of rAAV2 vectors in the brain.
Substance abuse has been identified as a chronic illness  and research suggests that the behaviors exhibited by substance abusers negatively affect the lives of their family members and intimate partners. Family members with a substance abusing loved one report difficulties in life domains such as emotional and physical wellness, finances, and involvement with the legal system . More specifically, spousal substance abuse has a detrimental impact on family functioning  with the severity of that substance abuse differentially impacting the family unit according to the coping ability of the non alcoholic partner, the extent of outside stressors, and the degree of the alcoholic family member’s pathology  .
The use of flame retardants has contributed to a drastic drop in the incidence of fires in the past thirty years. Although PCBs were banned decades ago, they are still widespread environmental contaminants. PBDEs have been detected in outdoor and indoor air, in sediments, soil, house dust, foods, birds, fish, and marine and terrestrial animals , as well as in human tissues, including adipose tissue, blood and breast milk .
Respiratory syncytial virus  is a major cause of infant morbidity from severe lower respiratory tract infection with bronchiolitis worldwide. Early attempts at vaccination of seronegative infants and young children using formalin inactivated RSV were unsuccessful. Vaccination of BALB/c mice with the formalin inactivated RSV vaccine or RSV proteins  expressed from a recombinant vaccinia virus also results in enhanced pulmonary injury and eosinophilia after intranasal RSV challenge infection, although the exact mechanisms for eosinophilia and enhanced pulmonary diseases in the two models may actually differ .
The LRRK2 protein contains several distinctive structural and functional domains . These include a “Ras of complex proteins” / GTPase domain and a kinase domain that shares a high degree of homology with mitogen activated protein kinases kinase kinase  . Interestingly, of all LRRK2 mutations that have been identified, the substitution of glycine at residue 2019 with serine  at the activation segment of its kinase domain is the most commonly observed .
The HIV 1 matrix  protein represents the N terminal domain of the precursor Gag  protein that directs the assembly of HIV particles . Molecular biology experiments have demonstrated that MA plays essential roles in targeting PrGag proteins to membranes for assembly, and in incorporation of HIV SU/TM  envelope  protein trimers into virus particles . However, alternative membrane binding domains  can replace MA in terms of directing the assembly of virus particles at membranes .
Forkhead box  transcription factors represent a closely related family of proteins that mediate cell cycle progression, survival, and differentiation . Foxd3 is required for maintainingpluripotent cells in the early mouse embryo and Foxd3 knockout mice die early during mouse development since it functions to maintain cells of the inner cell mass , trophoblast progenitors  and neural crest cell precursors . FoxD3 regulates specification of the neural crest lineage.
Small animal models of human disease play an important role in the development of new therapies for human diseases by providing a complete, functional biological system in which the effects of novel interventions may be tested and characterized. To that end, multiple mouse MRI  techniques have the potential to improve experimental throughput, enabling the scanning of entire groups of animals in the time required to image just one, improving statistical power and reducing the cost of powerful imaging techniques in biomedical research  . This leads to frequency differences between volumes of interest and to larger linewidths than in single volume experiments.
, The profilin from T. gondii  is strictly required for the actin dependent gliding motility that enables T. gondii to invade and exit from host cells. ,,, In most eukaryotes, a profilin promotes the rapid elongation of actin filaments by delivering monomeric  actin, or G actin, to the filament barbed ends. ,, Apicomplexans lacking profilin can grow and replicate but they can cannot invade host cells, presumably because their ability to polymerize actin for host invasion is compromised.
A growing body of evidence describes mechanisms underlying the generation and activity of regulatory T cells  that bear the CD4+25+Foxp3+ phenotype . Expression of TSA in thymus, including aire gene directed expression of TSA in medullary thymic epithelial cells, leads to negative selection of T cells specific for TSA , and to positive selection of Tregs specific for TSA , providing protection from autoimmune disease. While the development of Tregs in young mice is largely thymus dependent , CD4+25+ Tregs re develop spontaneously several months following thymectomy .
Transmission of ICWs can involve both gap junction mediated direct cytosol to cytosol diffusion of second messengers such as IP3 and Ca2+, and release of molecules such as ATP that diffuse through extracellular space, interacting with receptors on neighboring cells to mobilize calcium from the intracellular and extracellular compartments  . The main type of glial cell in sensory ganglia is the satellite glial cell . These cells share many properties with astrocytes of the central nervous system , including expression of glutamine synthetase and various neurotransmitter transporters .
The four angle saturation transfer  method enabled for the first time studies of CK kinetics in human heart at 1.5T , and to date remains the only localized ST method applied in patient studies . Because saturation transfer 31P MRS might benefit significantly from an increased signal to noise ratio  and chemical shift dispersion at 3T, as compared to 1.5T , it is desirable to extend ST methods to human studies at 3T . For the CK reaction, a two site model of chemical exchange between PCr and the γ phosphate resonance of ATP  is typically assumed .
Increased OEF can be measured using positron emission tomography  and is a powerful predictor of subsequent ischemic stroke in patients with atherosclerotic carotid artery disease  . The steady state method with inhalation of 15O labeled gas  and the bolus method with bolus injection of 15O labeled water  both require arterial blood sampling during the PET studies in order to convert PET counts into quantitative OEF measurements. In addition, the quantitative processing of OEF images requires considerable technical expertise.
Benzene, a component of gasoline, is associated with various hematological cancers . Multiple possible mechanisms of action are thought to be involved in benzene toxicity . Previously, using microarrays, we reported dose dependent changes in gene expression in peripheral blood mononuclear cells  associated with exposures to benzene ranging from less than 1 ppm to greater than 10 ppm in 83 workers in shoe manufacturing plants in China, compared to unexposed controls .
Recent high throughput sequencing of cancer genomes has led to newdiscoveries of mutations in cellular processes that were not previously known toplay a causal role in cancer. One such processes is RNA splicing . Among the recentlydiscovered spliceosome genes that are involved in cancers, SF3B1 is the mostfrequently mutated.
Surrogate decision makers of critically ill patients often have inaccurate expectations about their loved one's prognosis. This is problematic because prognostic information influences treatment decisions. Despite the importance of effective prognostic communication, there is no practical way to assess whether a physician has effectively communicated prognostic information to a family.
Interleukin 6 has both an acute and chronic inflammatory role . The protein also provides various signals to regulate cell growth , immune responses , and acute phase protein secretion , Interleukin 6 is an important regulator of immune response, inflammation and hematopoiesis . The circulating level of interleukin 6 is usually low in healthy individuals but increases in older adults, often for unclear reasons .
The regulatory functions of CD4+ CD25+ FoxP3+ cells  in maintaining peripheral tolerance, to self antigens has led to studies investigating their use in inhibiting alloreactive T cell responses following allogeneic marrow transplantation. Naturally occurring Tregs can induce transplantation tolerance in mice. ,, Tregs have been reported to act in an antigen specific manner and are known to prevent CD8 T cell mediated allograft rejection.
S100A4, also known as Fsp1 , is well known to be over expressed in fibrotic diseases of the lung, kidney, liver, and heart . Previously, we identified high expression of S100A4 to be associated with adverse clinical pathological factors for endometrial cancer, including higher endometrioid grade, non endometrioid histology, and advanced stage. In normal endometrium and lower grade endometrioid carcinomas, S100A4 protein is only weakly expressed in stromal cells, with no epithelial expression.
Under normal conditions, the pulmonary endothelium forms a thin semipermeable barrier between the vascular space and the interstitial and alveolar spaces allowing for effective gas exchange while preventing the excess leakage of fluid and protein . However, this barrier becomes severely compromised during ARDS . Pulmonary endothelial cell  mechanics play a central role in the regulation of this barrier function as the formation of intercellular gaps and paracellular movement of fluid and solute are the primary mechanism producing vascular leak in pathologic conditions .
First described in yeast , the SUV3 gene was later found to be conserved throughout evolution with orthologs documented in bacteria, plants, nematodes, Drosophila and mammals . The yeast SUV3 protein localizes primarily in the mitochondrial matrix and displays RNA helicase activity . Although originally thought to be exclusively mitochondrial, recent evidence suggests that Supv3L1 may function both in mitochondria and in the nucleus  to modulate key cellular processes such as apoptosis , transcription, recombination and replication .
Neuropeptides and their role in regulating inflammatory processes is becoming a topic of major interest in clinical medicine. It has been established that substance P and calcitonin gene related peptide are associated with inflammation associated pain . Recently, the role of other neuropeptides has been investigated, especially the neurotrophin family, of which brain derived neurotrophic factor  belongs, and have been shown to play a role in airway inflammation .
Aβ is prone to misfolding and aggregating into soluble oligomers, which eventually assembles into the large amyloid fibrils found in AD senile plaques . For example, in AD patients the levels of soluble Aβ correlate with disease severity, while plaques burden does not. Furthermore, APP transgenic mice develop memory deficits when oligomeric Aβ is abundant and months before plaques are detected  .
There is considerable evidence that these adult born granule neurons are physiologically functional  and contribute to hippocampus dependent behaviors . Despite the wide range of behaviors that appear to require new neuron function, little is known about the specific contribution of new neurons to hippocampal function . Based on partial lesion and regional inactivation studies, the predominant view is that the dorsal hippocampus is particularly critical for spatial learning, whereas the ventral hippocampus is involved in regulating fear and anxiety .
Current efficacy data supporting the routine use of acellular dermal matrices  in postmastectomy tissue expander/implant reconstruction is limited. A multi center, blinded, randomized controlled study was designed to evaluate the effectiveness of ADM in the setting of TE/I reconstruction. The primary objective of the study was to determine whether the use of ADM would decrease patient reported, post operative pain.
Inherited deficiency of hepatic alanine:glyoxylate aminotransferase  in primary hyperoxaluria type 1  or glyoxylate reductase/hydroxypyruvate reductase  in primary hyperoxaluria type 2  results in marked overproduction of oxalate by the liver . Oxalate cannot be metabolized in the human body, thus the excess oxalate must be eliminated, largely by the kidneys, resulting in marked hyperoxaluria. High concentrations of oxalate in the urine form complexes and crystals with calcium resulting in urinary tract stones, as well as injury to renal tubule epithelial cells and nephrocalcinosis .
Although the role of B7: CD28 interactions in promoting initial T cell activation is well established, a separate role for B7: CD28 interactions in promoting T cell tolerance has only recently been acknowledged . Investigation of the severe and accelerated diabetes that develops in CD28 deficient  and B7.1/2 double deficient  NOD  mice  revealed that B7: CD28 interactions control regulatory T cells . The results suggest that the B7: CD28 costimulatory pathway is essential for the development and homeostasis of regulatory T cells.
Transforming growth factor βs  are multifunctional cytokines with widespread effects on cell growth and differentiation, migration, and extracellular matrix  deposition, and have key roles in wound repair . With respect to cutaneous repair, TGF β1 and TGF β2 are known to promote fibroplasia and scar, while TGF β3 may or may not reduce scar  . The transition from scarless fetal type repair to adult type repair with scar occurs between days 16  and 18  of gestation in fetal rat skin .
TMS holds significant promise as a tool for cognitive neuroscience  as well as psychiatric research in the areas of depression and obsessive compulsive disorder . Unfortunately, the poor spatial focus of the current generation of TMS coils severely limits the ability of the clinical investigator in psychiatry to more precisely direct neuronal stimulation. Present TMS coilss stimulate large regions of tissue at a time limited to areas near the surface of the brain, as the electric field drops as the inverse of the distance to the coil.
The method is sensitive to changes in the local magnetic field between scans which appear as temperature variations. These changes can result from several sources, including drift in the static field , patient motion outside of the imaging plane, and local or global changes in magnetic susceptibility, which can be altered by heating . The most problematic source of error in this MRI based thermometry method appears to be its sensitivity to motion which causes a misregistration between the images used in the phase subtractions, resulting in artifacts in the resulting temperature estimation.
Podosomes and invadopodia are related cellular structures present in cells with physiologically or pathologically invasive behaviors respectively . The ability of human cancer cells to form invadopodia has been correlated with their invasiveness, both in vitro and in vivo  . One of the major cellular systems for the catalytic generation of ROS is the NADPH oxidase system .
Despite tremendous advances in our understanding of cancer biology and developments in cancer therapeutics, the prognosis for lung cancers remains extremely poor . One of the best resources to study the lung cancer OncoGenome is the formalin fixed paraffin embedded  archival samples. Embedding FFPE tumor tissues facilitates thin sectioning for antigenic analysis.
At the neural systems level, emotion regulation is supported by mature amygdalaprefrontal circuitry in healthy adults . Because of this relative immaturity, external sources  of regulation play a critical role in children's emotion regulation  . The mother* provides widespread regulatory influences in childhood that include physiological, thermal, and nutritional regulation .
Programmed cell death 4  is a novel tumor suppressor that inhibits tumorigenesis by interfering with translation initiation. Pdcd4 exerts its translation inhibitory function largely by inhibiting the helicase activity of the eIF4A ,. The loss of Pdcd4 has been shown to be a prognostic marker for colon cancer progression .
The domestic dog  exhibits the greatest morphologic diversity of any mammal . Variation in size between breeds spans two orders of magnitude with the 1 kg Chihuahua and 100 kg mastiff representing extremes of the continuum. An equally impressive level of variation is apparent when considering conformation.
Endothelial cell proliferation and migration are essential for angiogenesis. Subsequent steps in the signaling cascade are only partially understood, but VEGF is known to induce increased intracellular calcium , accumulation of inositol 1,4,5 trisphosphate  and 1,2 diacylglycerol , activation of protein kinase C , and tyrosine phosphorylation of both phospholipase Cγ  and phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase   . Recently, others have also shown that specific Gβγ protein knockdown in zebrafish causes disruption of VEGF induced angiogenesis and a vascular phenotype .
The goals of non surgical periodontal therapy  are debridement of bacterial plaque and removal of bacterial products from root surfaces. The periodontal pathogens Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans and Porphyromonas gingivalis are exceptionally difficult to eliminate by debridement alone . A. actinomycetemcomitans can invade epithelial cells and pass into the underlying connective tissue , while P. gingivalis can invade epithelial cells and linger inside .
Obsessive compulsive disorder  and Tourette syndrome  are neurodevelopmental disorders with significant phenotypic and genetic overlap., One promising avenue for identifying cross disorder genetic risk factors in neurodevelopmental disorders is the study of genomic copy number variants , segments of DNA ranging from 1 kilobase to several megabases that show deletions or duplications compared to a reference. The association of large, rare CNVs with neurodevelopmental disorders including autism spectrum disorders , schizophrenia, and intellectual disability  has been one of the most important recent advances in psychiatric genomics. CNVs predisposed to these disorders overlap substantially, highlighting the cross disorder effects of this class of genetic variation., Given this robust literature, an important, unanswered question is whether large, rare CNVs are also relevant for the genetic architecture of OCD and TS .
