Both integral and peripheral membrane proteins are located at the INM. In metazoan cells numerous integral INM proteins have been identified and the mechanism by which they are targeted and maintained at this location have been described ; Reviews: .
The ECX21941 gene from the Global Ocean Sampling  metagenome dataset , encodes a protein with a molecular weight of 11.5 kDa  and a calculated isoelectric point of 5.75. Genomic neighborhood analysis of ECX21941 and homologous proteins suggests a cyanophage origin for this protein . The structure of ECX21941 is similar that of Sm/LSm/Sm like proteins despite lack of any detectable sequence similarity and further analysis confirmed that it is a very divergent member of this protein family.
Intrauterine infection has been implicated in the etiology of preterm birth and is present in approximately 25% of all preterm deliveries. An increased concentration of proinflammatory cytokines in amniotic fluid and fetal plasma have been linked to the onset of preterm parturition and fetal or neonatal injury including cerebral palsy and chronic lung disease. Pulmonary surfactants are composed of a lipid protein complex.
The inflammatory bowel diseases , including ulcerative colitis and Crohn’s disease, are chronic disorders characterized by rectal bleeding, severe diarrhea, abdominal pain and weight loss,. These include pathological alterations in the mouth, eyes, skin, liver, joints, lungs and blood. These hematological changes as well as the enhanced thrombus formation reported in IBD patients have also been demonstrated in animal models of colitis, .
Ertapenem  is one of the newest carbapenem antibiotics to be approved for use in the United States and throughout the world. It differs structurally from imipenem by the presence of a β methyl substitution on carbon 1 of the core β lactam structure and from both imipenem and meropenem by the presence of a meta substituted benzoic acid on the functional group at position two. , With these variations, ertapenem retains excellent activity against the enterobacteriaceae, including extended spectrum β lactamase producers, and demonstrates comparable activity against Gram positive and anaerobic organisms.
Male sex determination during mammalian development is initiated by the expression of Sry  gene, which encodes an HMG box DNA binding protein. Thus, Sry acts as the master regulator of male sex determination. However, the molecular nature of the downstream events elicited by the action of Sry is still not well understood  .
Despite having a vaccine in hand that eliminated natural smallpox infections, new vaccines are needed to protect against the threat of deliberately released variola in addition to other endemic and emerging poxviruses. The potency and safety of these further modified live virus inocula are under continued study . Researchers are currently using the VACV, ectromelia , and CPV viruses in mice, in addition to the MPV in primates to evaluate vaccine designs.
William  suggested that thought was ongoing, switching intermittently between internal and external stimuli, relying heavily on processes needed to integrate the past with the present. More recently, researchers have examined the interface between unconscious and conscious processing in mental illness , the role of the unconscious in the facilitation of problem solving and creativity , and the nature of altered consciousness that accompanies paranormal beliefs and experiences  . More is known, however, concerning the unique aspects of cognitive processing associated with transliminality related traits such as positive schizotypy, out of the body experiences , and belief in the paranormal .
Chondrodysplasias and other cartilage defects, frequently caused by perturbations of the extracellular matrix , are a relatively rare group of genetic disorders with no treatment options thus far. The ECM plays a critical role not only in the structural support of chondrocytes but also by serving as a medium in which signaling molecules and growth factors are able to diffuse through the avascular cartilage tissue to target cells . As endochondral ossification of the cartilage elements ensues, the expression of aggrecan by differentiating chondrocytes predominates over other proteoglycans  .
The ovary, unlike other adult mammalian tissues, undergoes persistent cyclical remodeling with regulated proliferation, differentiation and cell death. These factors regulate many genes, including those required for growth and differentiation, through binding to E box  sequences on the promoter region of target genes . Id proteins lack a basic DNA binding domain and can heterodimerize with other bHLH proteins to block chromatin binding and thus subsequent transcriptional activity .
Wilms tumor  is an embryonal tumor of the kidney that affects approximately one child in every 10,000 before the age of 15 years in Europe and North America. During the 20th century, with the development first of curative radiation therapy techniques and then of effective chemotherapy regimens, WT case fatality rates declined from 90% to 10%. The increasing numbers of survivors of WT and other childhood cancers, however, have substantial risk of developing adverse medical conditions related to treatment of their disease.
Some early human studies provided supportive evidence that patients with AD demonstrate more rapid rates of forgetting than healthy older adults and patients with other neurologic disorders . One way to determine whether patients with aMCI and mild AD suffer from an encoding deficit or whether they have intact encoding but rapid forgetting is to target specific abilities of the hippocampus and observe how they change over time in patients with aMCI and mild AD. The hippocampus is involved in forming new memories, tagging and storing memories as individual representations, retrieving memories using only partial or degraded cues, and flexibly applying stored memory representations to novel situations .
A rat in a maze, a hunter gatherer on the plains, and a football quarterback in the middle of a tense play are each confronted with a choice between several possible actions. Choosing the best action often depends on learning the rewards and punishments associated with each action from experience. Anatomical, lesion and neurophysiological studies have implicated the anterior cingulate cortex  in this process.
Activation of the AHR transcription factor by diverse chemicals alters the expression of genes, most prominently cytochrome P450 1  family genes. AHR agonists include exogenous chemicals such as polynuclear aromatic hydrocarbons, planar halogenated aromatic hydrocarbons and a variety of natural products, as well a diversity of endogenous compounds . Zebrafish possess three AHR genes, designated AHR1A, AHR1B and AHR2.
Cancer development is a multistep process characterized by a multitude of genetic and epigenetic changes that induce resistance to proapoptotic stimuli, sustain angiogenesis, and confer insensitivity to antigrowth signals and immune surveillance  . Rapid tumor growth often results in hypoxia, which triggers the stabilization of the transcription factor hypoxia inducible factor 1 , an oxygen sensor that controls the expression of multiple target genes implicated in angiogenesis, metabolism, and cell survival . HSP90 is a highly conserved and ubiquitously expressed molecular chaperone involved in the correct folding and final maturation of a plethora of proteins, so called HSP90 clients, in an effort to maintain cellular homeostasis .
Adolescence is the highest risk period for development of major depressive disorder. A better understanding of the factors that predispose youngsters to a chronic, recurrent course will be helpful in the development and implementation of more effective treatment and preventive strategies, thereby allowing such youth to achieve their full potential as adults. In addition, several psychological and social variables have been proposed as risk factors for chronic and/or recurrent illness, including high neuroticism, negative emotionality, negative cognitions, poor social support, and stressful experiences.
Adaptations can be positive, such as enlargement of a representation of digits engaged in repetitive actions , or negative such as central pain following amputation of a limb or peripheral nerve injury . The most evident cortical response to deafferentation is expansion of representations of body parts with intact peripheral innervation at the expense of those deprived of sensory input  . Mechanisms underlying long term plasticity, especially the massive expansion of a representation with intact innervation occurring after extensive deafferentation of an adjoining body part  are less well understood .
Much has been done to understand the effects of specific neuropeptides working in a particular part of the brain, but it is also important to understand how respective brain regions work together to exert a given feeding effect, as well as to know how selective neuropeptides may interact to support appetite and to elicit a concerted ingestive effect . The PVN is thought to primarily influence energy based food intake , such as when an organism has a relative energy deficit, while the CeA is a limbic structure  involved in reward based food intake and affective ingestive neuromodulatory behavior . Endogenous melanocortin peptides are known to act primarily in the PVN, while opioid systems play a key role in the CeA; these neuropeptides likely provide some of the signaling interaction between the PVN, CeA, and with other nuclei throughout this neural network.
In an academic medical center, the ICU accepts critically ill patients from the Emergency Department , the hospital ward where they may have decompensated, and from other hospitals when those patients need a higher level of care. Cardoso et al reported that critically ill patients who had to wait for admission to the ICU due to bed unavailability had higher mortality; each hour of waiting in the emergency department  or the general hospital ward was associated with a 1.5% increased risk of ICU death. Chalfinet al reported that critically ill patients boarding longer in the ED had increased hospital length of stay and higher ICU and hospital mortality.
The maximum allowable local SAR in the body for a surface coil application is 20 W/kg to satisfy the safe local temperature thresholds . RF energy is deposited non uniformly in the body during an MRI scan. Non uniform in vivo distribution of the RF energy and heating makes it necessary to appropriately define global and local limits for the SAR to avoid heating beyond specified safe temperature limits and improve safety .
Peripheral artery disease  is a major manifestation of systemic atherosclerosis and as a consequence a strong predictor of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality. Patients with PAD commonly manifest the symptom of claudication that is cramping, aching, or fatigue in the calf muscles provoked by walking activity and relieved by rest. However, all patients with PAD  have a profound limitation in physical performance measures as defined by peak exercise performance, the 6 minute walk, and integrated measures of physical activity over a week., The pathophysiology of claudication in PAD is primarily related to atherosclerotic arterial occlusion in the lower extremity that limit the increase in blood flow induced by walking exercise.
Previously identified risk factors for musculoskeletal injuries have included: previous injuries, disproportionate increases in training volume, nutritional deficiencies, and hormonal irregularities. Expanding on the physiological norms for high volume athletes may help identify more common sport specific considerations for musculoskeletal injury . Measuring muscle characteristics with an ultrasound  may assist in identifying athletes at risk for injury and for tracking changes during rehabilitation.
Keeping a living, wriggling specimen in focus and properly located in the field of view, especially for extended observation times, can be a major challenge. Many techniques to immobilize a microscopic specimen have been reported in the literature . Mechanical immobilization techniques depend upon capturing the organism by carefully flattening it between two surfaces, both of which are typically transparent.
These large numbers of membrane proteins are involved in a myriad of cell signaling pathways and processes within the cell . Once a dimer is formed , the two cytoplasmic domains come into contact. Crystal structures of solved extracellular and catalytic domains of ErbB receptors have provided valuable insights into the process of ligand induced dimerization .
Successful breast conservation surgery  maximizes local control when obtaining negative margins prior to irradiation. Although it is well established that compromised margins increase the risk of local recurrence,  no universally accepted definition of a close or negative margin exists because trials have varied widely in their margin definitions, inclusion criteria, and local recurrence rates. ,  Irrespective of the definition used, negative margins remain the standard of care for BCS, and although the number of re excisions doesn’t affect local recurrence initial efforts to achieve margin negativity may help prevent reoperation.
Hematopoietic progenitors, from the bone marrow, migrate into the thymus and undergo a well regulated developmental program to produce T lymphocytes . The Wnt signaling pathway is an evolutionarily conserved pathway that regulates cell proliferation, differentiation, cell survival, migration, and polarity . Wnt stimulation releases β catenin from a destruction complex scaffolded by Apc, thus allowing β catenin to regulate its transcriptional targets by interacting with T cell factors, such as Tcf 1.
Arterial flow mediated dilation  is an indirect measurement of endothelial nitric oxide  release. Impaired FMD represents systemic vascular endothelial dysfunction that is commonly associated with cardiovascular disease .,  Additionally, the association of FMD with CVD is evidenced by its ability to predict future CVD events in population based studies.,  Endothelial dysfunction, defined by impaired FMD, has been reported in patients with atrial fibrillation .,  Also, abnormalities in NO signaling have been implicated in atrial ectopy near the pulmonary veins.,  These findings suggest a potential role for endothelial dysfunction in the development of AF. However, data from population based studies to support this claim are lacking.
Joint attention is a core autism deficit  that has been linked to several social communication and social emotional impairments characteristic of children with autism  . The presence of the child’s smile with a joint attention gesture can efficiently and effectively serve the function of joint attention: to share a positive experience with a communicative partner  . Young children who are typically developing or developmentally delayed frequently combine shared positive affect and joint attention.
The overall effect of the use of antiretroviral therapy on HIV transmission risk may include factors other than its effect on HIV RNA level. Previous studies have suggested that the availability of antiretroviral therapy might result in increased risk behavior. Among gay men in the United States and western Europe, rates of unprotected anal sex increased in the years after introduction of potent combination antiretroviral therapy , .
Adopting the terminology of Fox, et al , we refer to these brain areas as task positive and task negative regions respectively. In the resting state, anticorrelations have been reported between task negative and task positive regions . This has been interpreted as evidence that the resting brain shifts between two different modes of processing, one which engages the task positive regions, and one which engages the task negative regions .
Deregulation of intrinsic tumor protective mechanisms can convert normal epithelia into malignant carcinoma, and lies at the heart of the majority of human cancers. Therefore, the discovery of the p53 family members p63 and p73 generated much interest that these proteins would also act to prevent cancer . However, with regards to p63, a more complicated picture has emerged.
A typical design process entails multiple rounds of gene circuit modeling, construction, and optimization. This circuit centric view of gene circuit engineering has been implied in efforts to standardize synthetic biological parts  . As has been noted, however, a circuit is functional only in the context of its host and its activation may invoke unintended interactions with the host ,,.
Human induced pluripotent stem cells  offer a virtually unlimited source of cardiac myocytes  for disease modeling, drug testing and cardiac regeneration therapies, but current cardiac directed differentiation techniques  lead to heterogeneous populations containing cardiac cells with ventricular, atrial and pacemaker phenotypes as well as other cell lineages and residual undifferentiated cells . Ventricular, atrial and pacemaker myocytes have distinct contractile and electrophysiological properties , and development of methodologies to generate pure populations of these cardiac cell types would represent a major advance towards the use of hiPSC derived CMs  in clinical research and regenerative medicine . Highly purified embryonic stem cell  derived CMs populations have been isolated from ESC lines transduced with CM specific reporter genes .
Down syndrome  arises from the genetic consequences of trisomy 21 and is a disorder of gene dosage. The central phenotype of DS is syndromic mental retardation, albeit quite variable, and is a consequence of the 50% increased dosage at many  chromosome 21q genes. Additionally, individuals with DS have a gamut of associated developmental phenotypes that include, but are not limited to, early onset dementia, congenital heart defects, Hirschsprung disease  and leukemia .
The symptoms of common mental disorders, can lead to clinically significant impairment or distress , which can be alleviated by a variety of treatments, including, possibly, psychotherapy . Several controlled studies , meta analyses , and guidelines , have indicated the efficacy of psychotherapy for different mental health problems, both when used alone , or in combination with psychotropic medications . There remains, however, debate on methodological issues regarding assessment of psychotherapy efficacy and effectiveness  .
Patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma , which includes cancers of the oral cavity, pharynx, and larynx, have one of the highest rates of depression,  and psychological distress, relative to other cancer patient populations. Although treatment related side effects likely contribute to distress, high levels of depressive symptoms and psychological distress,  have also been observed in newly diagnosed patients prior to treatment. Importantly, associations between psychosocial functioning and VEGF have been reported in some cancer patient populations.
Prospective longitudinal studies of families with an alcoholic parent have shown that the children in these families are at risk for early, heavy, or problem drinking at young ages, and that externalizing behavior problems  commonly characterize these highest risk youth  . Although their assessments of behavior were limited , these studies suggest that a quantitative index of family alcohol problems  might predict aspects of behavior in childhood that tap the larger construct of behavioral undercontrol . These constructs have been distinguished from one another in many factor analytic studies and found to be differentially predictive of outcomes that increase alcoholism risk .
Frequently this transcription generates long non coding RNAs , which may be transcribed antisense to protein coding genes, from within introns, or from intergenic regions of the genome. As with mRNAs, many lncRNAs are processed , however, in contrast to protein coding mRNAs, lncRNAs are predominantly nuclear and many are rapidly degraded by the exosome, the major cellular 3′→5′ RNA degradation machinery. Nonetheless, accumulating evidence indicates that an increasing number of lncRNAs act to regulate gene expression, .
Among families affected by parental HIV, research consistently has shown the significant effects of maternal HIV status and distress on adolescent outcomes . To understand the effect of parental HIV on adolescent mental health and behavioral outcomes fully, research must delineate the mediating family processes through which maternal HIV impacts children. Research on HIV affected families to date has largely proceeded under the assumption that parental HIV infection exacerbates these family based processes, which in turn leads to problems seen in children living in these families .
Histidine  tag affinity purification is a method of choice for the purification of a large number of recombinant proteins expressed in various overexpression systems. In addition, the small size of His tag does not interfere with biochemical activities of the tagged proteins in most cases. TTP, a hyperphosphorylated mRNA binding and destabilizing protein , regulates inflammatory responses at the post transcriptional level .
Coupling agents are used to bind the filler particles and the polymer resin covalently, to impart better mechanical properties to the composite . Bisphenol A is not used directly in dental materials , but BisGMA and other components of dental composites are chemical derivatives of bisphenol A and may degrade into related species with potentially suspect health effects . Degradation of the dental composites in the oral environment can proceed by hydrolysis of the siloxane bond .
Infiltrating lobular carcinoma  differs both morphologically and clinically from the more common infiltrating ductal carcinoma  in breast cancer. ILC is more likely to be bilateral, multicentric, and diploid than IDC. Also, ILC tumors have a pattern of metastasis to bone, gastrointestinal tract, and ovary that is different from that of IDC .
The lymphatic system plays an essential role in fluid homeostasis, fat absorption and immune surveillance. Lesions often recur after treatment  . Class I phosphoinositide 3 kinases  are critical regulators of cell proliferation that act upon stimulation of upstream receptors by a growth factor or hormone.
, The dysregulated accumulation of the ECM represents an imbalance between synthesis and dissolution, and like other fibroproliferative conditions such as keloids, may represent disorders of wound healing. In addition to its interaction with hyaluronan, versican interacts with a number of other ECM molecules such as tenascin, fibulins,, fibrillin, and fibronectin, as well as cell surface proteins including selectins,, integrin β1, CD44, and epidermal growth factor  receptor. These results support the role of versican as an important structure in matrix organization while influencing tumor growth and proliferation through its versatile binding domains .
HIV/AIDS continues to be a serious threat to the wellbeing of young people in the United States and around the world . Approximately 5% of people living with HIV in the United States are between the ages of 13 and 24; they represent 46,500 persons . Youth constitute a vulnerable group because they are passing through a period of sexual development in which curiosity and lack of accurate information are commonly coupled with sexual initiation and experimentation  .
Although desmosomes are traditionally considered as epithelial junctions, they are also found in the intercalated discs of cardiomyocytes in specialized hybrid structures of desmosomes and adherens junctions, called area composita. The N terminal region binds to plakophilin 1 and PG and is required for desmosome assembly, whereas the C terminal region, which contains the plakin repeat domains, facilitates interactions with intermediate filaments  . DP exists in two isoforms, DPI  and DPII , generated by alternative splicing , with DPII having a truncated rod domain.
Relapse occurs in 15 to 20% of pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia  and 50% of adult ALL patients. Surprisingly, over half of relapses are missing CNVs present in the predominant clone at diagnosis and appear to have derived from a minor subclone in many cases. Targeting alterations that are frequently gained at relapse is therefore a rational therapeutic strategy, as these lesions are likely associated with chemotherapy resistance and clonal survival.
Since there is a paucity of apoptotic cells in RA joint, one potential mechanism responsible for the hyperplasia in synovial lining may be attributed to decreased death of fibroblasts and macrophages. A variety of studies have shown that induction of synoviocyte apoptosis in animal models of inflammatory arthritis ameliorates both joint inflammation and destruction . Extrinsic apoptosis is mediated through caspase 8/10 which may activate the downstream caspases 3/7 directly or through an amplification step that requires the intrinsic apoptotic pathway.
Early and late normal tissue complications are thought to be comparable to other modes of APBI . In particular, a recent study evaluating rates of normal tissue toxicity for those treated with IBAPBI report grade I, II, and III radiation induced fibrosis  to occur at a rate of 26%, 2%, and 0%, respectively  . RIF can be a painful and cosmetically undesirable condition seen clinically as skin retraction, atrophy, and decreased tissue compliance .
LC are capable, in several experimental systems, of Ag presentation for stimulation of cell mediated immunity  and have been believed to play a key role in initiation of cutaneous immune responses. Transgenic mice in which regulatory elements from human langerin were used to drive expression of diphtheria toxin, resulting in absence of LC, exhibited enhanced contact hypersensitivity responses, suggesting that LC may serve to downregulate cutaneous immunity  . The Th2 type chemokines CCL17  and CCL22  promote the migration of Th2 cells via binding to CCR4.
Alcohol consumption has been established as a major risk factor for esophageal cancer , which remains one of the most common and fatal malignancies worldwide  . Around 26% of deaths from EC could be attributed to alcohol use worldwide with attributable fractions ranging from 24% in low and middle income countries to 41% in high income countries. Although the biological mechanisms underlying alcohol induced carcinogenesis have not been fully understood, the metabolism of ethanol has been suggested to play an important role in the development of EC  .
The incidence of genital chlamydial infection has continued to increase over the last decade despite the availability of efficacious antimicrobial therapy . Th 1 type cellular responses including IFN γ production have been shown to play a predominant role in anti chlamydial protective immunity . We have shown that the protective immunity induced by rCPAF vaccination is dependent upon CD4+ T cells and IFN γ produced locally in the genital tract .
The elevation of nitric oxide  in skin cells after ultraviolet light B  irradiation plays an important role in regulation of apoptosis . UVB also induces the production of superoxide  , which could rapidly react with NO• to form peroxynitrite  . Zinc is the second most highly abundant transition metal found in the human body and is released from zinc binding proteins under oxidative stress.
Glyceraldehyde 3 phosphate dehydrogenase, spermatogenic , the sperm specific isoform of human GAPDH , is under active study as a male contraceptive target . In contrast to the somatic form of GAPDH, the sperm specific GAPDHS possesses a unique proline rich extension at the amino terminus which varies between species ), and may mediate binding to the fibrous sheath in the sperm flagellum  . The ability to identify potential drugs targeting human GAPDHS has been hindered by the difficulties in producing sufficient soluble and active enzyme for study.
TGFβ inducible early gene 1 , also referred to as KLF10, was originally cloned from human osteoblasts  as a primary response gene following TGFβ treatment . More specifically, we have shown that TIEG over expression enhances Smad binding element  reporter activity that is dependent on Smad 4 expression . Further, TIEG over expression in target cells enhances the induction of TGFβ regulated genes p21 and PAI 1  .
It is well documented that the innervating motoneurons play a key role in the maintenance and plasticity of the differentiated muscle phenotype including fiber size, metabolic profile and contractile properties . Numerous studies have demonstrated that the neural influence is exerted largely through the electrical activation pattern imposed on the muscles . The MRF expression patterns can be up regulated in adult muscles following changes in electrical activation patterns or complete removal of motoneuron synaptic input .
The Transforming Growth Factor β  superfamily comprises a large number of cytokines that regulate tissue homeostasis and development through the regulation of fundamental processes such as cell proliferation, differentiation, motility and programmed cell death. There is considerable genetic evidence that the TGF _ signaling pathway is a tumor suppressor pathway in colon epithelial cells. Additional evidence for a tumor suppressor role for the TGF _ signaling pathway is derived from studies of mouse models of cancer.
Non small cell lung cancer  is the leading cause of cancer death in the United States and worldwide . Five year survival rate of NSCLC patients is only 13%. The fluorescence bronchoscopy excels at detecting centrally occurring lung tumor.
During development of the central nervous system , differentiation of the myelinating cells, oligodendrocytes, and the process of active myelination itself are regulated by complex interactions of the oligodendrocytes’ cell surfaces with their extracellular environments . These interactions are to a large extent mediated by the integrin class of extracellular matrix  receptors . In agreement with a pivotal role of integrin ECM signaling for the regulation of oligodendrocyte differentiation and CNS myelination, signaling molecules that are effectors in integrin mediated signaling cascades have also been implicated in these processes  .

The nurse delivered intervention, which included both cognitive behavioral and educational elements, was compared to the educational interventions in both trials. Conversely, a study examining cognitive behavioral intervention for symptom management of patients with advanced cancer found older age reduced the effectiveness of the intervention.
In the United States, employees are legally entitled to a safe and healthy workplace. Yet both the general populace and public health officials often underestimate the impact of high temperatures on human health  . Severe weather has always threatened human health.
Chronic kidney disease, particularly end stage renal disease  treated with hemodialysis, is a powerful, independent risk factor for coronary artery disease  . In addition, traditional risk factors such as hypertension, diabetes and hyperlipidemia are common coexisting conditions. Patients with ESRD under consideration for renal transplantation represent a particularly challenging population as coronary disease remains a leading cause of mortality limiting the long term success of renal transplantation .
In these cases, the data cannot be analyzed by a monoexponential function and different approaches are required to analyze the data. Despite the fact that water diffusion anisotropy is widely used to study CNS pathologies and tractography, the relative contribution of different structural components of neuronal tissues to this observed anisotropy is still debated . This study demonstrated that the diffusion anisotropy of optic nerves of jimpy mice did not differ significantly when compared with age matched control mice.
Depressive symptoms are common in elderly hospitalized patients, with significant symptom levels occurring in 10 to 44% of patients. The presence of depressive symptoms during hospitalization is associated with adverse outcomes, a finding initially noted among select patient groups such as those with acute myocardial infarction. , It is now recognized that among elderly patients hospitalized with a range of medical diagnoses, those with depressive symptoms are at increased risk of poor post hospitalization outcomes including worse physical and mental health, functional decline and increased mortality.
Griscelli syndrome  is a rare autosomal recessive disorder caused by mutations in the MYO5A , RAB27A , or MLPH  genes . All GS patients present with hypomelanosis of the skin due to abnormal melanosomal trafficking in melanocytes and silvery gray hair due to the presence of large clumps of pigment in hair shafts. In addition, GS1 patients present with severe central nervous system dysfunction, while GS2 patients develop hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis  with or without neurological involvement.

It was subsequently proposed that SRA asserts similar regulatory effects on transcription in additional biological contexts, such as myogenesis  and adipogenesis , reviewed recently in  . Translation of this protein from coding variants has been confirmed , and the protein has been designated “steroid receptor RNA activator protein”, or “SRAP”.
Also, there is currently no widespread clinical imaging method to intraprocedurally visualize and evaluate RFA lesions. Reported rates of arrhythmia recurrence post TCA are typically around 20%, and studies have attributed arrhythmia recurrence to incomplete lesions or electrical conduction through unablated gaps in isolation lines. Intracardiac echocardiography , or catheter based B mode imaging, is frequently used to visualize the cardiac anatomy and ablation electrodetissue contact in real time, but the acoustic contrast between ablated and unablated tissue is insufficient for lesion characterization.

The second stage of bud formation is the initiation stage, when buds first project from the UGS epithelial surface. Inhibition of budding by TCDD required functional AHRs in UGS mesenchyme, not in UGS epithelium .
The Lsm proteins were identified in Saccharomyces cerevisiae by their sequence similarity to the canonical Sm proteins . These results suggest that LSm8 nuclear import involves an unidentified nuclear import signal that is only present when LSm8 interacts with other LSm2 8 subunits. In S. cerevisiae, Lsm1 to 7 proteins and a wide range of RNA decapping and decay factors have been shown to accumulate in cytoplasmic foci named processing or P bodies, but only under certain conditions .
Fulminant hepatic failure is a life threatening condition that is treated by transplantation of the liver when a donor organ can be found. Therefore, treatment of hepatic failure could be dramatically improved by development of methods for temporary hepatic support . Thus, the use of a liver assist devices  has greater theoretic potential as a minimally intrusive therapy, as incorporated hepatocytes might provide additional metabolic capacity and physiologically active molecules important for recovery of native hepatic function  .
Adolescent involvement in gangs is a serious public health problem, with an estimated 788 000 youths involved in 27 000 gangs in the United States in 2007 . Gang membership is typically characterized by engagement in some form of criminal activity, such as fighting with other gangs, stealing cars or other goods, selling illegal drugs, or engaging in property damage . Accordingly, gang members report higher rates of violent offending, nonviolent delinquency, and victimization than their peers .
Persistent oxidative damage to cellular DNA associated with chronic inflammation developed in response to microbial and viral infections, tobacco smoke, and other environmental insults, is genotoxic and has been implicated in the etiology of many human cancers . The most common DNA lesion detected in vivo is 8 oxo 7,8 dihydroguanine , a well known biomarker of oxidative stress . This lesion is mutagenic because it mispairs with A during replication by DNA polymerases that lead to a predominant G → T transversion mutation , the second most common somatic mutation in human carcinomas .
Dendritic Cells  are critical antigen presenting cells  characterized by their efficient conversion of internalized antigens into peptide MHC complexes  required to orchestrate T cell responses . Critical DC functions such as antigen presentation, expression of co stimulatory molecules and migration are tightly controlled by a maturation process, where stimuli such as Toll like receptor  ligands or inflammatory cytokines convert immature DCs into mature DCs specialized for T cell stimulation  . Manipulation of DC maturation shows high therapeutic potential, especially in vaccination regimes where antigen delivery to DCs is coordinated with a maturation stimulus to optimize T cell stimulation .
Amongst these, eosinophils play a prominent pro inflammatory role in airway allergic inflammation , contributing to several of the clinical features of allergic asthma . Clinical studies as well as murine models of allergic airway inflammation have shown up regulation of bone marrow  eosinophils and their progenitors . In addition to the BM, increased numbers of mature eosinophils as well as eosinophil progenitors have been reported within the bronchial mucosa  as well as in induced sputum from allergic subjects with asthma .
One study compared participants reporting “any” condom use to no use, another looked at condom use at last sex and “always” or “often” condom use in the past 6 months, and yet another measured “sometimes,” “always” or “never” use. The most common measurement involved counting the number of sex partners in a certain period of time, the number of sex acts , and the percent of sex acts protected. Responses can be influenced by social desirability bias, participation bias, and memory error.
Marriage is now the primary risk factor for HIV among women in India, and almost 90 % of new HIV infections among women do not involve commercial sex and mostly occur in the context of marriage . Interventions focused on HIV prevention among wives at risk for contracting HIV from their husbands are needed in India, particularly in high epidemic areas of the country, such as Mumbai  . Among married women, primary risk factors for HIV include geography and husband related risks .
Traumatic brain injury  is a major cause of acquired disability in children , which results in physical impairments and difficulty with cognition, mood, behavior, social development, and school performance . Parents report increased daytime somnolence and prolonged nocturnal sleep in grade school children for months to years after severe TBI compared with mild TBI and controls . Adolescence constitutes a unique stage in the process of maturation into adult sleep patterns and cognitive and behavioral functioning.
Poorly differentiated thyroid carcinomas of conventional type  and oncocytic  type  are biologically situated between well differentiated papillary  and follicular  thyroid carcinomas on the one hand and anaplastic thyroid carcinomas  on the other. The entity was finally recognized by the WHO in 2004, however, the criteria were not well defined . A consensus meeting was held in 2007 and a diagnostic algorithm was developed by different experts in thyroid pathology throughout the world .
TAR DNA binding protein of 43 kDa  is the major component of protein aggregates in patients with sporadic and most familial ALS and in a subclass of patients with frontotemporal lobar degeneration  characterized by ubiquitin positive inclusions . Moreover, mutations in the gene encoding TDP43 are associated with familial ALS and FTLD with motor neuron disease, strengthening the conclusion that this protein plays a central role in disease pathogenesis  . In healthy cells, TDP43 is largely restricted to the nucleus; however, TDP 43 is also involved in nucleocytoplasmic shuttling of messenger RNA , and TDP 43 containing cytoplasmic puncta have been detected in association with RNA granules .
Both synaptic  and extrasynaptic  GABAA receptors can be modulated by neurosteroids; extrasynaptic GABAA receptors may be of particular importance as targets of neurosteroid modulation . Inhibitory neurosteroids, such as PS, are proconvulsive , and enhance learning and memory , although some of these effects may be due to modulation of other channels such as N methyl D aspartate receptors  and voltage gated calcium channels . Further investigation into the structural basis of neurosteroid potentiation and inhibition of GABAA receptors will be important to better understand the physiological basis of neurosteroid effects on behavior, and to exploit their therapeutic potential .
Neural proliferation has been recorded in adults animals of all vertebrate taxa and, with few exceptions, occurs in the cell layer surrounding the lateral ventricles, the ventricular zone  . In songbirds, VZ proliferation  is concentrated in ventral and dorsal ‘hotspots’  with most, if not all, of the dividing cells classified as radial glia or neurons . In mammals these cells migrate largely to the hippocampus and olfactory bulb areas , whereas in songbirds many neurons migrate to nuclei of the efferent motor pathway for learned vocalization  .
The NS1 protein is comprised of two functional domains: N terminal  RNA binding domain, which binds double stranded RNA; and C terminal  effector domain, which binds several host proteins. In a second countermeasure the NS1 protein blocks the activation of the IRF3 transcription factor, as well as the activation of NF κB, thereby blocking the activation of IFN β transcription and hence the synthesis of IFN β pre mRNA . In contrast to the results with this virus, it was reported that IRF3 and IFN β transcription are efficiently activated in cells infected by the H3N2 influenza A/Udorn/72 virus  , which circulated in humans in 1972, demonstrating that the NS1 protein encoded by this virus does not block these activations.
Dopaminergic amacrine  cells are retinal interneurons that modulate a variety of key visual processes, most notably, those associated with light adaptation and the transition from scotopic to photopic visual function . Dopamine receptors, by contrast, are widely distributed throughout the retina , and dopamine release, occurring through both synaptic as well as extra synaptic exocytosis , is believed to exert its pan retinal modulatory actions through volume transmission . The DA cells are one of the sparsest cell types within the retina, amounting to less than one hundredth of 1% of all retinal neurons.
Methylphenidate is one of the most frequently prescribed medications for the treatment of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder . Since these safety concerns cannot be adequately studied in humans, animal models have been employed to examine the mechanisms of action of methylphenidate and its addictive potential . Such administration can cause rapid rise in plasma and brain methylphenidate levels, which can reach peaks 5 10 times those seen in patients taking therapeutic doses of methylphenidate orally as ADHD treatment  .
Although the exact mechanisms that underlie the development of HBV associated HCC have not been entirely elucidated, the results of many studies suggest that HBV associated HCC develops in the context of a continual inflammatory response to HBV infected hepatocytes and is also influenced by expression of HBV proteins such as HBx  . The results of studies in HBx transgenic mice suggest that HBx can impact the development of HCC. HBx might also influence HBV replication by regulating cell proliferation pathways; however, the precise impact of HBx on cell proliferation pathways in normal hepatocytes, and how cell cycle progression influences HBV replication, remains incompletely understood .
The behavioral economic approach to the study of cross temporal decision making conceptualizes addiction as a disorder of restricted time horizon , where future consequences falling beyond the horizon  are not adequately integrated into the valuation of current behavioral alternatives. However, addiction is also characterized by memory deficits , insensitivity to risk , and social cognitive dysfunction beyond generalized addiction related social withdrawal . Insights from basic research suggest that these addiction related deficits may simply be different manifestations of a common underlying process .
With the development of vascular specific contrast agents, medical imaging techniques have become much more sensitive to particular aspects of angiogenesis . For example, the advent of contrast enhanced ultrasound  using microbubbles targeted to specific receptors permits the study of angiogenesis at a molecular level . These parameters are extracted from models fit to time intensity curves that describe the kinetics of an injected contrast agent as it enters and exits a region of interest.
Many diseases are characterized by undesired peripheral neural activity. Numerous painful conditions including cancer pain, neuromas and neuralgias are associated with pathological afferent activity. Numerous studies have shown that nerve conduction can be blocked through the delivery of high frequency alternating current  to a peripheral nerve .
Dysphagia is a serious yet common problem in older adults, especially for those in hospital settings and in sub acute care facilities  . Patients with stroke or hip fracture, the most common reasons for sub acute care admission , are at especially high dysphagia risk. It is often diagnosed within the hospital setting by speech language pathologists , who assess swallowing ability and make effective dietary, behavioral, and provider recommendations to decrease the risk of dysphagia related complications .
Microarrays have shown increasing potential as a component of high throughput analytical devices for the rapid detection of biomolecules for a variety of applications such as drug screening. Protein microarrays have applications in proteomics and protein functional studies , DNA chips are used in gene expression studies and rapid DNA sequencing , and carbohydrate microarrays can be used in glycomics studies and pathogen identification . Several methods have been used to generate lipid bilayer arrays , including microcontact blotting and printing , substrate micropatterning , UV photolithography , robotic microspotting , and microfluidics .
Among the lysines that can be acetylated, acetylated H4 K16 is known to play a pivotal role in determining the potential of coding DNA for expression. H4 K16 acetylation in higher eukaryotes is mainly carried out by histone acetyltransferase  MOF , also called MYST1 or KAT8 . The function of MOF in dosage compensation is mediated by its acetyltransferase activity, which is tightly regulated by the MSL proteins .
Fluid handling is one of the key technical challenges in any point of care device. However, miniaturization alone is not sufficient to make a technology successful in POCT. Other important factors that determine the success of a technology for point of care are the cost of deployment, ease of use and continued maintenance and choice of a problem that requires a point of care device.
Aicardi syndrome is a rare neurodevelopmental disorder affecting females and, very rarely, males with a 47,XXY karyotype . It has therefore been hypothesized that Aicardi syndrome is caused by mutations in a gene on the X chromosome that causes lethality in hemizygous males . Aicardi syndrome is sporadic except for one reported pair of affected sisters  and a pair of affected monozygotic twins .
In cell culture, bacterial endotoxins rapidly stimulate superoxide production through assembly and activation of NADPH oxidase, functionally known as the respiratory burst. Specifically, the signaling mechanisms involved between the activation of the putative endotoxin receptor CD14:TLR4 and the assembly of the NADPH oxidase have not been determined . These regulatory subunits consist of p47phox, p67phox and p21Rac1, a small GTP binding protein .
Cleft palate is one of the most commonly observed congenital malformations in humans, occurring in up to 1 in 500 live births. During facial morphogenesis, paired first brachial arches elongate and fuse in the midline to create the palate and mandible . This process involves proliferation of mesenchyme within the palate shelves, and dissolution of the epithelium during palate fusion.
Nevertheless, investigators have proposed and tested few physiological mechanisms to explain how trait anger management style  or “state” anger regulation  may affect the course and/or severity of chronic pain . Anger, hostility, and anger management style are related to physiological reactivity to stress . Indeed, findings suggest that trait anger out, anger in, and hostility interact to predict LP tension increases among CLBP patients evoked during anger arousal; effects not evident for trapezius muscles  .
The active metabolite of vitamin D, 1,25 dihydroxyvitamin D 2D3), regulates transcription through its binding to the vitamin D receptor  for subsequent regulation of proliferation and differentiation in a number of cells, including keratinocytes . For example, binding of VDR to 1,252D3 induces transcription of 24 hydroxylase  through VDR response element sequences in its promoter . We have previously purified and identified the protein complex of vitamin D receptor interacting proteins  from primary keratinocytes, as well as in the squamous carcinoma cell line SCC12B2  as VDR coactivators.
Butterflies and moths  have a large number of short holocentric chromosomes  with substantial variation in chromosome number  . However, the most common chromosome numbers are n=29 31, , and the distribution is markedly skewed with only a few species having n>31. In spite of much variation in the number of chromosomes, the amount of DNA is approximately the same in different species, suggesting that species with fewer chromosomes have, on average, longer chromosomes.
NK cell commitment is marked by CD56 expression that can be divided further into two populations of NK cells based on CD56 intensity, with the CD56bright NK cells preceding, and giving rise to the CD56dim NK cells . CD56dim NK cells are thought to be more functionally mature with greater cytotoxic capacity and cytokine production after target cell recognition . Although some of the components necessary for KIR expression on NK cells have been elucidated , many questions remain concerning which signaling pathways are involved in KIR expression and functional maturation of NK cells .
Functional connectivity analyses of fMRI data as an approach to study temporal coherence in activity of distant brain areas, either during task performance or in resting state, has been widely applied in the neuroscience research. The most widely spread method of measuring functional connectivity between a pair of regions is computing a linear correlation of activity time series derived from these regions by e.g. simple spatial averaging across all the voxels in the regions. From all possible bivariate measures of association, linear correlation is clearly a method of first choice, reflecting the assumption that the relationship between the fMRI time series can be suitably approximated by a multivariate Gaussian white noise process.
Alzheimer's disease , the most common cause of dementia in the elderly, is characterized pathologically by the deposition of β amyloid  plaques and neurofibrillary tangles in the hippocampus and cerebral cortex. Because only symptomatic treatments are now available, safe and effective mechanism based therapies are needed for this devastating neurodegenerative disease of later life. Experimental support of the “amyloid cascade hypothesis” has led investigators to identify and evaluate targets for anti amyloid therapeutic strategies, which are designed to reduce the amyloid burden in the brains of individuals with AD .
2 deoxy D glucose  is a glucose analogue which, when administered in vivo, can be taken up by cells through glucose transporters. 13C labeled 2DG can be detected by nuclear magnetic resonance  spectroscopy , but the relatively low sensitivity for detection limits its applications. 18F labeled fluorodeoxyglucose  has been used extensively to image glucose uptake by positron emission tomography  .
In particular, research has shown that women who use illicit drugs are vulnerable to many different types of assailants, including intimate partners, strangers, acquaintances, sex trade clients, police, and drug dealers . Far less is known about non partner violence among women who use drugs. Poor women who use illicit drugs often live in harsh social environments and have limited, sometimes perilous, options for generating income, such as sex trade, drug dealing, and panhandling .
Asbestos fibers are a naturally occurring hydrated silicate mineral used for commercial applications. It has been reported that over the last century, more than 30 million tons of asbestos have been mined, processed, and applied in the United States . Exposure to asbestos typically occurs during mining and milling of the fibers or during industrial application of asbestos in textiles, insulation, shipbuilding, brake lining mechanics, and other areas.
The metabolic syndrome , a highly prevalent condition in the elderly, is associated with potentially reversible risk factors and with cardiovascular and cerebrovascular morbidity and mortality. MetS is also associated with inflammation and hormonal dysfunction,, which in turn are involved in the pathogenesis of anemia . Low hemoglobin levels are common in older subjects, and herald several adverse outcomes like mortality, disability and hospitalization.
Piaget was among the first developmental researchers to recognize that this balance between stability and flexibility is especially important during early development, as infants are faced with a massive amount of novel information that must be integrated to form stable representations of the world. These studies have shown that prefrontal dopamine signaling is differentially related to cognitive stability and flexibility, with elevated dopamine levels associated with improved performance on measures of stability  and reduced prefrontal dopamine levels linked to improved performance on measures of flexibility . Infant researchers have developed tasks to similarly examine components of cognitive control in early development, such as short term memory and attention/ oculomotor control  .
Floods have occurred in the recent past, including those during the monsoons of 1998, 2004, and 2007. The frequency of floods has increased in recent years, and over 50% of Bangladesh can be inundated during severe floods, causing epidemics of infectious diseases, especially diarrheal disease. , Clinical features of diarrheal diseases seen at health facilities tend to be more severe during floods.
Initially described by Dor in 1989 , endoventricular patch plasty  is used to reduce left ventricular  volume after myocardial infarction  and subsequent LV remodeling. The Dor procedure can be performed safely. ,  However, the NIH sponsored Surgical Treatment for Ischemic Heart failure  trial recently found no difference in composite outcome between coronary bypass  and CABG plus Dor procedure.
Brain development depends on a sequence of cellular and molecular events underlying the process of neuronal generation. Through this sequence, neuronal identity is restricted and defined. Broad distinctions between classes of neurons are largely accomplished through spatially distinct localization of neural progenitor pools.
According to the U.S. National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute's  Asthma Guidelines, the goal of asthma treatment is to improve the quality of life  of people who have asthma, while working toward controlling symptoms, reducing the risk of exacerbations, and preventing asthma related death  . In light of these limitations, the Asthma Quality of Life Subcommittee of the 2010 NHLBI Asthma Outcomes Workshop declined to recommend any existing instrument as a core outcome measure of asthma specific QoL . Instead, the Subcommittee strongly recommended development of new instruments that incorporate the patient's perspective and are able to measure the impact of asthma on QoL as a construct that is distinct from asthma symptoms or functional status.
In its natural forest floor habitat, Dictyostelium exists in its amoeboid state and feeds on bacterial cells by phagocytosis . When nutrients are scarce, cells aggregate to form fruiting bodies containing spores that are dormant and resistant to desiccation. This approach has provided new insights into how current therapeutic agents regulate cellular function , for example, in identifying common signalling pathways targeted by lithium and valproic acid in the treatment of bipolar disorder, and is increasingly being used to identify cellular mechanisms controlling drug targets using growth and development  or cell movement  as phenotypic readouts .
Aminoglycoside antibiotics cause damage to both short and tall HCs over a region of the papilla extending from the base for a distance that depends on the dose administered and the duration of administration. Recovery of neural and behavioral thresholds after aminoglycoside treatment is correlated with HC regeneration. Although there are differences in the detailed results of different studies, there is general agreement that although auditory nerve, brainstem, and behavioural thresholds show substantial recovery, they can remain elevated by up to 25 dB at high frequencies 20 weeks or more after the time of the ototoxic treatment  and  for reviews) .
Over the past decade, studies of animal models have transformed our understanding of cardiac embryology. In particular, the use of genetic cell lineage analysis, along with the ability to assess large numbers of specimens, has permitted the accurate tracking of distinct cellular contributions within the developing mouse heart. These findings have provided a framework for understanding cardiac development in man, where comparable studies are hampered by limited availability of specimens, and the impossibility of following cell lineage.
Although diabetes can be managed with insulin and other drugs, physiological glucose homeostasis is difficult to achieve by these means, and hyperglycemia is largely responsible for the co morbidities associated with diabetes. Consequently, much research on diabetes is aimed at understanding the molecular and cellular basis for pancreatic β cell development, survival, and regulated insulin secretion in order to discover ways to restore β cells or their functions in diabetic patients . NeuroD is a basic helix loop helix  transcription factor that is crucial for development of the pancreas .
Ubiquitination is the process of tagging a target protein with ubiquitin  or a polyubiquitin chain as part of post translational modifications leading to regulatory roles such as protein degradation in the proteosome . The process of ubiquitination is mediated by a cascade of three enzymes known as the ubiquitin activating enzyme , ubiquitin conjugating enzyme  and ubiquitin ligase . The processes share significant similarities that have allowed extrapolation of the data to better understand the biological function of human E1 ubiquitin activating enzyme .
Since effects of maternal thyroid status impact on outcome at a time before development of the thyroid in the fetus, it is clear that supply of maternal THs across the placenta is critical to normal fetal development during pregnancy. We and others have used cordocentesis to perform fetal blood sampling in babies affected by severe IUGR and have reported a statistically significant reduction in circulating concentrations of free T4 and free T3 . While circulating concentrations of T4 and T3 are considered the major determinants of cellular supply of these hormones, it is clear that other factors potentially modulate thyroid hormone action at a tissue level.
Thus, proper iron balance is essential for oligodendrocyte sparing and replacement following CNS injury . Through cytokine release, activated macrophages can alter levels of iron and the iron storage protein ferritin . In certain circumstances, activated macrophages also secrete ferritin, which can be actively taken up by oligodendrocytes and function to promote their survival .
According to the March 29, 2005 Guidelines for Carcinogen Risk Assessment , cancer risk is estimated using a human case specific dose response model, if such a model is available . In the absence of either such model, dose response risk evaluations are derived through extrapolation of experimental animal data from a high dose response region, which has been measured experimentally, to a low dose response region of interest, which has not been measured. Owing to costs and other limitations, dose response data from a typical rodent carcinogen bioassay study are generally derived from a few hundred experimental animals, and thus are statistically limited to observations covering only about one order of magnitude, between 10% and 100% incidence.
Most of bladder cancer cases present as NMIBC , which are low or high grade tumors with stages Ta, T1 or carcinoma in situ . Low grade NMIBC  has a high rate of recurrence but a low rate of progression to MIBC, while high grade NMIBC  has a high rate of recurrence and progression to MIBC . MIBC cases are primarily treated with surgical resection of the bladder  but 50% of patients still progress to incurable metastatic disease .
All trans retinoic acid  is the biologically active derivative of vitamin A. atRA has been considered a potentially promising chemotherapeutic agent, due to its pro apoptotic and growth suppressing activity. Previous results from our laboratory have demonstrated that atRA treatment of the ovarian carcinoma cell line CAOV3 results in >50% growth suppression. This results from arrest of the cell cycle during the G1 phase .
To ascertain which of these processes affected by DR might be causally responsible for DR’s benefits, we have utilized genetic variation underlying a variety of physiological traits in the ILSXISS  series of recombinant inbred  strains of mice . The ILSXISS is one of the largest RI panels available in mice , which makes it advantageous for applying genetic approaches, similar to those that have advanced our understanding of aging in invertebrate models . This is consistent with observations of , who found that individual, within strain variation in BW during DR was positively correlated with lifespan in four out of four cohorts .
, After the rhodopsin structure was solved in 2000, homology modeling and fragment based threading methods were applied to build models for GPCRs using the rhodopsin structure as the template. However, the suitability of the rhodopsin template to accurately predict the structure of other GPCRs is questionable, as the average sequence identity to bovine rhodopsin of human GPCRs is relatively low at ~20%, and the GPCR superfamily is highly diverse in its ligand binding properties. , While the overall helical bundle architecture is thought to be similar for class A GPCRs, detailed structural features are expected to differ for receptors binding to different ligands .
Of the transition metals, Fe, Cr, and Mn are of particular interest because of their abundance and the fact that their redox chemistry alters their bioavailability and toxicity. Manganese has three readily available oxidation states: Mn, Mn, and Mn. The redox state of these metals within a particle at the time of inhalation will be a function of the source of the particle and changes induced through atmospheric aging.
Mutations in leucine rich repeat kinase 2  represent the most frequent cause of autosomal dominant and idiopathic PD identified to date . About thirty LRRK2 sequence variations have been identified . Among them, the R1441C/G mutation within the GTPase domain, and the G2019S mutation within the kinase domain of LRRK2 occur more frequently and have been definitively linked to PD, highlighting an unprecedented role of GTPase and kinase signaling in the pathogenesis of the disease .
The drug works by drawing water into the large intestine, thereby stimulating bowl movements . The polyol pathway of glucose metabolism is active when the intercellular glucose levels are elevated in the cell . Aldose reductase , the first and the rate limiting enzyme in the pathway reduces glucose to sorbitol using NADPH as a cofactor .
Angiosarcoma  is a rare, usually high grade malignant vascular endothelial tumor comprising less than 1% of all sarcomas. Epithelioid hemangioendothelioma  is a low grade malignant epithelioid vascular tumor primarily involving soft tissue or viscera, especially liver and lung. CD30 is a 120 kD transmembrane glycoprotein and a member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 8 .
Even though the light scattering for sound enamel is at a minimum in the NIR, the light scattering coefficient of enamel increases by 2 3 order of magnitudes upon demineralization due to the formation of pores on a similar size scale to the wavelength of the light that act as Mie scatterers . The decay on the important occlusal surfaces can also be imaged employing an alternative NIR transillumination imaging configuration in which NIR light is delivered to the tooth from the buccal or lingual surface to diffuse upward through the dentin to provide uniform back illumination of the enamel of the crown . It is the aim of this paper to determine if a reflectance imaging configuration is better suited to acquire high contrast images of artificial demineralization on enamel surfaces.

Altered function of the Ssa cytosolic Hsp70 family considerably impairs propagation of the yeast prion , an infectious amyloid form of the translation termination factor Sup35 . Constitutively expressed Ssa1 and Ssa2 are 98% identical, while stress inducible Ssa3 and Ssa4 are 88% identical and share 80% identity with Ssa1 and Ssa2.

For in vivo applications, these PFCs have been previously emulsified into lipid particle formulations with sizes in the range of several hundred nm.
Cannabis is one of the most widely used psychoactive substances in the United States . Perceived risk of use is associated with substance use; the recent debate surrounding medicalization and legalization of cannabis in the U.S. has the potential to impact perceived risk of use. Recent estimates are needed to assess temporal changes in, and identify correlates of, perceived risk of cannabis use .
Collagen induced arthritis  is an established mouse model of human rheumatoid arthritis . Immunization with heterologous collagen type II in susceptible mouse strains results in autoantibody production to murine collagen type II, followed by autoantibody binding to joint cartilage, activation of the complement cascade, and inflammation resulting in tissue destruction . Although the pathogenesis of CIA involves autoantibodies, disease induction requires the interaction of CD4+ T cells and B cells, as well as the production of multiple cytokines.
ER stress activates the transcription factors, X box binding protein  and activator of transcription 6 , which induce numerous ERSR proteins designed to restore efficient ER protein folding, which contributes to resisting the stress ,. The folding of proteins in the ER lumen requires molecular oxygen , suggesting that that hypoxia mediated induction of ERSR proteins during myocardial ischemia may enhance ER protein folding in and survival of cardiac myocytes and limit ischemic damage. Consistent with this hypothesis are recent studies showing that simulated ischemia  activates the ERSR in cultured rat and mouse ventricular myocytes, and that ER stress is activated in the surviving myocytes adjacent to the damaged region in a mouse model of in vivo myocardial infarction  .
Ballooning of hepatocytes is induced by oxidative stress, and both ballooning of hepatocytes and MDBs are two characteristics of ongoing inflammation . Balloon hepatocytes forming MDBs are progenitor preneoplasia cells . Except for TLR3, all TLRs activate the MyD88 dependent pathway, recruit the IRAK family of protein kinases, and lead to the activation of TRAF6 .
A number of epidemiologic studies have associated pre  and post natal exposure toambient air pollution with adverse respiratory outcomes. Post natal exposures to airpollutants, including particulate matter , ozone , nitrogen dioxide, carbon monoxide , and sulfur dioxide , have beenassociated with increased infant mortality, even in developed countries such as the UnitedStates, with the strongest associations for post neonatal respiratory mortality . Although a number of studies report increased risks of respiratory symptoms inearly life in association with air pollution exposure,, relatively few studies havespecifically examined early life respiratory infection  in relation to traffic related emissions.

In the kidney, the proximal tubule reabsorbs 6070% of filtered NaCl and fluid. The normal kidney protects against acute increases in blood pressure by excreting NaCl rapidly. This was accompanied by an increase in fluid reabsorption in the proximal tubule in young  pre hypertensive SHR compared to WKY.
The number of incarcerations in the US has dramatically increased in recent years . The proportion of female inmates accounts for less than 9% of the incarcerated population, but the number of female inmates in state and federal correctional facilities has grown faster  than the number of male incarcerations  between 1995 and 2007  . Incarcerated women are affected by a myriad of difficult life circumstances, including poverty, unemployment, lack of education, and unstable housing conditions .
Preformed donor specific antibodies  are associated with a delay in transplant rates and poor outcomes, and de novo DSA are associated with reduced graft and patient survival after transplantation . Recent studies suggest that antibody mediated rejection  is the most important cause of allograft loss following kidney transplantation . Around the same time, C4d, a degradation product of the complement pathway that binds covalently to the endothelium, was identified as a stable marker of anti donor humoral activity .
Plaque acidification is not only damaging to teeth but also stressful for the acid producing organisms, which have developed a variety of means to moderate acid stress. The major means for resisting the damaging effects of plaque acidification involves membrane F ATPases, specifically F1F0 ATPases in oral streptococci . Another common way for oral bacteria to protect themselves against acid damage is through the production of alkali .
Reversible phosphorylation at conserved serines within lamin head and tail domains regulates the integrity of the nuclear lamina. Herpesviruses are large, double stranded DNA viruses that replicate and assemble progeny virions in the nuclei of infected cells, and hence must exit the nucleus to escape the cell. Complete dismantling of the nuclear envelope does not occur during herpesvirus infection; however, infection appears to induce partial lamin disassembly or reorganization to allow virions to reach the INM  .

Although each of the IL 6 family cytokines signals through a distinct receptor complex, they share the gp130 receptor subunit . Activation of gp130 kinase activity results in activation of the STAT3 transcription factor, and the Mitogen Activated Protein Kinase  and Phosphatidylinositol 3 Kinase  signaling cascades .
Hereditary deafness is phenotypically and genetically heterogeneous affecting nearly 300 million people worldwide. Clinically, hearing loss is manifested by wide variation in associated symptoms, age of onset, the specific frequencies affected and progressive loss of hearing thresholds. Genetically, it has been estimated that ~1% of all human genes may be implicated in the etiology of hereditary deafness., To date, the molecular genetic etiology for approximately 100 deafness genes have been reported.
Paramount among these is the nature of the cell's T cell receptor , which is defined not only by its specificity, but also critically by its affinity for cognate MHC Ag . However, the role of Ag affinity in sustaining autoimmunity, where Ag is often plentiful, may be quite different from other immune responses, and how affinity or other features of TCR recognition relate to the autoimmune potential of a T cell is uncertain . TCR affinity may have dual roles in defining a T cell's autoimmune potential.
According to a recent study, headache is the most common pain condition causing loss of productive time in the US workforce, with an average loss of 3.5 hours/week. Cervicogenic headache  is a type of headache causally associated with cervical myofascial tender spots or cervical spine dysfunction. The reported prevalence of CGH varies from 13.8% to 17.8% of the headache population in different epidemiological studies.
Great Danes  with cervical spondylomyelopathy  are most frequently affected by the osseous associated form, which is characterized by vertebral canal stenosis secondary to osseous proliferation of the vertebral arch, articular processes and/or pedicles . Magnetic resonance imaging  is the imaging modality of choice for dogs with suspected CSM  . These studies provided a qualitative description of MRI abnormalities in CSM affected GDs with clinical signs, but no morphometric information was provided.
An important approach in synthetic biology is to screen through many alternative network designs, computationally or experimentally, to find a network capable of achieving a pre defined function. We previously developed a computational approach to map dynamical mechanisms for small 3 node networks, performing a pre defined regulatory task,. Only intermediate concentrations of morphogen  must activate a target gene, resulting in stripe forming systems in 2D.
For both binocular rivalry and ambiguous motion displays, the dynamics of the perceptual alternations were found to be stationary . In particular, the fraction of time that one percept dominates over the other is stable over time and does not depend on methodological details such as measurement duration. In this study, we measured dominance times during spontaneous perceptual reversals in the perceived depth ordering of transparently moving gratings.
Improving the quality of care in nursing homes has been a major theme in health care for over 30 years. In this vein, a number of structural and process characteristics of nursing homes have been examined over the years in terms of their relationship with quality. Characteristics such as facility size, ownership, chain membership, facility resources and culture, medical treatments offered, specialized care settings, and percent private pay have all been related to outcomes.
Supported Employment  is an effective method to increase employment among individuals with psychiatric disabilities  with an employment rate approaching 60% . Moreover, a 10 year follow up study of SE indicated that only 30% of consumers felt that practicing job interviews was helpful , which suggests that SE’s approach to improving job interview skills may have limited effectiveness. Although the effectiveness of clinician facilitated role play training in vocational rehabilitation has received minimal empirical attention , several interventions have been developed as supplements to enhance SE, including cognitive remediation, cognitive behavioral therapy, performance feedback, and developing work skills .
Epidemiologic studies suggest that 15% of individuals with MDD have attempted suicide at some point in their life  and rates of 40% have been observed in clinical populations . Depression severity , comorbid personality , anxiety , and alcohol use disorders  have all been associated with an elevated risk of suicide attempt. Longitudinal studies have consistently demonstrated the importance of past suicide attempts , cigarette smoking , alcohol use disorders , and comorbid personality disorder  as predictors of future suicide attempts in depressed populations .
While the mechanism responsible for the development of AIDS remains incompletely understood, a series of recent studies have emphasized the role played by chronic immune activation and the direct infection of CD4+ central memory T cells , with these two phenomena being significantly reduced in SIV infected SM as compared to RM . During pathogenic HIV and SIV infections, high levels of direct virus infection of CD4+ TCM are associated with the depletion of CD4+ T cells in blood, lymph nodes, and mucosal tissues, thus suggesting a direct link between virus mediated CD4+ TCM killing, CD4+ TCM depletion, and onset of a clinically relevant immunodeficiency . A series of recent studies has identified a phenotypically and functionally novel subset of memory T cells with stem cell like properties that were termed “T memory stem cells” or TSCM .
The product, H2folate, is reduced to 5,6,7,8 tetrahydrofolate  by dihydrofolate reductase , and then methylenated back to CH2H4folate. Since 2002, thyX, a new gene that encodes for flavin dependent thymidylate synthases , has been identified in a number of microorganisms, including some severe human pathogens . This is quite different from the structure of classical TS, which is a homodimer with one active site per subunit .
The three ubiquitously expressed Ras isoforms: H Ras, K Ras 4B  and N Ras, share almost complete sequence homology between amino acids 1 165. Mechanisms that regulate isoform specific signalling include differential compartmentalisation within cell surface microdomains and intracellular compartments  and coupling to activators and effectors specific for individual, or a subset of Ras isoforms . A simple mechanism is through regulation of the cellular expression profiles but scant quantitative data exist for relative levels of cellular Ras protein expression .
Nicotine is the primary addictive component of tobacco smoke . Through interactions with nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  in the central nervous system , nicotine modulates various genes and cellular pathways in target neurons. For example, nicotine upregulates the expression of immediate early genes such as c Fos, c Jun, Nurr77, and Egr1 .
Mutagenesis of key residues has provided insight into the structure and function of SERT. The addition of a methylene group, via a D98E mutation, restores uptake of gramine to levels expected for dimethyl tryptamine, suggesting that residue D98 forms a direct  interaction with the substrate. Henry et al.  found that the I172 residue in hSERT displays a marked functional divergence with respect to inhibitor but not substrate potencies when the residue is mutated to its dSERT identity .
