It remains unclear, however, if FGFR 1 signaling in epicardial cells is required for EMT, myocardial invasion, and coronary vessel formation. Other key steps in the formation of the coronary vasculature include the determination and differentiation of vascular lineages, including endothelial and smooth muscle cells.
Thalamic barreloid neurons respond typically with 0 3 spikes per stimulus to single or periodic whisker deflections, with a mean of less than 2 spikes/stimulus . Using a population code based on firing synchrony, brief, sparse thalamic responses would be well suited for encoding rapid changes in whisker movement. For example, two spikes from different thalamic neurons are more likely to evoke a cortical spike if they occur within less than 8 ms from each other .
mPGES 1 is an inducible, glutathione dependent, and membrane bound enzyme. Blocking the production of prostaglandin I2  has been reported to play a role in cardiovascular events. ,  Thus mPGES 1 inhibitors are expected to retain the anti inflammatory effect as COX inhibitors without the side effects of COX inhibitors .
Social networks are defined as the web of social relationships that surround an individual. The most commonly examined characteristic in the epidemiologic literature on social networks and breast cancer survival is social network size, i.e. the number of network members. However, in the Women’s Health Initiative, Kroenke and colleagues found that associations between social networks and breast cancer outcomes depended on levels of social support and burden in relationships.
Hypertension is the most common primary diagnosis in the US with about 35 million office visits and is a major risk factor for stroke, myocardial infarction, heart failure, and chronic kidney disease. Consequently, the Seventh Report of the Joint National Committee on Prevention, detection, Evaluation, and Treatment of high blood pressure  recognized lifestyle management as an important factor in the prevention of hypertension. Despite the availability of effective lifestyle factors and pharmacologic agents for the management of hypertension, only modest improvements have been achieved to date.
Cannabis, the most widely used illicit drug worldwide, exerts dose related psychoactive effects when the primary psychoactive component, Δ9 tetrahydrocannabinol , interacts with cannabinoid receptors in brain. THC binding to the CB1 cannabinoid receptor leads to the “high” experienced by cannabis smokers . THC is metabolized by hepatic cytochrome P450 enzymes 2C9 and 2C19 to the equipotent monohydroxy compound , 11 hydroxy THC , and undergoes further oxidation to non psychoactive 11 nor 9 carboxy THC  .
Nicotine, cotinine and 3HC undergo further phaseII detoxification reactions by conjugation with glucuronic acid via catalysis by the UDP glucuronosyltransferase  family of enzymes. Up to 31% of nicotine urinary metabolites are in the form of phase II glucuronidated compounds, with nicotine N glucuronide , cotinine N glucuronide , and cotinine 3′ O glucuronide  comprising the majority of these conjugates . A high correlation exists between the in vivo urinary ratio of nicotine Gluc/ and the ratio of cotinine Gluc/ in smokers.
There is evidence that a patients’ subjective symptomatic experience correlates with improved HRQOL following sinus surgery. , In fact, most of the literature shows that CT imaging does not correlate well with patient symptoms or HRQOL. Sinonasal endoscopy is used to gather critical information about mucosal inflammation before and after therapeutic intervention and is often used to direct ongoing therapy for CRS, however there has been limited investigation into the association between endoscopy results and HRQOL.
Myocardial infarction  and stroke are the leading vascular contributors to illness and death in the United States,,  with hundreds of thousands of Americans experiencing one of these events annually. The chronic care of MI and stroke survivors will place huge burdens on families, health care systems, and public programs such as Medicare and Medicaid . Yet, few studies have compared acute and long term changes in disability due to functional or cognitive problems after MI and stroke in a contemporary cohort of survivors.
Several cluster randomized HIV prevention trials aim to demonstrate the population level preventive impact of antiretroviral therapy . 2013 World Health Organization guidelines raising the ART initiation threshold to CD4<500/µL could attenuate these trials’ effect size by increasing ART usage in control clusters .
Activation of Wnt signaling by means of secreted Wnts leads to increased bone formation. Several lines of evidence have shown that Dkk1 plays an important role in limb morphogenesis and head induction  as well as in bone formation and bone disease. Dkk1 haploinsufficiency has been shown to cause an increase in bone formation and bone mass  and antibody mediated neutralization of endogenous DKK1 has been shown to promote fracture healing .
Environmental factors and genetic variants acting alone and in combination influence two interrelated and highly prevalent metabolic diseases, obesity and atherosclerosis . Many genetic studies have attempted to clarify the relationship between obesity and atherosclerosis, but they show that single gene variants individually and collectively account for only a small part of the genetic variation controlling these disorders . Thus, continued efforts to characterize gene gene and gene environment interactions and to identify specific genes remain important endeavors .
Focal adhesion kinase  is an important cancer target, because FAK gene amplification and protein overexpression have been demonstrated in a wide range of malignancies . Successful targeted therapies that pair small molecule inhibitors with specific activated oncogenes include agents targeting BCR ABL and EML4 ALK translocations, HER2 gene amplification, and activating mutations in EGFR and B RAF . The neurofibromatosis type 2  tumor suppressor gene encodes the Merlin protein, which has sequence homology with the Ezrin/Radixin/Moesin  protein family .
Drug transport into the nail is expected to be influenced by formulation factors, such as pH. Conversely, Malhotra and Zatz and Kobayashi et al.  found pH to be an influential factor in determining nail permeability. The effects of pH upon nail permeability to ions have not been systematically studied, and little work has been done to understand the effects of pH on transungual iontophoresis .
Fibrinogen is a 340,000 kDa protein synthesized in the liver that plays an essential role in clot formation. This allows for interaction of neighboring fibrin monomers to form the matrix that is the foundation of a fibrin clot. The transglutaminase factor XIIIa stabilizes the newly formed clot by forming bonds between neighboring monomers, creating an insoluble fibrin mesh  .
An imbalance between the generation of ROS and the capacity of antioxidant systems can result in oxidative damage to proteins, lipids, and DNA, which, if unrepaired, is important in the pathogenesis of many diseases, including breast cancer . We previously reported that plasma protein carbonyls, and urinary 15 f2t isoprostanes, were associated with an increase in breast cancer risk in a large case control study . Several smaller studies have shown that plasma or serum malondialdehyde, urinary 8 oxodG, and plasma O2.− production are higher in breast cancer cases compared with controls .
Reactive oxygen species  generated during prolonged ischemia and subsequent reperfusion are known to contribute to ischemia/reperfusion injury , although, paradoxically, transient ROS generation is also an essential trigger for cardioprotection by ischemic  and pharmacologic preconditioning . Mitochondria energized with physiologically relevant NADH related substrates produce very little ROS, unless other factors, such as respiratory chain inhibitors  or mitochondrial ATP sensitive K channel activators  are also present. Experiments with isolated cardiac myocytes have demonstrated that hypoxia increases ROS production, and implicate mitochondria as the major source , .
Traumatic injury accounted for 30% of all life years lost in the United States and was the leading cause of death in Americans between 1 and 44 years old . Acute alcohol exposure was encountered in more than 30% of trauma patients and intoxication carried the highest risk for injury . In preclinical trauma studies, alcohol induced vasodilation, diuresis, decreased cardiac output, impaired vasoreactivity, and depressed myocardial contractility negatively impacted resuscitation and worsened outcomes .
In some cases, self movement generates visual information that would not be available otherwise, such as the motion parallax cues to depth that accompany translation of the observer, . Thus, visual information may also play a role in compensating for self movement, and there is evidence in the psychophysics literature that the brain makes use of global patterns of visual motion resulting from observer translation . This produces dynamic perspective distortions of the image in both stimulus coordinates  and in spherical retinal coordinates .
Inorganic polyphosphates are used in the meat industry to increase the water holding capacity  of pork, poultry and beef products . The mechanism of action of polyphosphates to increase WHC is multi factoral, and some of their actions are poorly understood. The dissociation of the actomyosin rigor linkage allows for salt to more effectively extract myosin from the thick filaments.
One group of inhibitors that have been characterized from tick saliva contains cystatin like molecules that were named sialostatin L and sialostatin L2 . Cystatins are inhibitors of C1 type cysteine proteases including the mammalian cathepsins . Binding of legumain is mediated by a completely distinct interaction involving an asparagine residue at position 39 of cystatin C  A number of cystatin forms have been shown to form domain swapped dimers, and the structures of some of these have been determined.
Abdominal aortic calcification  is associated with incident myocardial infarction or stroke, but no study has reported the association of AAC on lateral spine dual energy X ray absorptiometry  images with coronary artery calcium . The primary aim of this study was to assess the association between AAC scored on lateral spine DXA images intended for vertebral fracture assessment  using a validated 24 point semi quantitative scale and coronary artery calcium detected with electron beam computed tomography  in community dwelling older men and women without known heart disease. The secondary aims of this study were to assess the association between AAC scored on VFA images with a newer simplified 8 point semi quantitative scale and CAC scored with EBCT, and to perform an exploratory analysis of the additional prediction of a high CAC level from the additional of AAC score on lateral spine DXA images combined with clinical risk factors compared to the prediction of CAC from clinical risk factors alone .
In S. cerevisiae, silencing blocks expression of cryptic mating type genes at HML and HMR loci . Once recruited to silencers, Sir2 deacetylates a critical K16 acetyl mark on histone H4, , a process required for Sir2/3/4 complexes to bind throughout the locus,,,. Following the de acetylation of H4 K16, methyl marks on H3 K4 and H3 K79 disappear in later steps of silent chromatin formation, .
Human rhinoviruses  cause the common cold and are frequently detected in asthma exacerbations. RV typically induces neutrophilic inflammation in the upper airways of both asthmatic and non asthmatic patients; however, in asthmatics these infections can lead to more severe lower respiratory symptoms, as well as reductions in lung function. Interestingly, the severity of asthma symptoms may not be related to viral load, prolonged viral shedding, or to differences in proinflammatory cytokines in the upper airway secretions.
Individuals with schizophrenia consistently show impairments in social cognition . SC has become a potential treatment target due to its association with functional outcomes. An alternative method of assessment is to administer an observer based scale incorporating an informant’s “first hand” impressions in ratings .
The urbanisation process provides suitable larval breeding sites in the form of septic tanks, discarded metal cans, cisterns, drains, sewers, tires and dumpsters for this mosquito subsequently increasing the probability of the transmission of diseases in high density urban environments . Metallic habitats are of particular interest as they provide a source of metal contamination directly to the breeding site. For these reasons, A. aegypti larvae are subject to physiological stress as a result of metals in the environment.
The insulin/IGF 1 like signaling  pathway is an evolutionarily conserved neuro endocrine pathway that regulates metabolism, development, stress resistance and lifespan . In Caenorhabditis elegans , the insulin like receptor DAF 2  signals through a PI 3 kinase   signaling cascade that activates the downstream serine/threonine kinases PDK 1, AKT 1, AKT 2 and SGK 1 . Reduction of function mutations in serine/threonine kinases upstream of DAF 16 lead to changes in lifespan, development, metabolism and/or stress resistance .
The Breast Cancer Susceptibility Gene 1  encodes a tumor suppressor that acts to maintain genetic stability. In fact, carriers of BRCA1 mutations have a 4475% lifetime risk for developing breast cancer  and up to an approximate 45% risk for developing a second primary breast cancer . Germline mutations in BRCA1 are responsible for approximately half of hereditary breast cancer cases .
Federal regulation of cigarettes and other tobacco products has been recommended as an element of a broad based approach to reduce the disease burden of tobacco use . One component of federal regulation is likely to be the power to mandate limits of emissions of tobacco smoke toxins. It has been suggested that reduction of nicotine availability would make cigarettes less addicting and might facilitate quitting, thereby reducing smoking related disease .
Advances in targeted therapy have not dramatically improved the outcomes of patients with metastatic CRC, and the majority of those with unresectable metastatic disease still die within 2 years of the diagnosis of metastasis . The chemotherapeutic agent Irinotecan , which is commonly used in treating cancers such as metastatic CRC, causes S phase specific death of proliferating cells by inhibiting DNA topoisomerase I . Irinotecan is converted by carboxylesterase into SN38 , which is 1,000 fold more potent than unconverted Irinotecan .
While proportion recalled in free recall is a sensitive test of the state of the human memory system, there is still much room for improvement before such tests can be used to predict, in a useful way, which specific patients will go on to develop these disorders . Tulving’s work highlighted the importance of organization in understanding memory search, and specifically, the role of the retrieval cue in determining the relative probability with which various studied items will be retrieved from memory. Free recall provides us with a paradigm where the ability of a participant to successfully retrieve studied material depends on the moment to moment composition of an internally maintained retrieval cue, and the associations between this cue and stored information.
The vascular injury in systemic sclerosis  occurs very early in the disease, even before the onset of fibrosis. It has been suggested that vessel permeability and injury coincide with the infiltration of immune cells, mainly consisting of T cells and macrophages localised at perivascular regions. This immune cell recruitment is facilitated by vascular endothelial cells which, upon injury, upregulate adhesion molecules such as VCAM 1, ICAM 1 and E selectin, ultimately leading to immune activation, cell recruitment and tissue damage.
A growing interest in the field of glycobiology, defined in a broad sense as the study of sugars and their roles in biology, has emerged in recent years. Glycoconjugates, which include three broad groups, proteoglycans, glycoproteins, and glycolipids, are ubiquitously distributed in the cells, bodily fluids, tissues and organs, including the brain, of all animals, and are primarily, localized on the cell surface. Further, disruptions in these systems have been linked to several neurological disorders, such as Alzheimer's disease  and Huntington's disease .
Dendritic cells  are the primary antigen presenting cells  that mediate T cell immunity and tolerance . Following activation by pathogenic stimuli skin DCs upregulate MHC II, CD40, CD80, and CD86 molecules and migrate to the skin draining lymph nodes  to prime naïve T cells . Recent studies suggest several possibilities regarding the relative contributions of skin DCs  to cross presentation of skin derived Ag, T cell priming, viral immunity, and contact hypersensitivity .
The importance of karyotype at diagnosis in predicting outcome in patients with acute myeloid leukemia  and myelodysplastic syndrome  is well established. These studies have clearly demonstrated that the outcome for patients with chromosome 5 and 7 abnormalities  have an inferior leukemia free survival and overall survival when traditional cytotoxic chemotherapy, including combinations of cytarabine and anthracyclines, are used. Such inferior outcome is also seen even with the use of allogeneic stem cell transplantation in first complete remission .
Internationally, the Peer Change Agent  model is one of the most frequently used conceptual frameworks for HIV prevention interventions . Peer change agents  are generally trained to use similar strategies to communicate HIV risk reduction messages among targeted peers. Change agents themselves, however, can often be more important than the messages they convey.
CL is localized to both inner and outer mitochondrial membranes and within contact sites in mammalian cells . CL is required for the reconstituted activity of a number of key mitochondrial enzymes involved in cellular oxidative metabolism . CL also plays an essential role in mitochondrial biogenesis , and the assembly of respiratory enzyme supercomplexes .
Constitutive activation of the ERK1/2 pathway alters gene expression to promote proliferation and metastasis . Selective inhibition of oncogenic BRAF with vemurafenib  suppresses ERK signaling, causes melanoma tumor regression, and increases patient survival . Thus, a better understanding of the molecular mechanisms by which oncogenic BRAF transforms melanocytes and the cellular response to BRAF inhibition in melanoma are needed .
The “two hit” model of NASH was proposed in 1998  in which alterations in lipid homeostasis associated with obesity, insulin resistance and adipokine disruption result in steatosis and constitute the “first hit”. This sensitizes the liver to potential “second hits” resulting in hepatocellular injury, inflammation and fibrosis. Oxidative stress is frequently cited as a central mechanism of hepatocellular injury in NASH, correlating with the accumulation of lipid peroxidation products, appearance of mitochondrial dysfunction  and elevation of pro inflammatory cytokines.
Rodents treated acutely with MK801 show a neurotoxic effect in various cortical regions. Using 4T proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy , our group documented transitory elevations in the anterior cingulate  glutamine  and in Gln to glutamate  ratios  in healthy subjects exposed to ketamine. However, the relevance of these acute changes to a chronic illness such as schizophrenia is unclear .
Fibers at the lens center are coupled with cells at the lens surface through a highly developed gap junction mediated intercellular communication network. Multiple mutations of Cx46 and Cx50 have been identified that are directly linked to human autosomal congenital cataracts . In gene knockout models, mice lacking either fiber specific connexin, Cx46 or Cx50, develop lens cataracts .
Recent surveys have shown that low income households often cut back on basic necessities or take less medication than prescribed due to out of pocket drug costs . In general, cost sharing was included in the policy to make the Medicare benefit similar in structure to private health insurance and to promote “personal responsibility” by making people accountable for part of the costs of their care. Estimates of the out of pocket drug costs to dual eligible beneficiaries range from $94 to $742 in 2006 .
APCs expressing a broad spectrum of self antigens are responsible for the establishment of central tolerance through depletion of high affinity self reactive T cells. This results in the selection of T cells expressing receptors recognizing a universe of foreign antigens in association with self MHC in the absence of autoreactivity. Although B cells also reside in the thymus in normal mice and humans , less attention has been paid to the thymic B cell population.
The primate auditory system is characterized by two parallel, chemically defined processing pathways that can be segregated based on immunoreactivity to either parvalbumin  or calbindin . The immunoreactivity to these calcium binding proteins  is sufficient to differentiate specific subdivisions of auditory nuclei, especially in midbrain, thalamic, and cortical structures . Together, these characteristics make CaBP expressing interneurons powerful inhibitors in these cerebral structures.
Acute myocardial infarction  is one of the leading causes of morbidity and mortality in the adult population that strikes 7.6 million American adults, or about one person every 44 seconds in the United States. However, the reperfusion of ischemic tissue can itself lead to severe myocardial damage. Intensive research efforts have been focused on the amelioration of various pathophysiological components of ischemia/reperfusion  injury to limit the extent of cell death.
In humans, butyrylcholinesterase  is the primary endogenous cocaine metabolizing enzyme capable of catalyzing this reaction in plasma. Initial experiments in rats and mice showed that CocH is likely to be effective as an enzyme therapy or gene therapy for treating cocaine abuse by greatly reducing the reward value of a given drug dosage. Two clinical trials  of hBChE have been performed by Baxter Healthcare Corporation, although the clinical data have not been made available .
However, it does not consistently protect the joint from osteoarthritis  progression over the long term, , . The high number of sports related ACL injuries in young individuals, and the lack of effective treatment options for knee OA in this population makes this an emerging problem . Mechanical factors, such as abnormal tibiofemoral kinematics and aberrant articular contact stress following ACL rupture and reconstruction likely contribute to the onset and progression of OA, .
One approach is to utilize natural suppressors of metastasis to identify their downstream targets. Metastasis suppressors are genes that do not significantly alter primary tumor growth but prevent cancer cells from undergoing metastasis, . Raf 1 Kinase Inhibitory Protein  functions as a metastasis suppressor in prostate, , colorectal, , and breast  cancer, and is prognostic for survival in a number of tumors, , .
Family based linkage analysis has been highly successful in identifying genetic loci underlying Mendelian disorders. While many complex trait and disease variants have been identified through genome wide association studies , the majority of these loci have small effect sizes and cumulatively explain relatively little of the overall risk. This provides an ability to re address the failures of family based linkage approaches to identify complex trait loci.
The innate immune response relies on the recognition of the antigen by receptors that recognize specific structures found exclusively in microbial pathogens termed pathogen associated molecular patterns  . It has been demonstrated that targeting APCs with different TLR adjuvants could enhance or induce the activation of antitumor responses . We have recently demonstrated that intratumoral injections of CpG ODN is the most effective strategy to delay tumor growth in young and old mice .
The brain is a high oxygen consuming organ and constantly exposed to oxidative stress. In addition, since the brain contains high concentrations of polyunsaturated fatty acids and has a relatively weak antioxidative capacity, it is particularly vulnerable to oxidative stress . Indeed, there is substantial evidence for increased lipoperoxidation in neurodegenerative disease associated with oxidative stress, such as Alzheimer disease and Parkinson disease  .
Individuals with salt sensitivity of blood pressure  are usually unable to excrete excess sodium without experiencing a concurrent increase in arterial pressure , . These individuals are at increased risk for essential hypertension, cardiovascular disease , and premature death , . There is strong evidence that genetic mechanisms may underlie the inter individual variation in BP response to salt intake .
Schizophrenia is associated with very high rates of tobacco addiction  relative to the general population  . Nicotine, the primary addictive and reinforcing constituent in cigarettes, has high affinity for the beta2 subunit containing nicotinic acetylcholine receptors . Evidence from postmortem , preclinical , and clinical  studies demonstrates that chronic administration of nicotine and tobacco smoking increases the number of β2* nAChRs in most brain regions , a process that is commonly referred to as “upregulation”.
Perhaps most importantly, functional imaging offers a means of examining brain activity that is global in its scope as well as non invasive: both of which are necessary to reveal the complex distribution of activity that is the hallmark of a functioning brain . While fMRI exhibits better spatial resolution than MEG, this technique, like all haemodynamic based modalities, measures a surrogate signal  whose spatial specificity and temporal response are subject to both physical and biological constraints . Thus, BOLD fMRI relies on a complex coupling between neural activity, cerebral metabolism and blood flow and this, along with the shortcoming that the surrogate signal reflects neuronal mass activity, makes unambiguous data interpretation difficult in some cases.
Additionally, several methods for correlating the data have been introduced including across  or within  conditions, across  or within  subjects, or some combination of these. However, several papers have outlined drawbacks of applying SEM to fMRI data , with two of the more commonly cited being its requirement of an a priori anatomical model of regions and directed paths and its assumption of instantaneous connections. While the use of Granger causality is increasing, neither it nor AR analysis have enjoyed the same popularity as SEM, having been applied to only a handful of neural systems  .
Recent discoveries linking tiny pieces of RNA, called microRNAs , with the activity of thousands of genes are fueling excitement about the roles that these molecules play inside the cell . The reasons for such imperfections and the potential functional role that the non canonical bases might play are open questions of biological relevance . The double helices detected in the high resolution structures of other types of RNA are also imperfect in that the bases on interacting fragments form non canonical as well as Watson Crick base pairs .
It has been estimated that up to 30% of all mutations resulting in human genetic disorders result in PTCs . When the translation complex pauses at a PTC that is upstream of an EJC, eukaryotic release factors recruit the RNA helicase UPF1, a vital component of the NMD mechanism . Phosphorylated UPF1 recruits SMG 7 and SMG5, two 14 3 3 proteins which each bind to UPF1 and form a heterodimer, and results in the de phosphorylation of UPF 1 by PP2A .
In the first study designed specifically to test the hypothesis of differential genetic etiology of reading deficits as a function of IQ,  analyzed composite reading data and measures of IQ adjusted for their relationship to word reading  from 247 same sex twin pairs participating in the Colorado Reading Project. Thus, in an effort to test the hypothesis of differential genetic etiology of reading deficits more rigorously,  subjected composite reading performance data from a larger sample of same sex twin pairs than had previously been available  to DF analysis. When the basic model  was fitted separately to data from subjects with higher IQ scores  and lower IQ , resulting estimates of h2g were .72 and .43, respectively, a significant difference .
It has been validated in phantoms, animals, and humans, and is performed clinically as well as in research . Because the water and various fat peaks  have different T2 values, accurate fat quantification requires correction for T2  . Both PRESS  and STEAM  sequences have served as gold standards for liver fat quantification in clinical studies, suggesting that both sequences are valid.
Lead is now accepted to lower children’s IQ at commonly encountered exposures, and no threshold has been determined for this effect. Accordingly, in May 2012 the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention eliminated the terminology “level of concern,” which was previously defined as a blood lead level concentration of 10 µg/dL. Rather, children with elevated blood lead concentrations will be identified using a reference value based on the 97.5th percentile of the NHANES generated blood lead concentration distribution in children aged 15 years old; currently, this value is 5 µg/dL.
The prevalence of overweight among children in Texas is higher compared to U.S. wide estimates, especially among economically disadvantaged populations . National prevalence estimates indicate 16% of Mexican American adolescents are obese and 34% are overweight based on the CDC BMI for age growth charts . Additional details on Senate Bill 19 are provided elsewhere  .
Reactive oxygen species generated by inflammatory cells at sites of ovulation have been suggested to lead to DNA mutations increasing cancer risk . MPO is present at high levels in neutrophils and monocytes, and catalyzes reactions with hydrogen peroxide and chloride to produce hypochlorous acid , a potent microbicidal agent that damages DNA, proteins, and lipids . This atypical expression can lead to oxidative damage to normal tissues contributing to atherosclerosis , Alzheimer’s disease , and some types of cancer .
However, the cloning capacity of AAV vectors is close to its wild type genome length  and this represents a limitation for gene therapies of several IRs due to defects in larger genes, such as Usher1B , Stargardt disease 1 , and LCA10 . The retinal transduction potential of each of them has been evaluated in vivo in animal models: recombinant vectors based on Ad5, the most studied Ad serotype in the context of gene therapy, transduce the RPE primarily when injected subretinally in the mouse retina . The LV VSVG whether based on the human immunodeficiency virus  , simian   or feline immunodeficiency viruses   transduces the RPE mainly when delivered in adult retinas.
Diabetes and its complications remain major causes of morbidity and mortality in the US  . In order to prevent CVD and other complications, the American Diabetes Association  recommends that adults with diabetes maintain an HbA1c <53 mmol/mol , blood pressure <130/80 mmHg, and low density lipoprotein  cholesterol <2.6 mmol/L . Recent analyses from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey  showed that these goals are seldom met in the US: about 4050% of patients with type 2 diabetes meet any one of ADA goals and only 512% of patients with type 2 diabetes meet all three goals .
Since the late 1990’s, it has been proposed that the BOLD responses obtained from the same experiments could be introduced as prior in the source covariance matrix R. For example,  used BOLD activation maps to set the diagonal elements of R to non zero values at source locations where the BOLD activations were above a given threshold. Several studies have proposed to address this issue by imposing a partial fMRI constraint  or by modeling more finely the relationship between the BOLD signals and the EEG/MEG measurements . FMRI data can be used in a different way to serve as a source constraint.
Pentachlorophenol  is a synthetic molecule that has been used throughout the world for purposes as varied as antimicrobial agent, detergent and wood preservative. Even though its use has been restricted after the 1980s, it is still widely present in the environment, and it is considered as a chemical pollutant of concern . The air and the food chain are main pathways for human exposure to this compound, and it is possible to detect significant concentrations of PCP in the plasma of various age groups including newborns .
Mosquito coils have been and are still the most commonly used mosquito repellents worldwide. Mosquito coils are made of biomass base materials impregnated with insecticides. Through slow and steady combustion , a mosquito coil evaporates insecticides that prevent mosquitoes from entering indoor environments.
Colon cancer is third most malignant tumor type involving uncontrolled growth of cells in colon. Apart from genetic reasons, prolonged high consumption of western type diet augments risk of colon cancer in majority of patients. Gut microflora convert these primary bile acids to secondary bile acids, lithocholic acid and deoxycholic acid by de hydroxylation.
Cyclodextrins are cyclic oligosaccharides with hydrophobic interiors used as formulation vehicles to increase the amount of drug, including hormones and vitamins, which can be solubilized in aqueous vehicles . 2 hydroxypropyl β cyclodextrin  was extensively studied in rodents, dogs, and monkeys where it was generally well tolerated at low doses . Daily intravenous administration of greater than 200 mg/kg caused reduced body weight, foamy macrophage infiltration of the lungs, elevations in hepatic enzymes, increased Kuppfer cells in the liver, and renal cortical tubular vacuolization in rodents .
T cell exhaustion is a type of immune response describing the condition in which T cells exhibit reduced differentiation, proliferation and effector function. Phenotypically, PD 1 expression has been demonstrated to be a marker to identify exhausted T cells in viral infection and tumors . However it is not known which cytokine can up regulate CD70 expression on T cells .
Using plasma samples from a previous study, Sax et al. found in 252 patients with HIV, that BG had a sensitivity of 92% and a specificity of 65% for the diagnosis of PCP, using a cutoff value of 80 pg/mL. In another study comparing 28 serum samples of patients with HIV or hematological malignancy vs. 28 control patients, the sensitivity and specificity of BG for PCP were 100% and 96.4%, respectively. A prospective study from Japan in immunocompromised patients, using 40 BAL and 107 sputum samples of patients with clinical suspicion of PCP, found a sensitivity and specificity of 100% and 80% using a cutoff of 15 pg/mL of BG for the diagnosis of definitive PCP .
The hallmark of these diseases is the presence of intraepidermal vesicles  and anti epidermal autoantibodies . Pemphigus foliaceus  and pemphigus vulgaris  are the two major phenotypes of pemphigus . Immunologically, the sera of PF patients show anti Dsg1 antibodies, while the sera of PV patients contain antibodies to Dsg3  or both Dsg1 and Dsg3  .
Smoking is the leading cause of preventable death among women and a leading preventable cause of poor pregnancy and infant outcomes in high income countries . Self reported smoking during pregnancy in nine countries in Latin America, Asia, and Africa was highest in two countries, Uruguay  and Argentina  . Studies in high income countries have found that women’s self reported smoking status during pregnancy can underestimate smoking prevalence by 24 28%, and intervention studies have documented differences in self reported and biochemically verified quitting .
Polarized membrane trafficking of signaling receptors is critical for developing neurons to respond to extracellular stimuli mediating growth, guidance and neuronal survival. The family of tropomyosin related kinases  receptors provides a prominent example of trophic factor receptors that undergo long distance axonal trafficking to regulate growth and survival of developing neurons . A key mechanism by which the prototypical neurotrophin, NGF, secreted by peripheral target tissues, provides trophic support to sympathetic neurons is by regulating endocytosis and retrograde trafficking of NGF:TrkA complexes in signaling endosomes from axon terminals to cell bodies .
Researchers have long sought to understand juvenile delinquency because of its very clear social costs . One approach to understanding delinquency focuses on parenting behaviors, which are commonly labeled “monitoring.” Recently, however, there has been a call to reconceptualize the way the parental monitoring construct is operationally defined, and evidence has been presented in support of this argument . A second approach to understanding delinquency utilizes measures of personality .
Urinary citrate is an important inhibitor of calcium stones and low urinary citrate is a common contributor to many stone types . First, human NaDC1 has a very low affinity for citrate , which would limit the complete reabsorption of citrate. Also, our previous studies strongly suggest that a novel calcium sensitive transport process is present in cultured proximal tubule cells and this transport process does not appear to be NaDC1 .
The prevalence of type 2 diabetes is increasing worldwide, and is expected to affect 380 million people by 2025. In the US, use of sulfonylureas  continue to be one of the main classes used to manage type 2 diabetes. Despite over three decades of treatment experience with glipizide and glyburide, it remains unknown whether co administration of anti infective agents increases the risk of hypoglycemia, as suggested by case reports.
More specifically, internalizing behaviors, low educational expectations and aspirations, and impulsivity are related to different components of psychological functioning  . Moreover, these three components of psychological functioning noted above appear to be related to aspects of neurocognitive dysfunction . Therefore, in this study we propose that adolescent internalizing behaviors will be correlated with aspects of later neurocognitive dysfunction in adults in their thirties .
Epistasis experiments revealed that A20 restricts TLR and nucleosome binding oligomerization domain  triggered NF κB signaling, in addition to TNF induced NF κB and programmed cell death  signaling . Thus, A20 restricts a number of innate immune signaling pathways in macrophages and fibroblasts. The severe systemic inflammation and cachexia caused by A20 deficiency is ameliorated in mice that also lack the TLR adapter protein MyD88 .
Our laboratory has shown that patients with sickle cell disease  have significantly decreased HDL C and apoA I., We have also demonstrated that among SCD patients, those with lower apoA I levels have impaired vasodilatory responses to acetylcholine during forearm blood flow strain gauge plethysmography , and they tend to have elevated estimated pulmonary artery systolic pressures, an echocardiographic marker of pulmonary hypertension. In support of this finding, in pulmonary arterial hypertension patients without SCD, plasma HDL C levels are low, and predict clinical worsening and death. Niacin ER treatment promotes an increase in HDL C containing apoA I.
Gene modification by homologous recombination  is a relatively inefficient process mammalian cells, typically occurring at a low frequency of about one event per 105   107treated cells as compared to the high rate of random, non targeted integration of the donor DNA , which occurs in about one cell per 102   105 treated cells. Several approaches including positive negative selection have been used to enrich the ratio of targeted recombinants to random integrants for applications in mouse embryonic stem  cells . When a defined chromosomal double strand break  is introduced at a unique chromosomal site, local HR is induced at that site in a large fraction of the cells with the damage .
Addressing the sexual and reproductive health needs of people living with HIV is an emerging concern in secondary HIV prevention, especially in sub Saharan Africa with generalised epidemics and large numbers of reproductive age women living with HIV. The limited studies of fertility intentions among HIV positive men indicate they also want to have children . Consequently, little is known about HIV positive men's attitudes about safer conception, particularly in the sub Saharan African context of high HIV prevalence and high value placed upon having children .
BDNF levels increased in peptidergic nociceptors, and there is de novo expression in cell bodies of large diameter afferents . Experimental manipulation of either BDNF or TrkB, the receptor through which BDNF signals, also significantly alters nociceptive processing. For example, genetic deletion of BDNF from NaV1.8 expressing nociceptors decreased inflammation induced thermal hyperalgesia .
The treatment of these conditions remains imperfect and expensive. There is hope that stem cell therapy may prove beneficial as it has been increasingly well established that stem cells play an important role in wound healing. For example, artificial skin substitutes have been shown to be more effective when stem cells are incorporated into these membranes.
The Ang II induced reduction in body mass  can be alleviated by treatment with an angiotensin receptor blocker  suggesting that the mechanism of mass loss is angiotensin receptor mediated  . In addition, the ubiquitin proteasome pathway of proteolysis, which is stimulated by elevated glucocorticoids, appears to be the major catabolic mechanism by which Ang II induces increased skeletal muscle atrophy, and thus reduced body mass . In general, glucocorticoids predominantly blunt pituitary GH responsiveness and antagonize GH actions, especially the hepatic production of IGF1 .
Neural stem/precursor cells  have recently generated much interest as a therapeutic means of reducing neural tissue loss after neurodegenerative diseases or central nervous system  injury. In the latter processes, adult rodent SVZ NPC migration through the rostral migratory stream is essential in replacing olfactory bulb interneurons . Pituitary adenylate cyclase activating polypeptide  and vasoactive intestinal peptide  belong to the same family of peptides and have well established trophic properties through shared G protein coupled receptor signaling .
Sickle cell disease  associated vasculopathy in the penis is characterized by aberrant nitric oxide and phosphodiesterase  5 signaling, and by increased oxidative stress. Preliminary clinical trials show that continuous treatment with PDE5 inhibitor sildenafil unassociated with sexual activity decreases priapic activity in patients with SCD. However, the mechanism of its vasculoprotective effect in the penis remains unclear .
,  So far, two ENGases have been frequently used for the chemoenzymatic synthesis, including the Endo A from Arthrobactor protophormiae  that is specific for high mannose type N glycans, and the Endo M from Mucor hiemalis,  that can act on both complex and high mannose type N glycans. For example, in vitro remodeling of a glycoprotein using a natural complex type N glycopeptide as the donor substrate and wild type Endo M as the enzyme resulted in only a low yield  of the desired glycoprotein even when a large excess  of the donor substrate was used. It was demonstrated that the activated oligosaccharide oxazoline corresponding to the Man3GlcNAc tetrasaccharide core, and some of its structurally modified forms, were able to serve as donor substrates for transglycosylation.
The distal vasculature in the adult lung—distributed through approximately 300,000,000 alveoli—is a major site of injury and remodeling in acute lung injury . Once destroyed by injury or disease the spontaneous restoration of small vessel and capillary networks, leading to better lung function, has proved limited. While major advances have been made in the treatment and management of patients with ALI, vascular loss remains a significant clinical problem.
Direct evidence that MPH produces a discriminative stimulus comes from several drug discrimination studies in humans , rats  and mice . In experimental settings, psychostimulant sensitization is commonly demonstrated as increased locomotor activity following repeated exposures to the drug. With operant drug discrimination tasks, the influence of previous drug experience on discriminability has been most commonly studied with regard to effects of the training dose on the discriminative stimulus response function, and a comprehensive review has recently been published .
Early and successful reperfusion of the acutely ischemic myocardium is the most effective salvage against irreversible ischemic injury , but can also cause reperfusion injury. Despite a clear understanding of the role of ROS in reperfusion injury, there are no adjuvant treatments currently administered in routine clinical practice to protect the heart against reperfusion injury . Accordingly, our groups have formed a consortium to investigate the pre clinical efficacy of the mitochondria targeting peptide, Bendavia.
One class of lung cancer is non small cell lung carcinoma  . In advanced disease current front line therapies consist of chemotherapeutic doublets . Phase II genes are family of enzymes that under increased oxidative stress are up regulated, eliciting a response which detoxifies the stressors, often through conjugation to glutathione.
Cooling towers are heat rejection devices used in industrial settings to efficiently cool building water systems without the use of chemical refrigerants. Both microbes and substrata for microbial growth can either be present in the incoming water or introduced from the atmosphere. Biofilms both harbor and protect pathogens , and microbial ecological interactions in biofilms are particularly important for Legionella species and other pathogens that infect amoebae .
Early pharmacological based studies suggested the existence of at leastjust two receptors for cysteinyl leukotrienes  and these speculations were later confirmed with the cloning of the CysLT1 and 2 receptors . The CysLT1 receptor is expressed prominently on airway smooth muscle cells, mediates bronchospasm, and is the target of current leukotriene receptor antagonists. Neither of these receptors binds LTE4 with clinically relevant affinity .
In the past, most of medical schools’ curricula were based on the traditional model of teaching in which education activities were reduced to a transfer of information . Often students relied on memorization and became overly focused on a short term objective “What do I have to know to pass the exam?” In many instances, students failed to connect newly acquired material to preexisting knowledge and apply principles needed for problem solving and understanding concepts  . Creating an interactive and self directed learning environment has been a critical part of enhancing student performance at Mayo Medical School .
A central tenet of cancer biology states that cancer is clonal, with tumors arising as the result of expansion of increasingly dysregulated cells. While this is almost certainly true of some cancers, particularly those induced by well characterized mutagens , other known human carcinogens are not mutagenic  and may be less prone to induce cancers via this mechanism. Asbestos, which is known to induce mesothelioma, is an example of a non mutagenic carcinogen.
Medication adherence is generally defined as the extent to which patients take medications as prescribed by their health care providers . A meta analysis revealed that most of the literature in this area examined the dynamic between depression and medication adherence in the context of chronic illnesses; across the 31 studies  that were reviewed, the majority of the studies were about cardiovascular diseases and diabetes. Importantly, some studies have shown that people who were acutely or persistently depressed tended to over report their treatment nonadherence, compared to those who were in remission from depression, and those who were not depressed .
Subsequent studies have revealed that Bmi1 is required by both normal and leukemic hematopoietic stem cells to maintain their proliferative capacity . In addition, Bmi1 has been shown to be important for self renewal of neural stem cells , and its expression is essential for the tumorigenicity of MycN induced neuroblastoma . Perhaps the most prominent link between Bmi1 and tumor development is its inhibition of the Ink4A/Arf locus, which results in the regulation of cell senescence and proliferation  .
The psychoactive properties of cannabis have been recognized since early time and today, it remains the most widely used illicit drug globally. The search for the active ingredients of the plant led to the first identification of its main psychoactive ingredient, δ 9 tetrahydrocannabinol , and the subsequent development of cannabinoid medications . Several cannabinoid medications are currently FDA approved in the United States or in phase III trials, such as Dronabinol, Nabilone, or Nabiximols.
Ordered progression through the eukaryotic cell cycle depends on mechanisms that tie the abundance and activity of critical regulatory molecules to the events of DNA replication and cellular division. By destroying proteins at specific points in the cell cycle, the Ubproteasome system  provides directionality to the events of cell duplication, and insures that each phase of the cycle occurs after the previous one is completed  . One of the most popular approaches is to arrest cells at specific cell cycle stages, either by chemical or growth factor blockade, and to then release cells back into the cycle and monitor them as they move in synchrony through subsequent cell cycle transitions.
These observations, combined with reports that Müller glia in postnatal chicks and rodents have a limited capacity to regenerate neurons following retinal injury , implicated Müller glia as a source of retinal progenitors that participate in repair of damaged retinas . Support for Müller glia as a source of retinal progenitors comes from studies using transgenic fish where the fate of GFP expressing Müller glia can be followed for short periods of time following retinal injury . Using transgenic fish harboring a 1016bp fragment of the tuba1a promoter driving GFP expression  we found that tuba1a expressing Müller glia respond to retinal injury by dedifferentiating and proliferating .
Malignant gliomas, including anaplastic astrocytoma  grade III) and glioblastoma multiforme  are among the most devastating malignancies. Despite recent advances in therapy, treatment of malignant gliomas remains palliative. Recently, cancer cells with stem cell like properties have been described in a wide range of human tumors.
Numerous studies suggest that intrauterine infection is an important mechanism leading to preterm labor and may account for 40% of preterm births . Bacterial infections that ascend from the lower FRT are the most common route of uterine infection, and it is not known why some women suffer such infections that threaten pregnancies and fetal survival . In a healthy pregnancy, the uterus and growing fetus are protected from ascending infection by the cervix  .
Core components of the PCMH include comprehensive primary care, enhanced access, care management, and quality improvement; all directed toward the fundamental goal of orienting care around the needs of the patient., There is significant momentum behind the adoption of the medical home, with coalitions of industry stakeholders and health care policymakers calling for widespread use of the model in primary care. One anticipated benefit of the model is that the PCMH will better position health care systems and providers to support a patient’s active role in maintaining their health and managing their diseases. Patient activation can lead to a broad range of health benefits such as higher rates of recommended screening, reductions in unhealthy behaviors, improvements in blood pressure and cholesterol, and fewer emergency department visits and hospitalizations.
In a study employing APCs with decreased costimulatory capacity , higher peptide concentrations were required to induce proliferation of naïve T cells than were required for effector/memory T cells. In effector/memory T cells, higher peptide concentrations usually result in apoptosis. In contrast, Sabzevari et al.  reported that effector/memory CD4+ T cells from pigeon cytochrome c TCR Tg mice were more susceptible to apoptosis induced by APCs expressing B7 1 in the presence of high affinity cognate peptide compared to naïve CD4+ T cells.
The sulphydryl containing amino acid, cysteine plays an important role in intermediary metabolism in the heart. In premature and new born infants, cysteine is considered to be an essential dietary component . In addition to the above roles, cysteine availability is thought to be one of the major rate limiting factors controlling the synthesis of glutathione  .
About 50% of AMLs present cytogenetic abnormalities of various types that can be used to categorise the patients into different risk groups. The FMS like tyrosine kinase 3 , a member of the Type III RTK subfamily, is a membrane bound tyrosine kinase receptor, which together with its ligand FL, has an important role in the normal development of stem cells and the immune system., The FLT3 protein is commonly mutated in AML, with 2030% of cases carrying an internal tandem duplication within the juxtamembrane domain  and 812% a single point mutation at position 835 in the kinase domain , leading to constitutive signalling and enhanced cell survival and proliferation. By themselves, FLT3 ITD mutant proteins are sufficient to induce a myeloproliferative disorder, but the development of FLT3 ITD AML may require additional mutations that impair haematopoietic differentiation.
It is widely believed that somatic as well as germline mutations play important roles in the origin and progression of colorectal cancers . Many genes have been investigated for mutation to elucidate mechanisms of colorectal cancer development, with these investigations demonstrating the involvement of mutations in colorectal carcinogenesis and progression. Samuels et al. reported that PIK3CA, a catalytic subunit of the class IA phosphatidylinositol 3 kinases, was somatically mutated in 32% of colorectal cancers, resulting in the attenuation of apoptosis and facilitated tumor invasion.
Engrailed  is a homeodomain containing transcriptional regulator that has an important role in nervous system development. It is found ubiquitously in bilaterian animals, indicating that it arose more than 500 million years ago, in the Cambrian era . En has a role in cerebellar patterning , and the gradient of En in the tectum activates ephrin expression and guides retinal axons .
High plasma triglyceride  concentration is an important risk factor for cardiovascular disease , particularly in women, who have a two  to three fold greater relative risk for CVD associated with an increase in plasma TG concentration than men . Therefore, interventions that decrease or prevent an increase in plasma TG concentrations might be important in reducing CVD, especially in women. Aerobic exercise lowers plasma TG concentration  and this might, at least in part, provide a mechanism for the cardioprotective effect of regular, endurance type physical activity .
Free living and institutionalized older persons who experience weight loss often are psychologically depressed , and treatment for the depression has been shown to help these persons regain weight . Furthermore, aerobic fitness was a strong predictor of higher physical functioning, vitality, and lower mood disturbance . In a randomized controlled trial, aerobic exercise was shown to increase vitality and general health in older persons  .
MicroRNAs  are 21 24 nucleotide RNA molecules that regulate the translational efficiency and stability of target messenger RNAs . Moreover, specific miRNAs exhibit oncogenic and tumor suppressor activity, supporting a causative role for altered miRNA expression in cancer pathogenesis. Examples of known oncogenic miRNAs include the miR 17 92 cluster, which accelerates tumorigenesis in models of both solid and hematopoietic malignancies,, miR 21, which has pro proliferative and anti apoptotic activity in several tumor types, and miR 155, which promotes lymphomagenesis.
The role it plays with respect to numerous critical neural circuits makes it a strong candidate for genetic association studies of behavior. The rs6318 variant is among those demonstrating the most consistent results in association studies . We recently reported that in a sample of males HTR2C rs6318 was associated with serum cortisol responses to a series of emotional stress tasks in the laboratory .
HIV associated neurologic disorders  are characterized by a spectrum of central nervous system  complications. Based on disease progression, HAND can range from asymptomatic neurocognitive impairment  to minor neurocognitive disorder  to the more severe HIV associated dementia . Highly active antiretroviral therapy  has deceased the frequency of HAD, but HAND is still common: more than 50 % of HIV infected persons receiving HAART demonstrate milder HAND syndromes , including ANI and MND.
In 2010, approximately 35% of adult women in the United States were obese. Women of childbearing age are at particularly high risk for significant weight gain during their reproductive years. Women who fail to lose their pregnancy associated weight in the postpartum period are at significant risk of weight gain and midlife obesity in comparison with women who returned to their pre pregnancy weight.
Cancer cells are characterized by metabolic alterations and the tumor microenvironment is often marked with impaired blood flow and hypoxia, all of which can elicit endoplasmic reticulum  stress. Tumor cells adapt to these adverse conditions by activating the unfolded protein response , with induction of GRP78 as a major pro survival arm of the UPR signaling pathways . GRP78, also referred to as BiP/HSPA5, is a 78 kilodalton glucose regulated protein with potent anti apoptotic properties that plays critical roles in cancer cell survival, tumor progression, metastasis and resistance to therapy .
Ischemia/reperfusion injury  involves the transient deprivation of blood flow and oxygen followed by the return of blood flow during reperfusion. Liver IRI and subsequent dysfunction or failure occurs in many clinical settings including transplantation surgery, tissue resections or hemorrhagic shock . Liver IRI has been reported to cause up to 10% of early organ dysfunction, leading to increased rates of acute and chronic rejection .
An important aspect of Wnt signaling involves the regulation of cell polarity and cell motility via the non canonical signaling cascade . For non canonical Wnt signaling, the Wnt signal is transduced via the Wnt receptor Frizzled  to the cytoplasmic protein Dishevelled , and this pathway regulates cell movement during gastrulation via modification of the actin cytoskeleton . Downstream of Dvl, the small GTPases Rho and Rac are activated by two independent pathways .
During vascular development, smooth muscle cells are initially highly proliferative, then become quiescent and express proteins that allow the cells to assume a highly contractive phenotype. SRF is ubiquitously expressed; therefore tissue specific cofactors for SRF provide target specificity. Myocardin and the related proteins MRTF A and MRTF B are established SRF cofactors important for smooth muscle differentiation .
Anorexia nervosa  and bulimia nervosa  are separate disorders in the DSM IV TR, although their diagnostic boundaries are far from stable . We apply behavioral genetic methods to determine the extent to which this partially overlapping symptom picture could be attributable to shared genetic or environmental factors . AN is marked by low weight; however, provisions are made for the presence of bulimic symptoms in the binge purge subtype .
Once transcriptional regulation has occurred, AhR is exported to the cytosol and degraded by calpain and proteasomes  . Recently, a whole issue in the journal of Biochemical Pharmacology was dedicated to discussing functions of AhR that are of physiological relevance and are independent of inducing cytochromes P450  . The AhR appears to have constitutive expression and activity in established cell lines from human adult T cell leukemia  and in some primary ATL cell cultures , which suggest that this receptor has oncogenic activity in this tumor type.
A remarkable problem in molecular neurobiology is how an ORN activates one of a large family of odor receptor genes, while simultaneously repressing all the others. The maxillary palp is populated by three types of sensilla, pb1, pb2, and pb3, each of which contains ORNs of two classes . These six ORN classes each express a single Or gene, except that pb2A coexpresses two Or genes  .
The low density lipoprotein receptor  related protein 1  is a large endocytic receptor that belongs to the LDLR family. In a previous report, we showed that knockdown of LRP1 expression in human smooth muscle cells by siRNA resulted in significantly decreased cell migration . Collectively, these results suggest that altered LRP1 expression could influence the pathogenesis of several human diseases.
To achieve satisfactory performance, most ligand docking approaches typically require high resolution structural information on a potential target receptor, preferably in the ligand bound conformational state . Another study carried out for 8 protein targets shows considerable deterioration in CDocker’s  performance from 39% for native receptor structures to 26% for non native conformations . In the absence of experimentally determined structures, homology modeling provides receptor models with an accuracy related to the level of sequence identity to the template protein  .
NRs constitute a large superfamily of transcriptional regulators involved in a vast array of diverse physiological functions such as reproduction, control of embryonic development, regulation of cell differentiation, and homeostasis  . Since the cloning of the glucocorticoid receptor in 1985 , new members have been constantly added to the NR superfamily with the various sequencing and annotation projects, providing valuable information on transcriptional regulation and evolution of the animal kingdom . The recent use of multiple biochemical and phylogenetic analyses has shown that modern NRs evolved through subtle tinkering of an ancestral ligand dependent receptor related to HNF4 .
Type 1 diabetes  is an autoimmune disease characterized by immunocyte infiltration of the pancreatic islets  and destruction of the insulin secreting β cells. Diabetes in BB rats is polygenic . The MHC  contributes the largest genetic risk as it does in humans and in the NOD mouse.
The electrostatic interaction is crucial for the structural, functional, and dynamic properties of biomolecules. Since biomolecules are surrounded by solvent molecules, the solvent effect must be taken into account in modeling the electrostatics interaction. This challenge becomes more difficult when incorporating the PBE in a typical dynamics simulation involving millions of time steps.
Cigarette smoke has been reported to contain well over 4000 chemicals, at least 81 of which have been classified as carcinogens by the International Agency for Research on Cancer , including the known carcinogens 4  1  1 butanone , which is present in cigarettes at a range of concentrations up to 500 ng per cigarette , and benzopyrene P), which is present in the range of 3.36 to 40 ng per cigarette . Several studies have examined cigarette smoke condensates and shown mutagenic activity in the TA98 Salmonella reverse mutation assay . Previous mutagenesis work by another group indicated that 3MI was not mutagenic in a TA100 Salmonella reverse mutation assay using rat liver S9 .
The incidence of abdominal aortic aneurysm  is on the increase with approximately 150,000 new cases diagnosed in the US each year . Although the mortality rates associated with AAA are high, there still remains uncertainty about the correct time to surgically repair these aneurysms. However, recent research has questioned the effectiveness of this method  as it has been reported that smaller AAAs can rupture  and also larger AAAs may remain stable for the rest of the patients life .
There is an increasing appreciation of the essential roles of lipids in cellular metabolism and signaling that has replaced the notion that lipids only function as an energy reservoir or structural components for cells. Lipids adjust membrane fluidity, support diverse cellular processes and furnish the physical properties required for rapid membrane fission and fusion during vesicular transport between compartments of the exocytic and endocytic pathways. The rapid dynamic adds to the complexity of lipid metabolism.
hMATE1 , encoded by SLC47A1, is a newly identified organic cation/H+ exchanger expressed in the apical membrane of renal tubule cells and the canalicular membrane of hepatocytes. hMATE1 has been shown to mediate the cellular uptake of structurally diverse small molecular weight organic cations such as tetraethylammonium , N methylpyridinium, metformin, paraquat and oxaliplatin. hMATE2 K , the paralog of hMATE1, is specifically expressed in the kidney and interacts with various organic cations with a substrate specificity overlapping that of hMATE1.
It has not been determined if the differences in temporal activation of the Mos mRNA in Xenopus and mammals reflects distinct 3′ UTR regulatory element composition or if Xenopus and mammalian oocytes exert differential temporal regulation of the same mRNA translational control pathway . Meiotic cell cycle progression has been best characterized in Xenopus, where the cytoplasmic polyadenylation and translational activation of select maternal mRNAs occur in a strict temporal order . CPE sequences have been shown to repress mRNA translation in immature oocytes and to direct late class mRNA cytoplasmic polyadenylation and translational activation in maturing oocytes.
HSV 2 is the major cause of genital herpes, one of the most common sexually transmitted infections worldwide and a significant risk factor of HIV acquisition . In the US, 17% of people are seropositive for HSV 2 and 58% are seropositive for HSV 1 . Elsewhere, the seroprevalence rate is much higher, reaching 95% in some populations of HIV infected persons and female sex workers .
ERG recordings are used widely in the clinical evaluation of human retinal disorders  and in animal models expressing mutations that result in retinal abnormalities . However, although the rod pathway is very similar in rodent and primate retinas , there are distinct differences in cone signal processing. For example, the rodent cone flicker ERG exhibits low temporal resolution  compared to the cone flicker ERG response of monkey  and human  .
The “transfusion trigger” or minimal hematocrit  or Hb level at which transfusion is required is a subject of controversy. In some situations the concept of a set “transfusion trigger” has been replaced by a functional parameter monitoring for inadequate tissue O2 delivery on a case by case basis. On the other hand, it is recommended by the American Society of Anesthesiologists that erythrocytes be administered when the Hb concentration is less than 6 g/dL in young patients  .
Certain recombinant viral vectors take advantage of the evolutionary ability of viruses to efficiently insert DNA cargo into cells, but pose challenges with limited cargo size, difficulty in manufacturing, and safety concerning immunogenicity and tumorigenicity.,  Non viral delivery vehicles have been developed to address these limitations. Cationic polymers such as poly  and poly  are such non viral vectors that exhibit significant advantages in manufacture, cargo capacity, and biocompatibility. Past studies have shown that PBAE nanoparticles can overcome critical barriers to gene delivery, which include cellular uptake across the cell membrane, endosomal escape via the “proton sponge” effect, and cytosolic plasmid release.
In endothelial cells, OxLDL signals mainly via the lectin like oxidized low density lipoprotein receptor 1  , and activates diverse cellular second messengers, including NF κB and AP 1, two oxidative stress responsive transcription factors important in the regulation of cytokines, chemokines, and adhesion molecules. Furthermore, while OxLDL is a product of chronic oxidative stress, it can also exert pro oxidant effects by inducing ROS generation by the NADPH oxidases   . Of note, AOPPs induce endothelial dysfunction via NF κB  and are implicated in atherosclerosis.
By the end of 2007, the number of people living with HIV  in China was estimated to be 700,000 . Of newly reported cases of HIV, 37.9% were thought to be transmitted through unprotected heterosexual contact and 29.4% through needle sharing behaviours among injection drug users ., Between 1996 and 2004, the national prevalence of HIV rose from 0.02% to 0.93% among female sex workers  and from 1.95% to 6.48% among IDUs. Public health efforts are now primarily concerned with preventing the secondary transmission of HIV from these core groups to the general population.
A biochemical coagulopathy is part of the clinical spectrum of sickle cell anemia . These abnormalities persist in “steady state” between acute events, and they are accentuated during acute vasooclusive crisis . We previously examined transgenic sickle mice  for expression of tissue factor  by the vascular endothelium.
In physical activity clinical trials, there are a number of considerations when measuring an outcome, such as study goals, participant burden, project budget and accuracy/precision . Given the variability in different measures, and that one technique cannot measure all aspects of physical activity in free living situations, complementary methods of measurement have been recommended . It also is important to demonstrate the validity of accelerometry and different methods in intervention trials  .
Breast cancer occurrence is linked to E2 exposure, and approximately 75% of breast tumors express ERs . Acting through ERs, E2 regulates transcription of responsive genes, some of which control cell proliferation and apoptosis . ER mediated transcription can be inhibited by anti estrogens, which suppress ER activity and cell proliferation.
Vision plays an important role in the ability of people to process information from their environment and to participate in many everyday activities such as reading, working at home or in the office, walking, driving, and interacting with others. People with visual impairment may face challenges completing these activities, which in some cases may lead to depression, social isolation, and difficulties at home, in school, or at work. We previously reported on significant associations between visual impairment, including visual acuity and visual field loss, and health related quality of Life  in the Los Angeles Latino Eye Study , a population based study of adults.
Outcome prediction of patients who are in a locked in state is challenging. Extensive pontine infarction on diffusion weighted imaging MRI  has been proposed as a poor prognosticator. We report on three patients with a locked in state with unexpected favorable recoveries despite DWI evidence of widespread pontine ischemia .
In human studies, research has clearly demonstrated a link between alcohol consumption and stress with those individuals that experience higher levels of stress exhibiting higher levels of alcohol consumption . Disruptions in HPA axis function are believed to influence alcohol self administration , and alcohol itself increases brain levels of CRH and plasma levels of CORT , thereby activating the HPA axis. Considering that exposure to various stressors as well as ethanol self administration have been shown to increase concentrations of ALLO in a time  and sex dependent manner , further exploration of the relationship between stress induced alterations in ALLO and CORT during ethanol consumption is warranted .
